Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
All of the members of this group are from the Kochkor village. This village is located in the Kochkor valley, which is small valley high up in the mountains, where the winters are at times very severe, and the weather is windy almost all-year-around. The citizens of this region are mainly involved in animal husbandry. Amangul Kalmambetova is the leader of this group. She is forty-six years old. Her husband is a member of a farm collective. Amangul and her husband are raising seven children: six daughters and one son. Two oldest daughters are already married. Third daughter works as a waitress in Bishkek. Two next ones attend tenth and eleventh grades respectively. The youngest daughter also goes to school. She is in the second grade, and the son is at home for now. He is not of school age yet. It was not easy to support a family like this one, and Amangul’s husband has put all his strengths for years to provide for the family. Amangul decided to help her husband five years ago, and, taking her condition into the consideration, she found the most optimal solution. She decided to start sewing traditional goods. Also, the daughters have grown up by that time and could help their mother. Amangul invested three thousand som into the purchase of fabrics and supplies and began sewing the goods. Her profit gradually rose, and now, after five years, it is now six thousand som. Amangul and her husband married off their daughters and built a house during that time. Amangul looks to the future with much enthusiasm because she sees big opportunities in her business. She now needs a loan in order to purchase materials for making comforters “juurkan.” She needs twelve meters of atlas and twelve meters of satin fabrics. In the near future, Amangul plans to marry off her middle daughter, prepare dowries for two other daughters and expand the business by hiring new workers. Amangul has three partners: Asyl Duysheeva is forty-five years old. She is a mother of five children. Her husband is a member of a farm collective. Asyl makes “shirdaki,” which are wool rugs. She needs a loan in order to purchase materials for sewing. Tilekmat S. is fifty-one years old. He is a farmer. He has three sons, and the youngest son helps him take care of livestock. Tilekmat needs a loan to buy five sheep. Kyyal A. is thirty-one years old. Her husband is involved in animal husbandry. Kyyal has two children. She makes traditional wool rugs and dowries for young women. Kyyal needs a loan to purchase materials.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials for making comforters

loans.name: Myrzakmatova Gulnara's Group

texts.ru:
Мырзакматовой Гульнаре 54 года. Она вдова и мать одиночка. Ее дочери 20 лет и учится на третьем курсе медицинского училища. Сама клиентка с 1994 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. В данное время у нее имеются 2 головы КРС и 8 голов МРС. Кредит запрашивается для закупа 3 овец для последующего откорма. Также у нее имеется земельный надел, где она выращивает кукурузу и пшеницу. Большая часть времени она тратит на подготовку к весеннему посеву. 

Нургул 34 года. У нее есть единственная 7 летняя дочь, которая учится в 1 классе сельской школы. Основным ее источником дохода является полеводство. Она выращивает рис и подсолнух. Кредит будет использован для подготовки земли к посеву, а именно для закупа солярки и селитры для обогащения земельного надела. В этом году она собирается посеять рис. 

Розе 42 года. Она замужем и воспитывает двоих сыновей. Оба учатся в школе. Ее супруг работает строителем по Узгенскому району. Они как и большинство населения Узгена выращивают рис. В собственности у нее есть более 40 соток земли.  Кредит будет использован для закупа семян. 

Курманбек является  единственным мужчиной в этой группе солидарности. Он женат и воспитывает 4 детей, все девочки от 4 до 13 лет. Его супруга работает в селе уборщицей, а также в сезонные месяцы ездит на заработки в Россию. Семья клиента занимается полеводством, а именно выращиванием риса, подсолнуха и ячменя. На этот раз на 25 соток земли он собирается посеять рис, а на 70 соток ячмень. Кредит будет использован на этот посев. В перспективе он хочет заняться и животноводством. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.


If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Gulnara M. is 54 years old. She is a widow and a single mother. Her daughter is 20 years old and she is studying in medical school in her third year. Gulnara does animal husbandry and farming since 1994. At this time she has two heads of large cattle and eight heads of small cattle. She is asking for a loan to buy three sheep for feeding. She also has a plot of land where she grows corn and wheat. She spends most of her time preparing for the spring sowing season. Nurgul is 34 years old. She has an only daughter who is seven years old, she is studying in the first grade at the local school. Nurgul's main source of income is farming. She grows rice and sunflowers. She will use the loan to prepare the soil for sowing specifically by buying diesel fuel and saltpeter for enrichment of the soil in her allotment. This year she plans to sow rice. Roza is 42 years old. She is married and raising two sons. They both go to school. Her husband works as a construction worker in the Uzgen region. They grow rice as does most of the population of Uzgen. She owns more than 40 sotok (around 1 acre) of land. She will use the loan to buy seeds. Kurmanbek is the only man in this solidarity group. He is married and raises four children, all of them are girls from four to thirteen years of age. His wife works in the village as a cleaner and also travels to Russia during seasonal months for work. His family does farming and mainly grow rice, sunflower and barley. This time he plans to sow rice on his 25 sotok ( 0.6 acres) and barley on the 70 sotok (1.7 acres). He will use the loan for the sowing. He plans to do animal husbandry in the future.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 3 sheep and seeds to sow rice

loans.name: Gradus

texts.en:
Gradus O. O. is 38 years old, married and has one child. His business is located at a garage in Kariobangi, Nairobi and is well known by the name "Goodwill Trade". He sells vehicle paints to the mechanics at the garage and to his loyal customers, who are mostly from Kariobangi. He has been running this business for seven years and has two employees. He says that his business is profitable and that his main challenge is financial constraints and, therefore, reduced stock levels. Also, there are other similar businesses in the area so customers are not loyal as they are spoilt
 for choice. However, he works very hard to make sure his business continues to do well. 

He is using his loan of Kes 80,000 to buy more vehicle paints to serve a larger clientele and, thus, increase his profit margin. In the future he wants to be a distributor of paints. He is very hardworking, intelligent and focused.

loans.use: to buy stock of vehicle paints

loans.name: Mairamkul's Group

texts.ru:
Жизненные испытания, которые посылает судьба, постепенно закаляют человека и позволяют ему смотреть на жизнь с трезвым взглядом. Благодаря им, человек не ждёт подарков от судьбы, а сам начинает ковать своё счастье. Джумагулова  Майрамкул – лидер данной группы. Она вместе с семьёй проживает в г. Токмок. Майрамкул сорок шесть лет. Она вырастила троих детей и вполне выполнила свой родительский долг. Дети уже выросли. Две дочери уже замужем и живут отдельно. Сын Майрамкул пока ещё не работает. Что касается мужа, то он в данное время работает строителем. Последние годы Майрамкул работала в местной организации по производству национальных напитков и молочных продуктов, которое носит название “Максым”. Ровно год тому назад, Майрамкул начала думать о дополнительном источнике заработка. Тем более, график работы в “Максыме” позволял ей это. Она обратилась в “Мол Булак Финанс” за кредитом, и получив его начала торговать овощами на местном рынке. Чтобы начать торговлю Майрамкул понадобилось всего тысяча сомов. А теперь  от продажи овощей на рынке, она имеет полтора тысячи сомов ежемесячно. Майрамкул и на этот раз надеется, что сможет получить кредит. Она планирует увеличить ассортимент овощей для увеличения дохода, чтобы летом сделать ремонт дома. Подготовка к ремонту началась давно, и по этой причине, Майрамкул искренне верит, что у неё всё получится. 

У Майрамкул четыре партнёра по группе:

Исмаилову Нурбеку двадцать шесть лет. Он холост и работает охранником, в г. Токмок в ОсОО РАФА на фабрике по обработке шерсти. Из – за маленькой зарплаты, Нурбек уже на протяжении семи лет занимается перепродажей скота. Он надеется получить кредит и купить и закупить скот. 

Мадалиеву Рустаму тридцать один год. Он разведён, однако помогает жене и дочери. Рустам работает охранником на фабрике, и параллельно разводит цыплят. Он надеется получить кредит и закупить цыплят. 

Ивановой Ольге двадцать четыре года. Она замужем и имеет дочь. Чтобы помочь мужу прокормить семью, Ольга на дому начала шить платья и сдавать на продажу. Прибыль небольшая однако позволяет Ольге покрывать мелкие нужды. Ольге нужен кредит, чтобы купить курей.

Мадалиевой Мауджуде пятьдесят три года. Она разведена и является матерью двоих детей. Сын живёт отдельно, а дочь живёт вместе с Мауджудой. Мауджуда работает в киоске: продаёт газеты. Она надеется получить кредит, чтобы закупить товары для киоска.

--- WhereDidThisLoanComeFrom? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Life trials that fate sends us gradually strengthen a person and allow him to have a sober look at life. Thanks for these experiences, a person does not expect gifts from fate, but instead starts making his own happiness. Mairamkul D. is forty-six years old. She raised three children and fulfilled her parental obligation. The children are already grown. Two daughters are already married and live separately. Mairamkul’s son does not yet work. Her husband currently works as construction worker. Mairamkul spent the last few years working at a local national drinks and milk manufacturing company, called “Maksym.” Exactly one year ago, she started thinking about a supplemental source of income. Besides, her work schedule at “Maksym” allowed for it. She obtained a loan from “Mol Bulak Finance” and started selling vegetables at the local market. Mairamkul needed only one thousand som in order to start her retail business. And now she receives one and a half thousand som per month from the sales of vegetables. She hopes that she will obtain a loan this time. Mairamkul plans to expand the variety of vegetables in order to increase her income and repair her house in the summer. The preparations for the repairs started a long time ago, and this is why Mairamkul sincerely believes that everything will work out. Mairamkul has four partners in this group: Nurbek I. is twenty-six years old. He is single and works as a security guard at the yarn processing factory in Tokmak. Due to his low salary, Nurbek has been involved in livestock sales for seven years. He hopes to obtain a loan and buy livestock. Rustam M. is thirty-one years old. He is divorced, but helps his ex-wife and daughter. Rustam works as a security guard at a factory and also breeds chickens. He hopes to obtain a loan and buy chickens. Olga I. is twenty-four years old. She is married and has a daughter. To help her husband support the family, Olga began sewing dresses at home and selling them. The profit is small, but allows her to cover minor expenses. Olga needs a loan to buy chickens. Maudjuda M. is fifty-three years old. She is divorced and is a mother of two children. Her son lives separately, and the daughter lives with Maudjuda. Maudjuda works at a news stand and sells newspapers. She hopes to obtain a loan to purchase goods for her stand.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand the variety of vegetables in order to increase income and repair house

loans.name: Fummilayo

texts.en:
Fummilayo sells crates of eggs to make a living. She loves this business because it is highly profitable. She is doing well in her business and she hopes to expand it in the future. She has a good relationship with LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) and is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. 

She is married to a civil servant and they have 3 children. She is 40 years old and lives in Oyo state, Nigeria. Fummilayo is requesting a loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more crates of eggs to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of eggs to sell

loans.name: Kagiatu

texts.en:
Kagiatu G. is 48 years old. She is married and has three boys and two girls all of whom are currently at school. She has been in business for 15 years. Through hard work and dedication her business has thrived.

Kagiatu G. has obtained loans four times from LAPO, Sierra Leone. With profit from her last loan, she opened a savings account. With this loan, she will purchase more gallons of palm oil and bags of garri (tapioca) for sale. Her desire to be a major distributor in Freetown has led her to pursue this expansion of her business.

loans.use: To purchase palm oil and garri (tapioca) for sale

loans.name: Five Sisters Group

texts.en:
Cecelia M. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Five Sisters. She is 38 years old, single and has two children who are 9 and 15 years old. She was only able to attend school through high school.

For 13 years, Cecelia has been selling dry meat at the Red Light market, which is the largest market in Liberia. She sells good quality dry meat in a friendly manner which keeps customers returning. 
 
Cecelia plans to use her portion of 12,000 Liberian dollars of this 36,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more dry meat. Her goal is to expand her business and to improve her family's living standards.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Cecelia is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more dry meat

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is a 33-year-old man who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon. He has owned a grocery store for 10 years now. He sells canned food, candies, drinks, home cleaning products, etc. A feature of Haydar's work is that he offers competitive prices. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

When Haydar first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on setting up his business because he wanted to have independent work, as well as gaining experience. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Mirzodjon

texts.ru: Кабутов Мирзоджон проживает в районе Вахш. Возраст, 46 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Мирзоджон не имеет высшего образования. Работает в своей мастерской. Он в основном занимается ремонтом автомашин. В этой области имеет большой опыт. Кредит берет для покупки инструментов, чтобы предоставить качественную услугу.
texts.en:
Mirzodjon K. lives in the Vakhsh district. He is 46 years old, married and has 3 children. Mirzodjon does not have a higher education. He works at his own repair shop and primarily repairs cars. He has a lot of experience in this field. Mirzodjon is requesting this loan for the purchase of tools in order to provide quality service.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tools

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en:
Taiwo A. is 35 years old, married with three children. Her husband is a businessman and he also supports their home. Her eldest child is seven years old and her children attend school. She sells bags of garri (cassava flakes) in her town to make a living. Garri comes from cassava and can be eaten with soup. Most Nigerians love garri because it is a staple food in Nigeria. She has been in this business for a long time.

Taiwo is requesting a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more bags of garri to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of garri (cassava flakes) to sell

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 25-year-old man who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon, with his wife. He has owned a grocery store since 2005. He sells canned food, candies, drinks, eggs, bread, etc. A feature of Mouhamad's work is that he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors.

He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that Mouhamad has requested a loan. When he first started his business, he dealt with some financial issues, as well as having to face the competition. He decided on setting up his business because he wanted to have independent work, as well as gaining experience. In the future, he plans to expand his business by opening a second grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Nahida

texts.en:
Nahida is a 31-year-old woman who lives in the Bekaa with her husband and their two children. She has owned a shop since 2007. She sells toys for children, dishes, home cleaning products, groceries and many other things. When she first started her business, she wasn’t able to offer a large quantity of merchandise, therefore she decided to have various kinds of merchandise and offer all she could to her clients. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and tourists.

She decided to open her shop because she always wanted to have work of her own and to be self-reliant. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new merchandise for her store. This is the first time she has requested a loan. She plans to keep on improving her store to attract more clients and to expand it by making it a grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase new merchandise for her store

loans.name: Nusura

texts.en:
Nusura S. is currently in the business of selling bread and cooked beef in a restaurant, She is requesting a loan to buy stock of rice, beans, bags of maize flour, etc. to be cooked in the restaurant. Nusura is 40 years old and is married with a husband who is a businessman. She has three children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot and build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy stock of rice, beans, maize flour, etc. to be cooked in the restaurant

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 35-year-old married father of two children who attend school. He has been dealing in timber for seven years. He sells poles and posts to contractors and builders. Peter was previously in the hawking business before he ventured into this business. He is also employed as a caretaker in a residential place to earn extra income.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has acquired business ideas and has also learnt to keep proper records for his business. He hopes to build his family a house and expand his business to create employment in future. He has requested a loan of kes 20,000 to add to his stock. He describes himself as a humble man who is good at dealing with his clients.

loans.use: To add to his stock of poles and posts

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 44-year-old woman who lives in the Bekaa. She has been selling children's clothes since 2007. She sells dresses, shirts and sweaters; she also sells slippers, etc. She requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her shop since the new spring and summer collection has arrived. This is the first time that she has requested a loan.

A feature of Mariam's work is that she knows how to treat her clients and they feel comfortable purchasing from her. Her clients are mainly her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she had no difficulty since she had a large network and people knew her well. Mariam decided to set up her business because she wanted to improve her financiA. situation; she is a very active woman who does her best to improve her income and provide the best for her family. Therefore, she decided to have independent work. In the future, she plans to keep up the good work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane P.  is currently in the business of selling used clothes at the market and is requesting a loan to buy first class clothes and bedsheet stock to sell. Jane is 26 years old and is married with a husband who is a policeman. She has four children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy first class clothes and bedsheet stock to sell

loans.name: Latifat

texts.en: Latifat E. is a happy and hard working woman. She sells maize at wholesale and retail prices to her customers. Her customers are usually residents and friends. The demands for her maize are high in her community because maize can be used to cook various mouth-watering Nigerian foods. She hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more maize to sell. She is married with 4 children and her children are doing well at school. She is 37 years old and her husband also works to support their household. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more maize to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 28-year-old married man who supplies eggs while his wife is a tailor.  He has been supplying eggs for six years.  He also operates a retail shop where he earns extra income. He has been an active member of Faulu Kenya and he has previously bought a motorbike after getting a loan of KES 50,000. He also appreciates that his business has grown through Faulu Kenya. He has requested a loan of KES 60,000 to increase his business stock. He hopes to be a dependable farmer who can supply eggs to the whole country. He describes himself as a hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy more stock of eggs.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Foaad

texts.en: Foaad is a 40-year-old man who lives in Bekaa with his wife and their six children. Foaad has owned a grocery store since 1998. He sells canned food, beverages, candies, pasta, rice, oil, chewing gum, cakes and lots more. His clients are his friends and neighbors, as well as passers-by. Foaad is a very welcoming person and each time he receives a client, he likes taking time and chatting with him. He requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase new merchandise for his store so that he can expand his stock. This is the first time that Foaad has requested a loan from A. Majmoua. When he first started his business, he didn’t face any difficulties. Foaad decided to go into his business because he wanted to provide the best for his family. His store is well located and allows him to improve his family’s financiA. situation, but more importantly he likes trading and likes his work. In the future, he plans to keep on expanding his work.

loans.use: To purchase new merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Farogat

texts.ru: Абдувосиева Фарогат проживает в городе Курган- Тюбе. Возраст, 39 лет. Замужем, не имеет детей. У нее среднее образование. Более 7 лет занимается торговлей. Она продает каляски, игрушки, машинки и другие детские вещи. На полученный кредит хочет заказать новые, качественные каляски. На будущее планирует открыть собственный магазин.
texts.en:
Farogat A. lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. She is 39 years old, married and has no children. She has a secondary education and has been involved in retail sales for over 7 years. Farogat sells baby strollers, toys, toy cars and other children's goods. She wants to use this loan to order new, quality baby strollers. In the future, she plans to open her own store.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new baby strollers

loans.name: Aaida

texts.en:
Aaida is a 45-year-old woman who lives in the Bekaa. Aaida has been working as a sewer since 2005. She repairs and sews all types of clothes. She requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase a new and more sophisticated sewing machine and thread for her business. This is the first time that she has requested a loan.

Aaida is speciA. in her work because she is known for her good quality and punctuality in repairing clothes. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t have any difficulty since she used to work from her house and already had clients. Aaida decided to go into her business because she likes it and has lots of experience. In the future, she plans to keep on improving her financiA. situation.

loans.use: To purchase a new and more sophisticated sewing machine and thread for her business.

loans.name: Angua

texts.en:
Angua S. is currently in the business of selling groundnut phase at the market and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of groundnut to make phase to sell. Angua is 23 years old and is married with a husband that is a teacher. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy three plots for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of groundnut to make phase to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 40-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their eight children. Ali has been selling fruits and vegetables for two years now. He sells iceberg lettuce, tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers, radishes, potatoes, apples, oranges and more, depending on the season. He is speciA. in his work because his clients feel comfortable buying from him since he sells good quality merchandise. His clients are friends, neighbors and people from his region. He decided to open his shop because it was well-located; it is demanding work. He requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase fruits and vegetables. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

In the future, he plans to keep on improving his work by diversifying his merchandise and to start offering more exotic fruits, depending on the season.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Oneness Group

texts.en:
For three years, Deddeh G. has been selling food such as oil, beans and eggs at the Red Light Market, which is the largest market in Liberia. She sells her products at reasonable prices which keeps customers coming back. She is 38 years old, married, and has four children who range in age from 7 to 19 years old. In addition to her children, Deddeh supports three of her relatives. 

Deddeh plans to use her 30,000 Liberian dollar (LRD) portion of this 100,000 LRD group loan to buy more food for her business. Her goal is to send all of her children to school.

Deddeh is the leader of this group of five borrowers called "Oneness". In the photo that accompanies this profile, Deddeh is the person in the middle.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, this non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more goods such as oil, beans and eggs

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine D. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes, phase and onions and is requesting a loan to buy more bags of onions to sell. Christine is 28 years old and is widowed. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more bags of onions to sell.

loans.name: Youima

texts.en:
Youima L. is currently in the business of selling various items in the shop like cooking oil, biscuits, etc and is requesting a loan to buy bags of rice, beans, salt, sugar, etc., to sell. Youima is 45 years old and is divorced. She has 7 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a book shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, beans, salt, sugar, etc to sell.

loans.name: Jemilat

texts.en:
Jemilat is 40 years old, married to a teacher and has four children. She has been a member of LAPO microfinance for over three years now with a good repayment record.

Jemilat sells groceries to make a living in Lagos state and has been managing it for some years now. She is focused on making sure she meets the demand of her customers, which she said will also lead to increases in profits for her. Jemilat sees herself as a partner to her husband. She supports her husband in meeting the family financial needs.

Jemilat is asking for a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more groceries in bulk as this will enable her get a better discount and maximize profits. She expresses her gratitude to all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en: Hanna is a responsible, affectionate and hard working person. She wants to improve the quality of life for herself and her family. She is married with 3 children and she is 45 years old. Her children are doing well in school and this makes her happy. She fries and sells bons to her customers. Bons is made from flour, baking powder, sugar and cooking oil and is fried. School children love her bons so much and they patronize her business. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more bags of flour and cooking oil to fry more bons to sell. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of flour and cooking oil to fry more bons to sell.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna S. is currently in the business of selling various foods in a restaurant like beans, rice, beef, etc., and is requesting a loan to stock crates of beer and soda to sell. Anna is 25 years old and is married with a husband that is a driver. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

Anna S. is the one in front and is seated in the white plastic chair.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy crates of beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Doki

texts.en:
Doki V. is currently in the business of selling bags of sugar and salt in a wholesale shop and is requesting a loan to stock boxes of soap and crates of beer and soda to sell. Doki is 42 years old and is married with a husband that is a business man. She has six children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build department stores.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy boxes of soap and crates of beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina S. is currently in the business of selling beer at home and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell. Paulina is 29 years old and is married with a husband that is a teacher. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a bar at the market.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer to sell.

loans.name: Bola

texts.en:
Bola is 42 years old, married and has five children. She owns a shop; she makes and sells beads and accessories. She said bead-making gives her joy as this gives room for creativity. She makes different designs and these attract more customers to her shop.
 
Beads are used to beautify oneself for any kind of occasions; it is also use to dress a bride for a wedding ceremony. Due to her high patronage, Bola wants to expand and improve on her business.

Bola is requesting a loan amount of NGN 150, 000 to purchase more beads and accessories to sell. She hopes to support her husband in educating her children. She appreciates all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more beads and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Luz De Madre Group

texts.en:
Altagracia is the coordinator of her group, Luz De Madre (Light of Mother), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Los Alcarrizzos, a dusty industrial town north of the Capital, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children.

Altagracia is excited to be taking out her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a beauty salon by purchasing deodorants, hair products, diapers and jewellery to sell in her salon. She will use the profits to invest in her children by saving towards sending them to university. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy deodorants, hair products, diapers and jewellery to sell.

loans.name: Constancio

texts.es:
EL SEÑOR CONSTANCIO, ES SOLTERO, INGRESO A LA INTITUCION CON EL GRUPO SOLIDARIO UNION LA PORTADA HACE CUATRO AÑOS SIENDO UN CLIENTE EJEMPLAR EN SUS PAGOS, Y POR MOTIVO DE VIAJE SE RETIRO DEL GRUPO, ACTUALMENTE YA TRABAJA MAS DE CUATRO CREDITOS COMO INDIVIDUAL, DEMOSTRANDO BUEN COMPORTAMIENTO. ES SELECCIONADO PARA EL PROGRAMA KIVA POR SER UN CLIENTE RESPONSABLE  Y TRABAJADOR, TAMBIEN ES EL UNICO QUE SE HACE CARGO DE SU FAMILIA YA QUE APOYA CON EL APORTE ECONOMICO A SU MAMA Y SUS SOBRINOS QUE SON HUERFANOS YA QUE SUS PADRES FALLECIERON EN UN ACCIDENTE, Y EL SE HIZO CARGO CON LOS GASTOS DE MANUTENCION Y EDUCACION DE SUS SOBRINOS. SU ACTIVIDAD ES LA REPARACION DE MOVILIDADES Y CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA AL MAYOR DE REPUESTOS Y HERRAMIENTAS PARA LA REPARACION DE LAS MOVILIDADES A SU CARGO.

ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO COM EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACIO DLE CREDITO.
texts.en:
Constancio is single. He joined the institution with the La Portada Communal Bank four years ago. He is an exemplary client with his payments. Due to travel, he left the group. He currently has worked for over four years as an individual. He demonstrates good behavior. He was chosen for the Kiva program for being a responsible and hard-working client. Also, he is the only one taking care of his family. He supports his mother and his two nephews who were orphaned when their parents died in an accident. He supports them and pays his nephews’ educational expenses. He repairs vehicles. He will use the money from the loan to buy wholesale replacement parts and tools to repair vehicles. He is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in him by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale automobile replacement parts

loans.name: Olawuyi

texts.en: Olawuyi is a hardworking and honest man. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo state, Nigeria. He sells foodstuffs at retail prices to his customers. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He has been in this business for a long time. He uses his experience in business to attract and retain customers. He is married with 6 children and he is 58 years old. He is requesting a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. He hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Rebbecca

texts.en:
Rebbecca A. is currently in the business of selling clothes and bed sheets in her shop at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bed sheets and purchase a sewing machine. Rebbecca is 37 years old and is married with a husband who is a carpenter. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a market for her clothes.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more bed sheets to sell and purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Awadia

texts.en:
Awadia J. is currently in the business of selling bags of sugar, salt, etc., in her shop and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of sugar and rice to sell. Awadia is 28-years-old and is married with a husband that is a business man. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Manet Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento MANET es un banco que trabaja con nuestra Institución hace varios años, el banco se caracteriza principalmente por tener socias que se dedican al comercio y servicios.

El Sr. RENÉ es presidente, es chofer asalariado y con el prestamo tiene pensado ahorrar para poder comprarse una movilidad y pasar a ser propietario, ya que en un futuro esta pensando tener una familia y brindarles estabilidad económica. 

La Sra. ROSSY  Es una joven participante esta a su cargo la secretaria, se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza por catalogo, con el prestamo comprara perfumes, talcos y otros productos D. belleza D. promoción para despues poder vendrlos al precio original, lo que le a permitido ahorrar para continuar sus estudios D. farmacia y D. esta forma poder culminarlos. 

La Sra. MARIA Es una D. las socias fundadoras, es tesorera y se dedica a la atención D. su tienda, con el prestamo comprara varios productos para su tienda y D. esta manera diversificar sus productos, mejorando así sus ingresos.

Todas las socias son personas responsables y dinamicas que en muchos casos tienen que sacar a sus familias solas, estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Manet Communal Bank has been working with our Institution for a number of years. This Communal Bank is known primarily for having members who are engaged in the retail and service sectors.

Sr. René is the President and works as a salaried driver. With this loan, he plans to buy his own vehicle. For the future, he is thinking about having a family and providing them financial stability.

Sra. Rossy is a young member who holds the position of Secretary. She sells beauty products by catalog. With this loan, she will buy perfumes, talcum powders, and other products that are on sale which she will sell at regular price. This will allow her to save money so that she can continue her pharmacy studies and finish her degree.

Sra. Maria is the Treasurer and one of the founding members. She manages a store and will use her loan to buy various products so that she can diversify her inventory and improve her earnings.

All of the members are responsible and dynamic people who have to support their families, and in most cases, do it by themselves. They are very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for trusting them by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Nehmat

texts.en:
Nehmat is a 35-year-old married woman. A mother of one young child, she opened a small business to earn income to help met her family's needs in collaboration with her husband. In 2008, she opened a roastery in her town selling all types of nuts, coffee, sweets, etc., and her new job developed automatically.

Today, Nehmat requested to borrow $900 because she wants to buy additionA. merchandise for her shop to meet her clients’ demands and because she wants to keep up the level of services she offers to her clients.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise.

loans.name: Orfelinda Esther

texts.es:
Orfelinda es una madre de familia de 52 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a dos de sus seis hijos en el sector Licapa del distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace diez años tiene instalada en su vivienda una bodega en donde ofrece a sus clientes productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite), abarrotes, verduras y bebidas. Ella nos comenta que inició su negocio vendiendo bebidas gaseosas y que poco a poco fue haciéndolo crecer con su esfuerzo y dedicación.

El negocio goza de buena aceptación debido al buen trato que ofrece y a que pone al alcance de la mano de sus clientes productos de uso diario por los que tendrían que ir hasta el centro de la ciudad para adquirirlos, vale decir que la zona en donde vive queda alejada de la ciudad de Paiján.

Orfelinda desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más abarrotes y verduras, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Orfelinda es una mujer responsable, trabajadora y que gusta de colaborar con sus vecinos cuando se le pide ayuda. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Orfelina is 52 years old, and she lives with her husband and two of their six children. They live in the Licapa section of the Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region. It is located two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. For ten years she has had a convenience store set up in her home. She offers her customers basic needs products (rice, sugar, oil), groceries, vegetables, and drinks. She tells us that she started her business selling soft drinks. Little by little she made her business grow through her effort and dedication. The business is widely accepted by her customers because of the quality service provided. Also, she puts daily use products within her customers’ reach. Otherwise they would have to go to the center of the city to get the products, and the area where they live is far from the city of Paiján. Orfelinda wishes to expand her business by purchasing more groceries and vegetables. That is why she is requesting a loan for 1,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa. This will help her achieve her objective. Orfelina is a very responsible and hard-working woman who likes to work with her neighbors when they ask her for help. She has previously worked with our institution, and she has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries and vegetables to expand her business

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en:
Tenneh G. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called In God We Trust. She is 30 years old, single, and has two children who are 5 and 7 years old. She was only able to attend school through high school.

For five years, Tenneh has been selling dry fish and palm oil in the Stephen Tolbert Estate on the Somalia drive in Paynesville. She sells good products and has a friendly manner which keeps customers returning.

She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this group loan to buy more fish and oil.  Her goal is to grow her business to a shop and to live a better life.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Tenneh is holding a sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution, with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more fish and oil.

loans.name: Bummi

texts.en:
Bummi has a shop where she sells drinks and juice. She buys in bulk and sells at retail prices. She gets her goods directly from distributors as she is a large dealer and has been in this business for 10 years.

Bummi is 41 years old, and married with three children, who are all doing well in school. She has been able to provide good support for the family and wishes to do more.  Her husband sells planks that are used in roofing houses and making furniture. 

Bummi is requesting a loan of NGN 140,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en:
Khodor is a married man and has ten children, four of whom are working and the rest are still going to school. With his big family, Khodor needs to work hard to satisfy his family expenses. He has been working as a farmer, cultivating all sorts of vegetables according to the season. He has been involved in this occupation for the past twenty years. He cooperates with agriculturA. markets in his town to deliver his harvests.

Today, Khodor is asking to borrow $1,000 to buy farming supplies such as seeds and fertilizers to supply his business before the coming new season.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: It is well known in her community that Rebecca uses her grinding machine to grind foodstuffs for her customers. The demands for her grinding services are high and she wants to meet the needs of her customers. She hopes for a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase a grinding machine to enable her to fulfill her customers' requirements. She is married with five children and she is 40 years old. She has been in this business for the past seven years. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a grinding machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working capital for his money exchange business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pay for improvements to his farm

loans.name: Arelys Alicia

texts.es:
Arelys tiene 25 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de seis años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en el sector Licapa del distrito de Paiján, en la provincia de Ascope, región La Libertad, ubicada a a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a su menor hijo hizo que desde hace seis años empezara a trabajar como costurera, aprendió el oficio de su padre, que también se dedica a esta labor desde hace muchos años y con mucho esfuerzo pudo comprar una máquina de coser, actualmente tiene instalado un pequeño taller en su vivienda, donde atiende los pedidos que le solicitan sus clientes.

Arelys confecciona prendas nuevas y también repara las dañadas. Su negocio ha ido creciendo y ya está recibiendo pedidos de confección de uniformes escolares, ya que la temporada escolar ya empezó en todo el país. Por este motivo ella se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de hilos y telas para continuar con su trabajo.

Arelys es una mujer luchadora y que ha sabido salir adelante a pesar de las dificultades. Ella ha trabajado anteriormente con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Arelys, age 25, is a single mother. She has a six year old son, and she lives with her parents in the Licapa section of the Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region. It is located two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. Because of the need to get her minor son ahead, she started working as a seamstress six years ago. She learned this trade from her father, who has also done this work for many years. With a lot of effort she was able to buy a sewing machine. She currently has a small shop set up in her home. That is where she takes care of her customers’ orders. Arelys makes new clothes, and she repairs damaged clothes. Her business has been growing, and she is now receiving orders to make school uniforms. The school season has started everywhere in the country. That is why she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 2,000 PEN. She plans to use it to buy thread and fabric to continue with her work. Arelys is a tenacious woman who has known how to get ahead in spite of difficulties. She has previously worked with our institution, and she has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy thread and fabric to make school uniforms

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a hardworking, responsible and affectionate woman. She is married with five children. Her children are excelling in school. Esther is 4o years old. She sells lumber to make a living. She has been in this business for a long time and she uses her experience in business to attract and retain more customers. She hopes to be a major lumber distributor in the future. She hopes for a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more lumber to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more lumber to sell

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad has owned a photography studio in his town since 2007 and has ten years of experience in this field. He's 30 years old, married and has one baby. He sells photo frames and camera film in addition to providing printing services. He's very happy with his business and he's thankful for the profit he has made for his family during this period. 

Today, Mohamad is asking to borrow $900 to purchase more needed supplies and to perform maintenance for the photocopier machine to satisfy his customers’ needs.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is into rentals and catering services. She rents out canopies and chairs for various parties and also supplies drinks and food for such parties. She has been in the business for four years and started borrowing from LAPO two years ago. Her previous loan helped her meet the demands of customers, maximizing her profit, and her family needs are better met.

Elizabeth has finished repaying her previous loan and she is requesting a new loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase catering items in bulk at a cheaper price.

Elizabeth is 46 years old, married and has four lovely children. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and promises to repay on time.

loans.use: To purchase more catering items.

loans.name: Peaceful Business Group

texts.en:
Anna K. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Peaceful Business. She is 40 years old, married, and has three children who range from 15 to 20 years old.  She did not have the opportunity to go to school due to poverty.

For 15 years, Anna has been selling foodstuffs such as rice and onions at the Harbel Market. She says she provides good customer service which keeps customers returning. Anna plans to use her 4,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 20,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more rice and onions.  Her goal is to grow her business and to continue to educate her children and build them a house.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Anna is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with 13 branches acR. the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more rice and onions.

loans.name: Hajer

texts.en:
Hajer is a married woman and the mother of three unemployed children. In 2007, she decided to start selling clothes from her home after seeing a need for such services in the region. Over the years, she became well known in the whole region. That's how she and her husband are able to raise the three children. 

Today, Hajer is asking to borrow $1,200 to buy additional clothes in order to offer the new collections for the summer season. In the future Hajer plans to expand her business more and more by opening a clothes shop.

loans.use: To buy additional clothes to sell.

loans.name: Love One Another Group

texts.en:
Fatu D. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Love One Another.  She is 40 years old, married, and has three children who range from 8 to 14 years old.  She did not have the opportunity to go to school due to poverty.
For 15 years, Fatu has been selling lapas, a traditional West African fabric, and slippers at the Harbel Market. She sells the lapas and slippers in a friendly manner which keeps customers returning.  
Fatu plans to use her 4,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 20,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more lapas and slippers.  Her goal is to run her business well, to educate her children and purchase a land to build a house for the family.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Fatu is the one holding the sign. Fredee W. is inset at lower left.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more lapas and slippers.

loans.name: Everardo Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Everardo Antonio R. B., tiene 34 años vive en el Barrio de Palestina es acompañado y su mujer se dedicxa a los quehaceres domésticos ello tienen 3 hijos que actualmente estudian la escuela primaria, ellos se dedican desde hace 20 años a al agricultura.

Dentro de los principales probelmas que han enfrentado, ha sido la afectacion de las plagas, sze iniciaron en los trabajos de la cosecha de piña gracias a la reforma agraria y dentro de los planes a futuro esta la diversificacion en la simebra de tomate en una manzana de tierra, ella solicita de u prestamo para la ompra de fertilizantes que ataquen de inmediato el problema de las plagas que esta amanezando con la producción, espera se le apoye economicamente y de esta manera ayudarla a evolucionar y desarrollar nuevos proyectos que le permitan mejores condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Everardo Antonio R. B., age 34, lives in the Palestina neighborhood with his wife. She devotes herself to the household chores. They have three children who are currently in elementary school. They have been farming for 20 years. Pests are one of the main problems they have encountered. They started cultivating pineapples thanks to the agrarian reform. Among their future plans is diversification by planting tomatoes on one block of land. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, which will immediately attack the problem of the pests that are threatening the production. He hopes that he receives economic help, which will help him evolve and develop new projects. These will allow him to have better economic conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and farming supplies

loans.name: María Magna

texts.es:
María Magna tiene 35 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos en el sector Licapa del distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace un año a la comercialización de alfalfa (forraje utilizado para alimento de animales). Ella compra la alfalfa a los agricultores del lugar para luego vendersela a sus clientes en el mercado “El Hueco” de la ciudad de Paiján. Este negocio es de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia, ya que los ingresos que su esposo percibe como trabajador agrícola no son suficientes para soventar los gastos familiares. Por este motivo María Magna se esfuerza diariamente para sacar adelante a su negocio. 

Las lluvias que se presentaron en el norte del Perú hace algunas semanas hicieron daños en el techo de su vivienda, por ello María Magna se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de eternits para techar nuevamente su casa.

María Magna es una mujer bastante responsable y trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales exitosos en el futuro. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
María Magna is 35 years old, married, and lives with her husband and her 3 children in the Licapa sector of Paiján district, Ascope province, in the region of La Libertad. That is 2 1/2 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. For a year now she has sold alfalfa (used as forage for feeding animals). She buys alfalfa from regional farmers then sells it to her customers in the El Hueco Market in the city of Paiján. The business is very helpful with her family economy, since her husband's income as an agricultural worker is insufficient to meet family expenses. For this reason María Magna works hard every day to advance her business. The rains in the north of Peru during the last several weeks damaged the roof of their house. For that reason, María Magna found it necessary to approach Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,000 new sols to buy fiber/concrete roofing tiles to re-roof her house. María Magna is a very responsible and hard-working woman. Her greatest wish is to see her children become successful professionals in the future. She has worked in the past with our Institution and has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality in making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING FIBER/CONCRETE ROOFING TILES TO REPAIR THEIR RAIN-DAMAGED ROOF

loans.name: Key Of Prayer Group

texts.en:
Sallie K. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Key to Prayer. He is 35 years old, married, and has three children who range from 4 to 16 years old. He is a high school graduate.

For three years, Sallie has been selling rice at the Harbel Market. He sells the rice in a friendly manner which keeps customers returning.  Sallie plans to use his 7,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 29,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more rice. His goal is to grow his business and to continue to support his children in school so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Sallie is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Esmeralda Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento ESMERALDA es un banco que trabaja con nuestra Institución desD. el año 2007, este banco se caracteriza porque en todo este tiempo a conseguido consolidarse como grupo, la mayoria D. sus socias se dedica a la venta D. pan,anticuchos,café y algunas socias tienen tienda. 

La Sra ESTHER es una D. las fundadoras, tiene a su cargo la presidencia, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. pan, tiene una familia D. 4 miembros, con el prestamo a conseguido comprar por cantidad harina, azucar y levadura,lo que ha permitido que su producción se diversifique y aumente sus ganancias, mejorando su calidad D. vida.

La Sra. MIRNA Es una socia antigua, esta casada y tiene hijos pequeños, esta a cargo D. la secretaria, con el prestamo a comprado diferentes productos para su tienda, aprovechando que hay más ventas por las fiestas D. carnavales.

La Sra. MARIA es la tesorera del banco, ella tiene como principal actividad la atención D. una tienda D. barrio en su mismo domicilio, con el prestamo a comprado conservas, golosinas y galletas por cantidad, con este aumento en su capital mejorara sus ingresos D. ella y su familia.

Todas las socias son personas responsables, dinamicas y trabajadoras que en muchos casos mantienen solas el hogar y desean mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias, estan agradecidos con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.

OJO: En la fotografia esta el hijo D. una D. las socias.
texts.en:
The Esmeralda Communal Bank has been working with our Institution since 2007. In all the time it has managed to establish itself as a group, this Communal Bank has become known for its members who are primarily engaged in selling bread, skewered meats, coffee, or operating retail shops.

Sra. Esther is one of the founders and holds the position of President. She produces and sells bread. Esther has a family consisting of four members. With her loan she plans to buy flour, sugar, and yeast so that she can diversify her production and increase her earnings. As a result, she will be able to improve her quality of life.

Sra. Mirna is a long-time member who is married and has small children. She serves as the Secretary. With her loan she plans to buy different products for her store so that she can take advantage of the Carnival festivities to generate more sales.

Sra. Maria is the Treasurer of the Bank. Her principal business activity is managing a neighborhood store located in her home. With her loan she plans to buy canned goods, candy, and cookies in bulk so that she can increase her inventory and improve the income for herself and her family.

All of the members are responsible, dynamic, and hardworking people who support their families, and in most cases, must do so by themselves. They desire to improve the quality of life for their families and are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for trusting them by providing this loan.

NOTE: The son of one of the members also appears in the photograph.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en:
Toyin, a hardworking and honest woman, lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria, where she sells foodstuffs at retail prices. She loves this business, which she has been engaged in for many years, because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers, and uses her experience to both retain her clientele and attract more customers.

Toyin, a 35-year-old married mother of three children, is now requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell, hoping to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: David

texts.es:
El señor David vive en casa propia con su esposa e hijos en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja como empleado en la Alcaldía, lugar donde se le presentó la oportunidad de atender a los empleados con el almuerzo.

 El crédito que solicita es para comprar ollas, vajilla y otros materiales que le sirvan para la atención a sus clientes..

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2002. Por el buen historial de pagos David puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
David lives in his own home with his wife and children in the Pasankeri neighborhood of the city of La Paz. He is employed at the City Hall, where he was given the opportunity to serve the employees with lunch. The loan that he requests is to buy pots, dishes and other materials that will help him attend to his customers. He has been a client of IMPRO since 2002. Because of his good credit history David can access a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pots, dishes and other items to provide lunch service at the City Hall of La Paz

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
El sr. Ricardo se dedica al rubro del transporte, esta casado, tiene su movilidad con la que él trabaja y tiene una segunda movilidad que la trabaja un chofer; lleva más de 27 años con esta actividad, recientemente con tres amigos adquirió una empresa de radiotaxis, donde tienen como 30 móviles, y son conocidos en la ciudad por tener contratos con discotecas. Vive en su casita con su esposa y sus tres niños, pequeños todavía, y en unos meses más planea abrir una sucursal en otra zona; es un cliente muy responsable. El crédito que solicita ahora es para la compra de un motor para su movilidad.

Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sr. Ricardo is married and works in the transportation sector. He owns a vehicle from which he works and also has a second vehicle that is operated by another driver. Ricardo has 27 years of experience in this business. With three of his friends, he recently acquired a radio taxi business with a fleet of 30 vehicles. The business is already recognized within the city and has contracts with several nightclubs.

Ricardo owns a small house where he lives with his wife and three children, who are still quite young. Within a few months, he plans to open another branch in a different part of town. He is a very responsible client. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a new motor for his vehicle. He is extremely grateful to Emprender and Kiva for trusting him by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a motor for his vehicle

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
La señora Maria Dolores Z. es nacida en la ciudad de Managua tiene la ead de 37 años, es acompañada, su pareja trabaja como mecanico y le ayuda económicamente de forma eventual a los gastos del hogar, ella tiene 2 hijos de las edades de 16 y 11 años, los dos estudian actualmente pero la mayor despues de las clases, le ayuda a vender productos de belleza, ella se dedica a la venta ambulante de cosméticos, productos del hogar y loteria, tiene ya mas de 4 años que este ha sido su fuente de ingresos.

Ella comenzo vendiendo estos productos, gracias al apoyo de otros prestamos, ahora ella solicita de un nuevo credito para continuar invirtiendole a su negocio, en la compra de nuevos productos que le permitan aumentar el volumen es sus ventas y una mejor economia que favorezca a toda la familia.
texts.en:
Maria Dolores Z. was born in the city of Managua. She is 37 years old, and has a partner who works as a mechanic. She helps him on a casual basis with the household expenses. She has 2 school-aged children who are 16 and 11 years old. Both of them are currently in school, and the older one also helps her to sell beauty products after school. She is a street vendor who sells beauty products and lottery tickets, and this has been her source of income for over 4 years. She started selling these products thanks to the support of other loans. Now she requests a new loan to continue investing in her business, by purchasing new products that will allow her to increase her sales volume and improve the finances of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a greater inventory for her business

loans.name: Lizet

texts.es:
La señora Lizet vive con sus dos hijos en la zona de Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja como empleada en una empresa de costura. El crédito que solicita es para pagar la operación de su hijo menor el cual nació con labio leporino; debido a los constantes desmayos que tiene el pequeño es que necesita una operación urgente.

Este es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de Impro, pero por el carácter social puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Lizet lives with her 2 children in the Achachicala neighborhood of the city of La Paz. She works as an employee of a dressmaking business. The loan she requests is to pay for the operation of her youngest child, who was born with a cleft lip. Due to the frequent fainting spells that the young child experiences, the need for this operation is urgent. This is the first time that she has requested a loan from IMPRO, but because of her character, she is able to access the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the cost of a cleft lip operation for her son

loans.name: Felipa Sixtina

texts.es:
Felipa tiene 63 años D. edad, enviudó hace 29 años y tiene siente hijos, todos ya independizados. Vive junto a dos nietos en el sector Chuin del distrito D. Paiján, provincia D. Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a dos horas y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

DesD. hace dos años posee un pequeño negocio D. venta D. abarrotes y menestras en su vivienda, ella nos comenta que el negocio empezó debido a la demanda D. algunos productos D. primera necesidad por parte D. sus vecinos, ya que estos no podian adquirirlos facilmente porque la zona en donD. vive se encuentra alejada del centro D. la ciudad. 

Felipa compra diversos productos D. uso diario en pocas cantidades y los ofrece a sus clientes al crédito, ya que la mayoría D. ellos trabajan en una empresa agroindustrial que le paga mensualmente. Ella también trabaja como obrera D. la mecionada empresa por lo que se identifica con la situación D. sus clientes.

Felipa se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en los gastos D. escolaridad D. los dos nietos que tiene a su cargo. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento D. asumir sus cuotas.

Ella es una mujer carismática y muy trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es ver a sus nietos convertidos en profesionales exitosos.
texts.en:
Philippa is 63 years old and was widowed 29 years ago. She has 7 children, who are now all independent. She lives with two grandchildren in the district of Paiján Chuin, Ascope in the province of La Libertad region, which is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. For the past two years, she runs a small business selling groceries and beans in her home.
