She says the business began because of the demand for certain staples by her neighbors, which could not be acquired easily as they live in an area far away from downtown. Felipa purchases various goods for daily use in small quantities and offers customers credit, since most of them work in an agricultural company that pays monthly. She also works as a laborer for that company and can identify with her clients. Felipa is requesting a loan from field partner Alternative Edpyme of 1000 nuevos soles. She plans to spend the loan on the school fees of her two grandchildren under her charge. She has previously worked with this field partner and has proved to be timely and responsible with her payments. She is charismatic and hard working. Her greatest desire is to see her grandchildren turn into successful professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: School fees for the grandchildren in her charge.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora María vive en  casa alquilada con su madre en la zona Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que tiene es la de repostera, ella genera sus ingresos elaborando donuts y empanadas.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar insumos (harina, aceite, azúcar, levadura, etc.).

Es cliente de impro desde el año 2007 y tiene un historial de pagos muy bueno y por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
La señora María lives in a rented house with her mother in the Villa Neuvo Potosí area of the city of La Paz. She is a pastry cook; she earns a living making donuts and empanadas (pastries). This loan will be used to buy ingredients (flour, oil, sugar, yeast, etc.). She has been a customer of IMPRO since 2007. Because she has a very good credit history, she is eligible for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of flour, sugar, oil, and other ingredients for her business selling donuts and empanadas (pastries)

loans.name: Ladunni

texts.en: Ladunni is 50 years old and married with three children. His wife also works to support their home. Laduuni is an honest and hardworking man who sells bags of poultry feed at retail prices. He loves this business because he is the only person in his community who supplies this product. His customers patronize him regularly, and this gives him joy. Ladunni, who hopes to expand his business in the future, is requesting  a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more bags of poultry feed to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of poultry feed to sell

loans.name: Casimira

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA CASIMIRA ES UNA CLIENTE BUENA Y RESPONSABLE, ELLA  YA TRABAJO DOS SECUENCIAS EN LA INSTITUCION, EN SU COMPORTAMIENTO ELLA DEMOSTRO PUNTUALIDAD, LA SEÑORA  SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ROPA DE NIÑO Y ABARROTES EN LA DIFERENTES FERIAS DE LA CIUDAD DE LA PAZ, ELLA VENDE EN LAS FERIA DE ALTO LIMA, HUAYNA POTOSI Y LA FERIA DE  RIO SECO, SU ESPOSO TIENE LA PROFESION DE ALBAÑIL, EL TRABAJO DE SU ESPOSO ES INESTABLE POR LA FALTA DE TRABAJO QUE EXISTE EN BOLIVIA, EL CREDITO ANTERIORMENTE SOLICITADO FUE INVERTIDO EN LA CONSTRUCCION DE SU CASA EL CUAL FUE EJECUTADO POR SU ESPOSO QUE ES ALBAÑIL, SU HIJA SE DEDICA A LA ACTIVIDAD DE TEJIDO DE MANTAS, EL CREDITO SERA INVERTIDO EN LA COMPRA DE ROPA POR MAYOR.

ESTA AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Mrs. Casmira is a good, responsible customer. She had two previous loans, which were repaid on time. She sells children's clothing and groceries in various markets in the city of La Paz: Alto Lima, Huayna Potosi, and Rio Seco markets. Her husband is a builder. He can not work steadily because of the lack of construction work in Bolivia. Previous loan money was invested in the construction of her house. This work was done by her husband. Her daughter knits blankets. This loan will be invested in wholesale clothing. She is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have shown by extending credit to her.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr: Monsieur Abdou D. est un menuisier ébéniste de 48 ans. Il habite au plan Diakhaye une cite avoisinante de la localité de Baye Laye Guediawaye. C’est en mai 2009 qu’il a adhéré à la caisse de l’U-IMCEC  à Baye Laye. Monsieur D. exerce cette activité de menuisier ébéniste  depuis 1969. Il expose ses réalisations  et travaille sur commande. C’est un métier qu’il a choisi par amour et qu’il a choisi parmi tant d’autres. De par son aspect lucratif c’est pendant les veilles de fêtes  que son activité devient plus intéressante car il y’a beaucoup de commande en cette période. Mais en période d’hivernage le bois se fait rare. Par conséquent il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs destine a l’achat de bois pour faire des lits et d’autres meubles qu’il va revendre. Le crédit lui permet d’étendre sa capacité  de travail et d’augmenter ses profits. Dans ce cas il a la possibilité de mieux subvenir a ses besoins et aux besoins de sa famille. Il est marie et père de 8 enfants dont l’âge varie entre  3 et 30 ans.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdou D. is a 48 year old cabinet maker. He lives on the plateau of Diakhaye, a neighboring town to the village of Baye Laye Guediawaye. In May 2009 he joined the U-IMCEC savings bank in Baye Laye. Mr. D. has been carrying out his cabinet-making business since 1969. He puts his creations on display and works to order. It is a profession he has chosen out of love and one out of so many that he could have chosen. From a profitability point of view, his business is particularly interesting during the run up to festivals, because there are a lot of orders during this period. However, during the winter period wood is rare. Consequently he is applying for a loan of 500,000 francs which will be used to buy wood in order to make beds and other furniture that he will sell. The loan will allow him to increase both his work capacity and his profits. As such, he will be able to provide better for his needs and those of his family. He is married and has eight children, the ages of whom range from three to 30 years.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Nuestros  socios pertenecen al banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, ubicado en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestros socios son un grupo de 18 personas entre varones y mujeres, nuestros socios son personas emprendedoras y ansiosas de seguir creciendo más con el capital que mediante este medio se les otorga, todos ellos solicitan el préstamo para reinvertir en  sus diferentes negocios.

Una de las socias, Marcelina tiene 32 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y es conviviente es la primera vez que esta perteneciendo a Arariwa, nuestra socia trabaja en una pizzería desde las 8:00 am hasta 3:00 pm, ella ayuda en la cocina a picar los ingredientes que entra en la pizza y los fines de semana trabaja en una discoteca de la ciudad del cusco en el área de ropería(guardas casacas, abrigos),el crédito que requiere es para comprar útiles escolares para sus hijos, ella nos cuenta que sus hijos ya empezaron a estudiar y tiene que comprar libros, cuadernos todo lo que se necesita para el colegio.

 Nuestros socios agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y se comprometen en cumplir con el pago total de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
Los socios Doris, Celinda y José Carlos no aparecen en la foto porque pidieron permiso a la junta del banco comunal para no estar presentes el día del desembolso.

Los socios Doris, Celinda y José Carlos no aparecen en la foto porque pidieron permiso a la junta del banco comunal para no estar presentes el día del desembolso.
texts.en:
This group belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres Emprendedoras" (Enterprising Women), located in the city of Cusco. They are a group of 18 eager entrepreneurs, both men and women, who are intent on continuing to grow their businesses with the capital that is being provided through these means. All of them will use the loan to reinvest in their various businesses. One of the members, Marcelina, is 32, has 2 children and lives with a partner. This is the first time that she has been a member of Arariwa. She works in a pizzeria from 8am until 3pm; she helps in the kitchen to chop the ingredients that go on the pizza, and during the weekends she works in a nightclub bar in the city of Cusco checking people's coats and jackets. The loan she requests is to buy school supplies for her children. She tells us that her children have already returned to school and need to buy books, notebooks, and other school-related items. Our members appreciate and value the loan granted through these means, and they are committed to making the payments on each of their debts according to the established schedule. The members Doris, Celinda and José Carlos do not appear in the photograph because they asked permission of the board of the communal bank to be absent on the day of disbursement.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the member Marcelina needs a loan to buy school supplies for her children

loans.name: Divina Misericordia 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Carmen is the coordinator of her group Divina Misericordia (Divine Mercy), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Santiago, a city known for its tobacco and beef production, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple rented structure as a single mother with her children.

Carmen is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having fully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling phone cards (cards which, when scratched off, reveal a secret coD. which when texted to the phone company gives the customer prepaid minutes). She will use the profits to invest in her family by purchasing school supplies for her children as well as saving towards owning her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Phone cards to sell

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo es un padre de familia de 60 años de edad, tiene cuatro hijos ya independizados, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde muy joven de ha dedicado a trabajar como obrero agrícola, actualmente se encuentra trabajando como segador de alfalfa (forraje para animales) en un terreno de cultivo cercano al lugar en donde vive. Esta actividad la realiza por las mañanas. Como los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad no son suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares, también se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, los animales los cría en la parte posterior de su vivienda y los comercializa a los negociantes que visitan eventualmente la zona.

Las lluvias que se presentaron en la zona norte del Perú hace algunas semanas hicieron que una de las paredes de su vivienda colapsara, por ello, Gerardo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que planea invertir en la compra de material para volver a levantarla.

Gerardo es un hombre bastante responsable y trabajador. Sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima y lo consideran una persona confiable y que ayuda a los demás cuando se le necesita.
texts.en:
Gerardo is the head of his family, 60 years old, has four independent children, and lives with his wife in the district of Paijan, province of Ascope, in the region of La Libertad, which is located two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

Since he was young he has worked as a farm worker, and currently is working as a harvester of alfalfa (forage for animals) on a farm close to his home. He does this activity in the mornings. As the income is not adequate to meet the family expenses, he also raises and sells small animals in the backyard of his house which he sells to businesspeople who periodically visit his area.

The rains that come in the northern part of Peru caused one of the walls of his house to collapse several weeks ago, and because of this Gerado has seen the need to ask for the first time for a loan of 1500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa which he plans to invest in the purchase of material to rebuild the wall.

Gerardo is a very responsible man and worker. His neighbors and acquaintances have a lot of esteem for him and consider him trustworthy, and say that he helps others when they need it.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of construction material to repair a wall damaged by rain

loans.name: Sebastian Seferino

texts.es:
El Señor Sebastian  es un joven, que tiene un ambiente en alquiler en la Facultad de Psicología de la UMSA, donde presta servicios de fotocopias y de anillados de documentos, él tiene aproximadamente 25 años y desde hace 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad, es soltero, tiene familiares en la localidad de Apolo, y algunos parientes en la zona sur, viviendo exactamente en el domicilio de uno de sus tios,  pese a su juventud es una persona trabajadora, dinamica y muy responsable atiende solo y a veces en epocas de mucha demanda contrata personal de apoyo,  por lo expuesto y siendo una manera de apoyarlo a continuar en esa actividad  solicitamos el trato preferencial Kiva en este crédito. Con el dinero del credito comprara al po mayor material como ser: papel,tinta y anillados.

Esta muy agradecida con Empender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sebastian is a young man that has a leased space in the Psychology department of UMSA (Universidad Mayor de San Andres) where he provides photocopying and spiral binding services for documents. He is approximately 25 years old and has been in this line of work for 5 years. He is single and has relatives in Apolo and others in the southern region; he lives in one of his uncle’s homes. Despite his youth, he is a hard-working, dynamic, and very responsible. He works alone but sometimes, at high demand periods of time, he hires personnel to help out. For these reasons, and in order to support his efforts in this activity, we are requesting the Kiva preferential treatment with this loan. He will use the funds to buy supplies, like paper, ink and spiral binding supplies at wholesale. He is very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust that has been placed on him by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stationery supplies and ink.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Madame Guèye née Awa F. est mère de 4 enfants avec une moyenne d’âge de 7 ans. Elle est membre U-IMCEC depuis Juin 2009 et sollicitée un crédit de 120 000 FCFA pour compléter son budget d’approvisionnement.  Elle vend maintenant des habits pour hommes et elle veut se ravitailler en  ceinture, ensemble maillots, lacostes, tee shirt et des pantalons jeans qu’elle vend par commande.
Au paravent, Madame Guèye vendait des tissus, du thé, de l’encens et des chaussures. Elle a fait 10 ans dans la vente et compte sur ce prêt pour augmenter sa production. Ainsi avec ce nouvel investissement, Madame Guèye âgée de 43 ans espère régler les frais de scolarité de sa petite sœur qui suit une formation à Dakar.   
C'est ainsi qu'elle pense que le crédit va lui procurer un impact positif sur sa situation sociale et sur son business en lui assurant une dépendance économique.
texts.en:
Mrs. Guèye (maiden name Awa F.) is the mother of four children, whose average age is seven years. She has been a member of U-IMCEC since June 2009 and is seeking a loan of 120,000 FCFA to round out her inventory budget. She is currently selling men's clothing, and she would like to replenish her stock of belts, sports uniforms, polos, tee-shirts, and jeans, which she sells on order. Previously, Mrs. Guèye sold fabrics, tea, incense, and shoes. She has been in sales for ten years and needs this loan to increase her production. In this way, with this new investment, Mrs. Guèye (age 43) hopes to pay the school fees of her younger sister, who is studying in Dakar. Thus she believes that this loan will have a positive impact on her social situation and her business by ensuring her financial independence.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock up on clothing

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: LA SEÑORA MARIA ELENA, ESTA CASADA TIENE 2 HIJOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR TIENE UNA TIENDA DE BARRIO EN SU DOMICILIO DESDE HACE 22 AÑOS, EN LA CASA DE SU MAMA DONDE ELLA TAMBIEN VIVE, TAMBIEN TRABAJA DE PROFESORA, SE DA TIEMPO PARA LAS DOS ACTIVIDADES, ES MUY TRABAJADORA,  LA SEÑORA MARIA ELENA ES MUY ANTIGUA EN LA INTITUCION, DONDE HA DEMOSTRADO SER MUY RESPONSABLE EN SUS PAGOS, EN GRUPOS ESTA EN SU TERCER CICLO Y EN CREDITO INDIVIDUAL ESTA EN SU SEGUNDO CREDITO. CON  EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA VARIEDAD DE PRODUCTOS PARA SURTIR SU TIENDA Y BRINDAR UN MEJOR SERVICIO A SUS CLIENTES, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Elena is married and has two school-age children. She has a neighborhood store that she has managed out of her mother’s home, where she lives, for 22 years. Maria Elena also works as a school teacher and has time for both jobs. She is a hard worker and a long-time client of Emprender.

Maria Elena has demonstrated that she is very responsible with her payments. She participated in three loan cycles with a group and is now on her second individual loan. With this money, she will buy a variety of products to restock her store and provide better service to her customers. She is extremely grateful to Emprender and Kiva for trusting her by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: To God Be The Glory Group

texts.en:
Mamie V. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called To God Be the Glory. Forty-years-old, married, and the mother of four children who range in age from 12 to 26, Mamie was only able to attend school through elementary school. For two years she has been cooking and selling food at the Red Light Market, the largest market in Liberia. She says she sells good food which keeps her customers returning.

Mamie plans to use her 10,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 46,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more food to cook and sell. Her goal is to open a restaurant and improve the living conditions of her family.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Mamie is the one holding the sign. Miatta M. is inset at lower left. About LEAP

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution, with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase additional food to cook and sell.

loans.name: Aita

texts.fr: Madame Aita S. habite a Yoff dans le quartier de Ndeugagne.Elle est agee de 55 ans et est sociétaire  de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC Yoff depuis novembre 2009. Elle est mariée, sans enfants mais a en  charge 3 filles. Elle est éducatrice  en arabe dans une école  franco-arabe du quartier. Elle a choisi cette profession sous l’influence de son père qui lui a inculque cette éducation. Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus dans sa profession c’est le fait de transmettre le savoir. Elle sollicite un crédit de 75 000 frs pour assurer le transport  et les frais lies au pèlerinage de ses enfants et sœurs à l’ occasion du Maouloud. Son objectif est d’améliorer  la situation sociale de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aita S. lives in the Ndeugagne neighborhood of Yoff. She is 55 years old, and has been a member of the Yoff branch of U-IMCEC since November 2008. She is married without children of her own, but has three other children under her care. She is an Arabic teacher in a neighborhood Franco-Arabian school. She chose this profession influenced by her father who instilled this learning in her. What attracts her most in her profession is the transmission of knowledge to others. She is requesting a loan for 75,000 Francs, to deal with transportation and other costs her children and sisters will incur during a pilgrimage linked to festivities celebrating Maouloud (birth of the prophet Mohammed). Her objective is to improve her family’s social situation.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Social need

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers and farming supplies.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame Fatou G. est une femme mariée âgée de 40 ans avec un bébé de 6 mois.  Elle est couturière commerçante depuis 10 ans et  elle est soutenue par son mari dans son activité. 
 En plus des tissus qu’elle vend, elle confectionne des habits destinés également à la vente. Après 2 prêts octroyés par la caisse Jammi Xaleyi de U-IMCEC Thiès qu’elle a réglés sans difficultés avant même la fin de l’échéance, Madame G.  souhaitait un nouveau  prêt de 450 000 FCFA pour renforcer son activité. 
Avec cette somme, elle va acheter des tissus thioupes (indigo) venant du  Mali pour les besoins de son business. Elle écoule ses produits le plus souvent à Rufisque dans la région de Dakar et à Mbour une ville située à une centaine de kilomètres de Thiès où elle compte pas mal de clients.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou G. is married, 40 years old with a six-month-old baby. She has been a professional seamstress for 10 years, and is assisted by her husband in her business. In addition to the fabric she sells, she also tailors clothes for sale. Mrs. G. was granted two loans by the Jammi Xaleyi branch of U-IMCEC in Thiès, and repaid them both without problems and even sooner than scheduled. She is now requesting a new loan of 450,000 FCFA to strengthen her business. This loan will serve to buy ‘thioupe’ pieces of fabric (indigo) from Mali that she needs for her business. She sells her products mainly in Rufisque, in the Dakar region, and also in Mbour, a town located 100 kilometers from Thiès, where she has quite a few customers.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric for retail business

loans.name: I Trust God #2 Group

texts.en: Mamie S. is the leader of this group of five borrowers called “I Trust God #2”. In the photo, Mamie is the one holding the sign. She is 50 years old, single, and has four children who range from 14 to 27 years old. She, herself, did not have the opportunity to go to school. For twenty years, Mamie has been selling dry goods at the Red Light Market, which is the largest market in Liberia. She says she sells good products which keeps customers returning. Mamie plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more dry goods. Her goal is to grow her business and to improve the living conditions of her family. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with thirteen branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more dry goods

loans.name: Amigos De Caliri Group

texts.es:
El banco de Emprendimiento AMIGOS DE CALIRI se formo en la zona de Caliri a orillas del rio Irpavi, en su mayoria sus habitantes se dedican al lavado de arena, aunque tambien se dedican a otras actividades para lo cual deben de salir muy temprano a sus fuentes de trabajo puesto que el transporte es muy escaso en la zona. la asociacion esta compuesta por 8 socios de los cuales forman parte de la mesa directiva.

la Srta Maria quien se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos por catalogo, ella es estudiante en la universidad y su deseo es terminar su carreara y a si poder mejorar su calidad de vida, con el dinero del credito comprara mercaderia por promocion para luego venderlos al precio original.

El Sr. Sandalio quien trabaja en construcciones, esta casado y tiene hijos pequeños que se encuentran en edad escolar, el dinero del credito lo invertira en la compra de material de construccion y herramientas para utilizarlas en su trabajo.

El Sr. Edwin  que se dedica a la venta de muebles en la feria de 16 de julio, esta casado y su esposa le ayuda en la venta de muebles, con el dinero del credito comprara  mercaderia y asi tener mayor cantidad de muebles para la venta.

Forman la asociacion tambien: Jesus que es albañil, Ines que se dedica a a la venta de cosmeticos, Ximena vende celulares, Maria Isabel  se dedica a la costura de ropa y la Sra Remedios se dedica al lavado de arena en el rio irpavi. el prestamo solicitado servira al incremento de capital de trabajo y asi mejorar sus negocios. Todas las socias estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Amigos de Caliri (Friends of Caliri) Bank was formed in the Caliri region on the shore of the Irpavi River. The majority of its population works in the sandblasting business, although they also work in other areas, meaning they must leave for their places of employment very early as transportation is very scarce in their area. The group is formed of 8 members who form part of the board of directors.

Mrs. Maria works selling cosmetics through a catalog. She is a student at the univsersity and her desire is to graduate and be able to improve her quality of life. With the loan, she will buy merchandise on sale to later sell for the original price.

Mr. Sandalio works in construction. He is married and has small school-aged children. He will invest the loan money in the purchase of construction materials and tools to use in his job.

Mr. Edwin works selling furniture at the 16 de Julio market. He is married and his wife helps him sell furniture. With the loan money, he will buy merchandise to have more furniture for sale.

Other group members include: Jesus, who is a mason, Ines, who works selling cosmetics, Ximena, who sells cell phones, Maria Isabel, who is a seamstress, and Mrs. Remedios, who does sandblasting at the Irpavi River. The loan will be used to increase labor capital to improve their businesses. All of the members are thankful for Emprender and Kiva for trusting them with the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials and merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy inventory for his grocery store

loans.name: Thiabaty

texts.fr: Madame Thiabaty  D.  est une dame de 33 ans qui habite a Yoff Ndeungagne. Elle est membre de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC Yoff  depuis  décembre  2005. Elle a déjà rembourse 3 prêts  antérieurs. Elle est divorcée  et s’active dans le commerce d’achat et de vente de chaussures et de tissus. Elle fait aussi le tricotage de bonnet et la couture a la main. Elle a une expérience de 5 ans dans le commerce qu’elle fait. C’est une activité  qu’elle a choisi par passion. Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus ce sont les bénéfices  qu’elle réalise  .Elle sollicite un crédit de 75 000 frs pour acheter  des marchandises qu’elle commercialise. Avec ses bénéfices  elle assure  la satisfaction de ses besoins. Son  objectif est d’améliorer  la situation de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms Thiabaty D. is 33 years old and lives in Yoff Ndeungagne. She has been a member of the Yoff branch of the microfinance institution U-IMCEC since December 2005 and has already repaid three previous loans. She is divorced and trades in shoes and fabrics. She also knits bonnets and sews by hand. She has a 5-year-long experience in her business. She chose this activity because it was her passion, and the profit from her business matters a great deal to her. She applies for a loan of 75,000 CFA francs to buy more products for her inventory. She will use the profit to provide for her needs. Her aim is to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: With God All Things Are Possible Group

texts.en: Mamie J. is the leader of this group of five borrowers called “With God All Things Are Possible”. In the photo, Mamie is the one holding the sign. She is 37 years old, married, and has two children who are 14 and 16 years old. She, herself, was only able to attend school through high school. For ten years, Mamie has been selling dry goods at the Red Light Market, which is the largest market in Liberia. She sells good quality products in a friendly manner which keeps customers returning. Mamie plans to use her 8,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 40,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more dry goods. Her goal is to grow her business and to improve the living conditions of her family. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with thirteen branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more dry goods

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more medicine to sell

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married with two grown daughters. He is a private businessman from Pavlograd who sells fruits and vegetables in the central local market. Alexander owns three vending stalls in the same marketplace. He has been in this trade for ten years and has gained much experience. Currently, he has 90,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. His monthly net profit amounts to 7,000-10,000 Grivnyas.

Alexander is requesting a 17,000 Grivnya loan to increase his working capital. He says he likes working with this type of merchandise. Even though some market vendors prefer to work with different type of merchandise because fruit and vegetables get rotten fast, Alexander sticks to this sphere of trade. He says food items are always in good demand. Alexander’s enterprise is the main source of income for his family.

In the photo, Alexander is pictured with one of his hired employees.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit for his store

loans.name: Hevert Antonio

texts.es: Hevert Antonio tiene 37años, su actividad económica es la venta de sorbetes. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica es este negocio pues él, tiene muchos clientes por lo que el sale todos los días en su bicicleta con su humilde termo en donde guarda los diferentes sabores de helados. El tienen 2 hijos menores de edad que están a su cargo Hevert les ofrece estudios necesarios para su negocio, pues siempre se ha dedicado a vender este tipo de productos. El solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que es necesario para su materia prima. El sueña con mejorar su actividad económica.
texts.en:
Hevert Antonio, 27, sells sorbetes (frozen treats). He has been in this line of work for over 10 years. He has many customers so he goes out daily on his bicycle with his humble cooler where he keeps the various flavored frozen treats. He has two minor children under his care. Hevert provides them with education for his business; he has always sold this type of product. He is asking for funding to buy needed raw materials. He dreams with improving his commercial activity.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for his frozen treats.

loans.name: Mikhailo

texts.en:
Mikhailo is single and lives and works in Uzhgorod. He sells baked goods, pastry and candy in one of the local markets of his home town. He started this venture seven years ago. Presently, he has over 31,000 Grivnyas of gross income each month.

Mikhailo is seeking a 12,000 Grivnya loan to diversify the assorted merchandise in his vending kiosk. He is hoping to invest the generated income in a new startup – a flower kiosk.

Mikhailo can be characterized as a determined entrepreneur who has put much effort and energy into the growth of his business.

loans.use: To diversify his assorted merchandise

loans.name: D & A Business Group

texts.en:
Dadley T. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called D and A Business Group. A 43-year-old married father of a 17-year-old, Dadley is a university graduate with a degree in accounting, and he owns a little stationery store in the Harbel Market. Dadley has been running this business for six years and hopes to become the #1 stationery dealer in lower Margibi County in the near future.

Dadley sells his stationary at an affordable price to his customers in order to encourage them to continue buying from him. He needs this loan to purchase more stationery. Dadley dreams of building a house for his family one day.

About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution, with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more stationery.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more dry goods such as rice and body lotions.

loans.name: Ileana Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Ileana Del Socorro se dedica a este negocio como es el ofrecer los servicios de belleza de manera ambulante. Ileana es una muy buena cliente de Fundación León 2000 por lo que siempre se ha preocupado en pagar sus cuotas. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio, es madre de 2 hijos por lo que se preocupa por mantenerlos. Ella es una madre responsable pues además de esto les ayuda con sus tareas y a realizar las actividades del hogar. El motivo de su financiamiento es para la compra de materia pinturas de uñas, acetona, palillos, calcomanías decorativas, uñas decorativas y cremas. Su deseo es seguir manteniendo esta actividad.
texts.en:
Ileana Del Socorro provides beauty salons services door-to-door. Ileana is a very good client of Fundación León 2000; she has always rapaid on time. She has been in this line of work for over 15 years; she has two children to support. She is a responsible mother because, in addition to her work, she helps them with their homework and to do houshold chores. She will use the funding to buy manicure supplies like: nail polish, nail polish remover, cuticle sticks, decorative decals, decorative press-on nails and hand creams. Her wish is to keep doing this kind of work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manicure supplies.

loans.name: Sira

texts.fr: Sira D. est une femme de 57 ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SAREYEROYEL depuis 6 ans et demi et a eu à bénéficier de 13 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés régulièrement. Elle fait du petit commerce de sucre, d'huile végétal, d'huile de palme etc. Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettent d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et de participer aux différentes charge.
texts.en:
Sira D. is a 57 year old woman. She is married and the mother of one child in her care. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Sareyeroyel for six and a half years and has benefited from 13 loans which she has always managed well and repaid regularly. She is in the business of selling sugar, vegetable oil, palm oil, etc. The profits from her work allow her to improve her family’s quality of life and contribute to meeting various responsibilities.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to build up investment capital

loans.name: Matilde Del Rosario

texts.es:
La Sra. Matilde del Rosario F. R. se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas de maíz y venta de fritanga en su casa de habitación y a domicilio.

Ella va a usar el crédito para la compra de materia prima, ella necesita dichos productos para ampliar y mantener su negocio y por ende aumentar sus ventas y así satisfacer la demanda.

Ella empezó  a vender tortillas en pequeñas cantidades  en su casa de habitación y a poco a poco fue aumentando ya que este es un producto de muy buena demanda hasta que empezó con la venta de fritangas la cual tiene muy buena aceptación de parte de los consumidores también. Cabe señalar que ella siempre se ha dedicado a esta labor. Todos los días las hijas de ella le ayudan a la elaboración de estos productos así como a la venta.

Ella espera que con este financiamiento ella logre aumentar un poco mas su negocio y así obtener un poco más de ingreso y  que esto le ayude a solventar sus gastos familiares.

Matilde F. R. es una mujer casada y tiene 5 hijas de las cuales solo tres viven con ella, y las otras tres son totalmente independiente

Este es el crédito número siete que ella tiene en Ceprodel en un lapso  de tiempo de 5 años, dichos crédito le han ayudado a ir aumentado su negocio hasta donde lo tiene ahora, es un impacto familiar positivo ya que le a ayudado a mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida de ella así como las de su familia.
texts.en:
Senora Matilde del Rosario F. R. makes and sells corn tortillas and fried foods in her home.

She is going to use the loan to buy basic ingredients. She needs these products to expand and maintain her business and thus increase sales and satisfy demand.

She began to sell tortillas in small quantities in her home, and little by little the business increased, since it is a product in high demand. Then she began selling fried foods, which also were well accepted by the consumers. It should be pointed out that she has always done this type of work. Every day her daughters help her in the making of these products and also in the sales.

She hopes that with this loan she will succeed in increasing her business a little more and thus obtain a little more income and that this will help her pay for the family expenses.

Matilde F. R. is a married woman and she has 5 daughters, of whom only three live with her, and the others are completely independent.

This is the seventh loan that she has had at Ceprodel in a period of five years. These loans have helped her increase her business up to what she has now. It is a positive impact on her family, since it has helped her improve her income and quality of life, as well as that of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic ingredients (corn, lime, firewood, potatoes, bananas, etc.)

loans.name: Valimata

texts.fr: Madame Valimata K. est une femme mariée  de 42 ans. Elle habite a Yoff Layenne et est sociétaire de l’U-IMCEC de Yoff depuis octobre 2009. Depuis plus de 10 ans elle exerce  la vente de sandwich et de fritures de poissons. Elle a démarre son activité grâce  au financement de son ferre  qui l’a beaucoup encourage. Ce qui l’intéresse le plus dans son occupation c’est la recherche de profits pour satisfaire ses besoins personnels. Madame K. est mère  de 11 infants dont l’âge  varie entre 2 et 20 ans. Elle sollicite un crédit de 50 000 frs pour l’achat de caisses de poissons et de sacs d’oignons pour mieux rentabiliser son commerce. Son objectif est d’améliorer  les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Madame Valimata K. is a 42 year old married woman. She lives in Yoff Layenne, and has been a member of the U-IMCEC of Yoff since October, 2009. For more than 10 years she has been in the business of selling sandwiches and fried fish. She started her business with financial help from her brother, who encouraged her a great deal. She is most interested in earning profits from her work to meet her personal needs. Madame K. is the mother of 11 children ranging in age from 2 to 20 years. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 FRS to buy cases of fish and sacks of onions to make her business more profitable. Her goal is to raise her family's quality of life.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Vidalia

texts.es:
La Sra. Vidalia G. R. se dedica  a la elaboración y venta de tirillas así como la venta de elotes cocidos, güirilas, y tamales dulce.

La Sra. Vidalia G. solicita un financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como es el maíz, cal, leña y elotes, ya que hoy en día están son más caros dichos productos y ella piensa mantener su negocio ya que es su fuente de ingreso.

Ella comenzó con dicho negocio cuando miro que había mucha demanda de este y poca oferta y desde entonces a diario se dedica a esta labor con la ayuda de sus hijas. Ha tenido este negocio desde hace 12 años y trabaja todos los días desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde, cabe señalar que siempre se a dedicado a este negocio.

La Sra. Vidalia G. espera que con el financiamiento que se le otorgue aumentar sus ventas e ir ampliando más su negocio de venta de tortillas así como la venta de elotes y tamales.

Vidalia G. es una mujer casada y tiene dos hijas de edad escolar las que le ayudan a diario en el negocio. 

Ella es el financiamiento numero 7 que ella tiene en un periodo de 4 años, los impacto de los financiamientos han sido positivos ya que le han ayudado a ir ampliando su negocio y también sus ingresos y de una u otra manera le a ayudado ha mejoras su nivel de vida
texts.en:
Vidalia G. R. makes a living making and selling popular regional dishes such as corn on the cob, maize pancakes and sweet tamales. She is requesting the loan to purchase ingredients such as corn, lime, firewood and sweetcorn because currently those products are expensive and she wants to stick with the business since it's her source of income. Vidalia started the business when she saw those kinds of products were in high demand, and since then she has dedicated herself daily to this work with the help of her daughters. She has had the business for 12 years and works every day from 5 a.m. to 3 p.m. She hopes that with the loan she can increase her sales and expand her business to include selling tortillas as she does with the corn and tamales. Vidalia is married and has two school-age children who help her with the business daily. This is her seventh loan over the past four years, and the financing has had a positive effect in helping her improve her business and her income, and in one way or another helped her improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients such as corn, lime, firewood and sweetcorn

loans.name: Julia Anita

texts.es:
Julia es una madre de familia de 34 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años al negocio de venta de embutidos en el mercado El Tambo de la ciudad de Paiján, este negocio es de suma importancia para la economía familiar, su esposo tiene la misma actividad pero en un mercado de una ciudad cercana. El negocio de Julia es conocido por la calidad de productos que ofrece y por el buen trato que brinda a los clientes.

Adicionalmente, Julia vende anticuchos (meat kabob) por las tardes en una calle del centro de la ciudad de Paiján, este negocio también le provee de significaticos ingresos que son utilizados en el mantenimiento de la economía familiar.

Julia desea ampliar su negocio de venta de embutidos, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de más mercadería para ofrecérsela a sus clientes.

Ella es una mujer alegre y trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando arduamente para asegurarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y una buena educación que les garantice un exitoso porvenir. Julia ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas. En la imagen aparece vendiendo anticuchos por la tarde.
texts.en:
Julia is a 34-year-old mother that lives with her husband and three children in Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region, which is two-and-a-half hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region. For the past 5 years she has sold cured meats in Paiján’s El Tambo market. This is an extremely important business for the family’s finances; her husband is in the same line of work, but in a market located in a nearby city. Julia’s business is well-known for the quality of the products she offers and for the good customer service she provides. In addition, Julia sells anticuchos (meat kabob) in the afternoon on one of Paiján’s downtown streets. This business also produces significant income that is used for family expenses. Julia wants to enlarge her sale of cured meats. She is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy more merchandise to have available for her customers. She is a cheerful and hard-working woman. Her greatest wish is to continue to work hard to insure a better quality of life for her children and to provide them with a good education that will guarantee them a successful future. Julia has managed previous loans with our institution and has been responsible and punctual with her repayment commitments. In the photo she appears selling anticuchos in the afternoon.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cured meats.

loans.name: Yareysi María

texts.es:
La Joven Yareysi María Z. Z. es una joven del Municipio de Condega y se dedica a la venta de ropa variada de segunda en su casa de habitación.

Ella solicita un financiamiento en Ceprodel para la compra de varias pacas de ropa de segunda y así ofrecer un mejor surtido de ropa tanto para adultos como para niños. El la empezó con este negocio con el objetivo de aumentar sus ingresos, empezó vendiendo ropa en pequeña cantidad y solo a para adulto y al ir teniendo mas demanda ella fue aumentando su producto.

Ella tiene aproximadamente un año de tener este negocio y lo atiende todos los días  desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde  a veces le ayuda su hermana a atender el negocio. Ella se dedicaba  a las labores de estilista antes de tener este negocio.

Yareysi Z. espera que con la compra de más pacas de ropa de segunda aumenten sus ventas y satisfaga la demanda de los clientes y así ir aumentando más su negocio.

Yareysi Z. es soltera y no tiene hijos, su hermana vive con ella.

Este es el crédito numero  2 que ella tiene en Ceprodel en un periodo de dos años y estos crédito le han ayudado positivamente ya que le hay permitido crecer en su negocio de venta de ropa mejorando sus ingresos mensuales.
texts.en:
Yareysi María Z. Z. is a young woman from the municipality of Condega who makes a living selling a variety of second-hand clothing out of her home. She is requesting the loan from Kiva partner Ceprodel to purchase various bundles of second-hand clothing so she can offer a larger stock of products for adults as well as children. She started the business with the goal of increasing her income, and she started out selling small quantities of clothing only for adults and as demand increased she also increased her products. Yareysi has had the business approximately one year and tends to it every day from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m., and sometimes her sister helps her. Previously, Yareysi made a living as a hairstylist. She hopes that with the purchase of more second-hand clothing she can increase her sales and satisfy her customers' demand, and thus grow her business more. Yareysi is single and doesn't have children, and her sister lives with her. This is her second loan through Kiva partner Ceprodel over two years, and her previous loan helped her grow her business and increase her monthly income.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bundles of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Madame Aminata T. est une femme de 55 ans qui évolue  depuis plus de 5 ans dans le commerce de thioubs et de chaussures. Elle habite a Yoff Mbenguene. Elle est sociétaire  de la caisse de Yoff depuis novembre 2005 et n’a jamais bénéficié  de prêts.  C’est le fait de ne pas rester inactive qui l’a pousse a choisir cette activité de commerce. Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus c’est la réalisation de bénéfices et la satisfaction des besoins de la clientèle. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs pour renouveler son stock de thioubs et de chaussures déjà place. Son objectif est l’amélioration de sa condition de vie.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata T. is a 55-year old woman, who for over five years has been developing a business selling "thioubs" (special tinted fabric) and shoes. She lives in Yoff Mbenguene. She has been a member-shareholder of the savings bank in Yoff since November 2005 and has never had a loan. She started her business in order not to remain inactive. What interests her most is making profits and satisfying the needs of her customers. She is applying for a loan of 150,000 francs in order to renew her stock of "thioubs" and shoes. Her aim is to improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening of funds

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
La Sra. María Cristina V. H. es comerciante del municipio de Condega y se dedica a la fabricación y venta de pan.

Ella va a utilizar el crédito que solicita con nosotros para la compra de materia prima como es la haría, azúcar, etc. Con esto pretender ala ampliación de su negocio y por ende aumentar la oferta.

 Ella empezó haciendo pan en pequeñas cantidades y a medida que iba dando a conocer este producto iba aumentando la clientela hasta que su negocio creciera hasta como esta en la actualidad.

La Sra. María Cristina Comenzó  este negocio aproximadamente hace unos 15 años. Ella trabaja todos los días de lunes a sábado desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, cabe señalar que esta señora siempre se ha dedicado a esta labor y le ayuda en las labores diarias la esposa del hijo.

Ella espera que con el financiamiento aumente su producción ara lograr cubrir su mercado casi en su totalidad.

La Sra. María Cristina V. es soltera y tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar a los que les costea sus gastos escolares.

Este es el crédito número diez que Doña María Cristina Solita en un periodo de siete años. Ella argumenta que estos financiamiento le han ayudado a sacar adelante dicho negocio con éxito ya que la situación a encarecido la materia prima, por lo que se muestra agradecida por los financiamiento que Ceprodel le ha hecho.
texts.en:
María Cristina V. H. is a merchant from the municipality of Condega and makes a living baking and selling bread. She plans to use the loan to purchase ingredients such as flour and sugar to expand her business. She started baking bread in small quantities and while she was getting to know the trade she was growing her clientele until her business grew to where it is today. María started the business approximately 15 years ago, and she works Monday through Saturday from 6 a.m. to 5 p.m. Her son's wife helps her with the work daily. She hopes that with the loan she can increase her production to cover nearly her entire market. María is single and has two children who are still in school, which she pays for. This is her 10th loan over a period of seven years, and the loans have helped her successfully make headway with the business since the ingredients can get expensive. She is grateful for the support Kiva partner Ceprodel has given her.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients (corn, flour, sugar, lard, etc.)

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La señora Maria Auxiliadora R. P., tiene 61 años de edad vive con su esposo en El barrio San jose de los Ríos, ella es casada y su esposo labora como chofer, tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, casados, totalmente independientes y se dedican al comercio y la agricultura.

Ella trabaja en la siembra de la piña desde hace 32 años  y uno de los principales problemas a los que se ha enfrentado en sus tierras ha sido la afectación de los gases que el volcan  a emanado en los últimos meses, ella comenzo trabajando en la agricultura gracias a que heredo unas tierras las cuales con su esfuerzo las a trabajao todos estos años, las piroridades qeu tiene para su produccion esta la diversificacion de la produccion con loa sembra de otras frutas y realizar trabajos de consevacion de los suelos, ella solicita un prestmao para la compra de materiales vegettivos y fertilizantes que den un mantenimiento productivo a ala cosecha y las tierras esot garantizara la buena venta y les brindara mejores ocndiciones como familia para emprenderse a nuevas fuentes de ingresos tales ocmo la apertura de una pulperia en su casa debidoa  que en la zona no existe ninguna cerca y desea aprovechar ese mercado meta.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora R. P., 61, lives with her husband in San Jose de los Ríos neighborhood. She is married and her husband works as a driver; they have three adult children, who are married and totally independent, who are merchants and farmers. She has been a pineapple grower for 32 years. One of the main obstacles she has faced is that her farmlands have been adversely affected by the gasses spewing from the volcano the last few months. She started to farm when she inherited some farmlands; she has worked them all these years with much effort. Her priorities for her crops are that the crops be diversified with other kinds of fruit and soil conservation. She is asking for funding to buy farming supplies and fertilizers that will provide care for the crops and soil so that a profitable sale will be insured which, in turn, will provide better living conditions for the family that will even lead to new commercial activities like opening a grocery store in her house because there isn’t any nearby and she wants to take advantage of this target market opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Khady Amy

texts.fr: Khady Amy N. est une femme âgée de 36 ans, elle est divorcée et mère de 2 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de THILMAKHA depuis 7 ans et a eu 14 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Elle développe un petit commerce de draps de lit et fait de l'embouche ovine. Ses activité lui procure des ressources financières qui lui permettent de prendre en charge ses enfants et ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Khady Amy N. is a 36-year old woman who is divorced and has two children in her care. She has been a member of the Village Bank of THILMAKHA for seven years and has had 14 consecutive loans. She is developing a small business selling bed sheets and also does beef fattening. Her activities provide her with the financial resources to take care of her children and cover her personal needs.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her commercial activity

loans.name: Marling Lili

texts.es:
La Sra. Marling Lili L. P. tiene una venta de comida en el casco urbano de Condega.

Ella solicita un financiamiento para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de comidas tales como aceite, arroz, verduras, etc. Ya que estos ah subido deprecio y quiere comprar más productos para elaborar más comida y satisfacer la demanda.

Ella empezó este negocio surge al establecerse una fabrica de puros en las cercanías de su casa de habitación por lo que los trabajadores de dicha empresa demandaban alimento, este negocio tiene de tenerlos desde hace unos 8 años y empezó vendiendo comida en pequeñas cantidades aumentando a medida que los trabajadores aumentaban. Ella se dedicaba a la costura antes de dedicarse a la venta de comida.

Marling L. espera con este financiamiento comprar mas materia prima y aumentar mas su negocio y lograr satisfacer la demanda y por ende sus ingresos.

Ella es una a mujer soltera con hijo en edad universitaria, al que ella le costea dichos gastos de estudio.

Este es el crédito numero 4 que ella tiene en Ceprodel en un periodo de 10 años. Ella dice que sus créditos con Ceprodel le han ayudado a crecer su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marling Lili L. P. sells food in greater Condega. She is asking for funding to buy ingredients for her meals like: cooking oil, rice, vegetables, etc. because prices for these items have risen and she wants to have more ingredients available to prepare more food and satisfy customer demand. She started her business when a cigar factory opened up near her home. Employees of the factory needed food and, for about 8 years now, she has provided meals for them; first in small numbers but gradually increasing as the number of employees grew. Prior to going into meal preparation she was a seamstress. Marling hopes to use the funds to buy more ingredients to increase her volume, meet customer demand thus increasing her income. She is a single mother of a university-age son; she pays all his educational expenses. This is her 4th loan with Ceprodel in a 10-year period. She says that her loans with Ceprodel have helped her business grow, her income increase and thus improved her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, cooking oil, gas, rice and flour.

loans.name: Maryurit Liset

texts.es:
La  Joven Maryurit Liset O. C. es maestra de en un colegio de secundaria en el municipio de Condega.

Ella solicita un crédito el cual va a utilizar para gastos universitarios de su hermano tales como matricula  compra de utensilios escolares. Ella quiere que su hermano tenga una profesión y en un futuro el tenga como valerse por si solo y que sea una persona exitosa.

Maryurit O. empezó a ser maestra desde hace 4 años, ella empieza sus labores desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 12 de medio día y el resto del día ella planea la lección de clase del próximo día. Antes de dedicarse a maestra ella era estudiante.

Ella espera con este crédito financiarle los gastos universitarios a su hermano menor para que en un futuro logre ser un profesional igual que ella y pueda triunfar y logra ser alguien en la vida.

Maryurit O. es una joven casada y no tiene hijos cabe señalar que ella vive con su mama.

Este es el crédito numero dos que Maryurit tiene en Ceprodel en u periodo de tres años  le han beneficiado positivamente ya que le han ayudado a sacar sus estudios adelantes y crecer profesionalmente así como espera ayudarle a sus hermano en sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Maryurit Liset O. C. is a secondary school teacher in the city of Condega. She is asking for funding to pay university expenses for her brother such as: tuition and school supplies. She wants her brother to have a profession so that he can support himself in the future and be a successful person. Maryurit O. has been a teacher for 4 years. Her work day starts at 7am and goes until noon; the rest of the day she prepares her lesson plans for the next day. Prior to becoming a teacher she was a student. She hopes to use the funds to pay for her younger brother's university expenses so that he will become a professional like her in the future and be successful and come into his own in life. Maryurit O. is married and has no children; it's worth mentioning that she lives with her mother. This is her second credit with Ceprodel in a three-year period. The loans have had a positive impact in that they helped her finish her schooling and to grow professionally as she now hopes to help her brother do.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for university expenses (tuition, books, etc.)

loans.name: Amy Zal

texts.fr: Amy Zal N. est une femme de 31 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc villageois de THILMAKHA depuis 7 ans et y a eu de belles performances avec le crédit pour y avoir accédé 14 fois de suite. Elle vend divers produits cosmétiques et des bijoux, elle fait également de l'embouche ovine. Avec ses bénéfices, elle parvient à soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Amy Zal N. is a 31-year old woman who is married and has seven children in her care. She has been a member of the Village Bank in THILMAKHA for seven years and has a good borrowing experience, in that she has had 14 consecutive loans. She sells a variety of cosmetic products and jewelry, and at the same time she undertakes beef fattening. With her profits, she manages to support her husband in taking care of the family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her investment capital

loans.name: Erling José

texts.es:
El señor Erling es una persona que desde hace 5 años se dedica a esta actividad con el cual ha logrado salir adelante ya que en la actualidad este en su tercer año de su carrera universitaria ya que estudia sabatino el es un joven trabajador ya que con los créditos bridados por nuestra institución él ha aumentado su producción y sus ventas con lo que le ayuda a su madre a sufragar los gastos de la casa.
Esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de pollos ya que para esta época las ventas se mejoran lo que le permitiría aumentar su producción
texts.en:
Erling has been in this line of work for 5 years. It has helped him get ahead in that he is currently in third year of university studies; he is enrolled in a Saturday program. He works hard and the loans he has gotten from our institution have made it possible for him to increase his sales which are used to help his mother meet household expenses. He is asking for a new loan to buy chickens because this is the season when they sell the best and he wants to increase his production.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Jose Adrian

texts.es: Jose Adrian es un prqueño productor agropecuario del Municipio El coral donde habita junto a su esposa, quien le apoya con las actividades agropecuarias. Está solicitando su primer crédito a AFODENIC, y espera ser beneficiado con el fondo KIVA para invertirlo en su principal actividad, como es compra de ternero desarrollo, para cuidarlos y engordarlos para que el ganado alcance mayor peso y ser comercializado a un buen precio de mercado, y asi obtener ingresos económicos que ayuden a mejorar la calidad de vida del núcleo familiar.José Adrian, posee su propia finca donde realiza sus actividades agricola y pecuaria, sin embargo necesita el financiamiento para lograr mejorar su economia. Se caracteriza por ser independiente pues le gusta trabajar por si solo, para salir adelante,también tiene deseo de superar su económia,  en su comunidad lo consideran ser hombre responsable, honesto y de buenos valores morales.
texts.en:
Jose Adrian is a small rancher and farmer in El Coral where he lives with his wife, who helps him with his farming chores. He is asking AFODENIC for his first loan and hopes that the Kiva fund will grant it. His main activity is cattle raising: he buys young calves, feeds them, cares for them, fattens them up so that they reach their maximum weight and can be sold at the best possible price to earn income to improve his family's economic conditions. Jose Adrian has his own farm where he raises his livestock and farms. However, he needs funding to improve his economy. He is characterized by being independent because he likes to work on his own to get ahead; he also wants to improve his finances. In his community, he is considered to be a responsible, honest man with good moral values.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To raise his calves.

loans.name: Elsa  Maria

texts.es: Doña Elsa Maria, habita el municipio de Nueva Guinea en la Colonia Talolinga junto a su familia compuesta por su marido y cuatro hijos, sandra de 16 años, va iniciar estudios universitario, Derling de 15 año, estudia segundaria, Dervin Yarel estudia primer año de segundaria y Yarelis Danieska de 2 año, sus hijos mayores le ayudan con el cuido de la finca cuando salen de clase, solicita a AFODENIC su primer crédito para compra de vaca parida, para fortalecer su inventario ganadero, y mejorar la alimentación de sus niño obteniendo mayores ingreso para su familia,   esta señora es una mujer trabajadora en las actividades del campo, se destaca como una mujer lider en la colonia, le gusta trabajar y le tiene mucho amor a todas sus actividades que se desarrolla en su finca, en con unión con su familia, su anhelo es tener mejor ganado de producción de leche para lograr incrementar sus ingresos y brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Elsa Marie lives in Colonia Talolinga in the Nueva Guinea municipality. She lives with her family, which is comprised of her husband and their four children. Sandra, age 16, is going to start her university studies. Derling, age 15, goes to high school. Derven Yarel is in his first year of high school. The youngest is two year old Yarelis. The older children help take care of the farm when they leave class. She is asking Afodenic for her first loan to buy a dairy cow in order to strengthen their livestock inventory. This will also improve the children’s nutrition and get greater income for the family. This lady works hard in the fields, and she stands out as a woman who is a leader in the neighborhood. She likes to work, and she really loves all of the activities that she does together with her family on the farm. Her desire is to have more milk producing livestock to increase their earnings and offer her family better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Angel Francisco

texts.es: Angel Francisco habita en el sector de Nueva Guinea en la Comarca Flor de Pino en la Colonia Talolinga junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa y 3 hijos menores los que tambien ayudan y colaboran en los quehaceres del hogar y  en las actividades del campo. Don Angel desde muy pequeño, ha tenido como principal actividad economica el manejo de su inventario ganadero apoyado por su papa,  solicita financiamiento de su primer credito para compra de vacas paridas, las que le permitiran obtener mayores fuentes de ingreso que ayudarian a solventar las nesecidades del nucleo familiar, su mayor sueño es pagar su credito en tiempo y forma para que esta institucion le siga brindando servicio de credito cuando lo neceiste, se caracteirza por ser un hombre trabajador con muchas ganas de superarse, en su comunidad lo consideran como una persona responsable y trabajador.
texts.en:
Angel Francisco lives in the New Guinea sector of the Flor de Pino region in the Talolinga neighborhood. His family is comprised of his wife and their three minor children. They help and work together on the household activities and the field work. Since he was very small his primary economic activity has been managing his livestock inventory with his father’s help. He is requesting his first loan to buy dairy cows. These will allow him to get greater income, which will pay for the family’s necessities. His biggest dream is to pay the loan in time in the manner agreed upon so that this institution will continue to offer him loan service when he needs it. He is characterized as a hard-working man with a great desire for self improvement. In his community he is considered to be a responsible and hard-working person.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy dairy cows

loans.name: Jose Enrique

texts.es: El señor Jose Enrique habitante de colonia Talolinga del municipio de Nueva Guinea, desde  muy pequeño se ha dedicado a la actividad pecuaria, su familia esta conformada por su esposa Elsa Maria y 4 hijos, la mayor Sandra  de 16 años de edad va iniciar sus estudios Universitarios, Derling de 15 años estudia secundaria, Dervin Yarel estudia la secundaria y Yarelis es la menor de 2 años de edad, sus hijos mayores y su esposa ayudan a realizar las actividades laborales del campo; Don Jose Enrique esta solicitando financiamiento de su primer credito para compra de vacas paridas, rubro que intantaneamente sera una fuente de ingreso para el nucleo familiar permitiendole mejorar sus condiciones de vida en su hogar,  este señor es un hombre trabajador con muchos deseos de superacion, espera ser beneficiado con el fondo KIVA para lograr mejorar las condiciones de su familia, en su comunidad lo consideran ser hombre responsable,  honesto y de buenos valores morales.
texts.en:
Jose Enrique lives in the Talolinga neighborhood in the New Guinea municipality. He has worked with livestock since he was very small. His family is comprised of his wife, Elsa Maria, and their four children. Sandra is 16, and she is going to start her university studies. Derling is 15, and he is in high school. Dervin Yarel is in high school. Yarelis is the youngest; he is two years old. The older children and his wife help him with the field work. Jose Enrique is requesting his first loan to buy dairy cows. This will be an instant source of income for his family, and it will allow him to improve the living conditions in his home. He is a very hard-working man with a lot of desire to improve. He hopes to receive a loan from Kiva to improve his family’s conditions. In he community he is considered to be a responsible and honest man with good moral values.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Santos Catalino

texts.es: El señor Santos Catalino habitante de la colonia San Jose del municipio de Nueva Guinea, trabaja en conjunto con su familia compuesta por su esposa y 4 hijos mayores, los que colaboran en los quehaceres de la unidad de produccion, solicita financiamiento de su primer credito esperando ser beneficiado con el fondo kiva, para compra de vaca parida  con el objetivo de garantizar una fuente de ingresos diaria que le permita mejorar las condiciones de vida familiar y su nivel economico, su principal actividad ha sido el manejo de hato bovino, el mayor anhelo de don Santos es poder aumentar su pequeño inventario ganadero, porque es el patrimonio de su familia, ademas desea por vivir una vida mas comoda en conjunto con su familia, se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador con muchos deseos de superacion.
texts.en:
Santos Catalino lives in Nueva Guinea's San Jose neighborhood. He works together with his family that is composed of his wife and 4 adult children; they all cooperate with production unit tasks. He is asking for his first loan, hoping that Kiva fund will grant it, to buy a dairy cow with the intention that it provide a steady source of daily income that will improve his family's living conditions and economic level. His main emphasis has been raising cattle. His greatest wish is to increase his small herd because this is his family's assets. In addition, he would like to live with his family in a more comfortable house. He is noted for being a hard-working man with a desire to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Amalia Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Amalia, esta casada y tiene hijos pequeños, es hija de una cliente muy buena y antigua de la institucion, ella se dedica administrar la movilidad de su propiedad y que la maneja su esposo, ella tiene tres hijos pequeños, dos estudian en la escuela y otro es bebé, ella durante el día trabaja junto con su suegra en la venta de abarrotes en el mercado de Achumani,la suegra le paga un salario de 500 Bs. al mes y además le paga el almuerzo diario de ella y de sus hijos, es una mujer joven y trabajadora, por lo que se ve conveniente favorecerla con esa tasa preferencial. Con el dinero del credito comprara repuestos para su movilidad  y unas llantas nuevas.

Uno de los deseos de la Sra. Amalia es el de comprarse una casita y de ver a sus hijos profesionales, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindad en la otorgacion del credito
texts.en:
Amalia is married and has young children. She is the dautgher of a good and long-standing client of the institution. She administers and her husband drives their vehicle. She has three young children; two are in school and the third is still a baby. During the day, she works with her mother-in-law selling groceries in Achumani's market. Her mother-in-law pays her a salary of 500 Bs. a month; she also buys daily lunch for her and her children. She is a hard-working young woman so it would be advisable to grant her the preferential rate. She will use the funds to buy replacement parts and new tires for her vehicle. One of Amalia's wishes is to buy a little house and see her children become professionals. She is very grateful to Empreder and to Kiva for the trust placed in her by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires and for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Chintia Yanielka

texts.es: Chintia es una joven que habita en el Municipio de el Coral,  labora como Auxiliar contable en la Alcaldia municipal de El Coral, su familia la conforman su mama y 4 hermanos los que coloboran en las actividades del hogar, su mayor necesidad que se le presenta es la de mejorar su casa, pero no cuenta con los recursos economicos necesarios para hacerlo, por esta razon solicita financiamiento a la institucion de AFODENIC y esperando contar con el apoyo de kiva, para realizar cambio de zinc en su vivienda ya que se encuentra en mal estado  y hecharle la ceramica a la sala ya que actualmente no cuenta con piso, lo cual le permitira vivir en mejores condiciones junto a su familia. Chintia se recibio en de Lic. en Contaduria Publica y es una joven emprendedora con mucho deseo de superacion.
texts.en:
Chintia is a young woman who lives in the municipality of El Coral. She works as an accounting assistant at the El Coral City Hall. Her family is comprised of her mother and 4 siblings, who collaborate with the household chores. Her biggest need is for home improvement, but she does not have the financial resources she needs to do so. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from AFODENIC, hoping to get Kiva's support so that she can replace her house's zinc roofing because it is in disrepair. She also needs to install tile flooring in the living room because it currently does not have any. These things will allow both her and her family to have better living conditions. Chintia is a certified public accountant, and a young entrepreneur with the desire for self-improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replace zinc roofing

loans.name: Daniel Antonio

texts.es: Daniel Antonio tiene 58 años, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales solamente1 depende el. Es un hombre muy trabajador pues le gusta mucho su actividad económica que es una pulpería, que tiene más de 5 años de trabajar con su actividad pues el ofrece sus diferentes productos en el mercado en donde tiene una amplia variedad de clientes. A pesar del gran desafío que enfrenta como es problema de salud de su esposa de la cual le brinda la atención necesaria. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de pollo, huevos, aceite, gaseosas, jugos, detergentes entre otros. Su deseo es mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Daniel Antonio is a 58-year-old father with 3 children, 1 of whom still depends on him financially. He is a very hardworking man who really loves his general store. He has been in business for over 5 years, offering a wide selection of products to a variety of customers at the market. Despite the huge challenge that he is currently facing--his wife's health problems--he gives her the care she needs.

The loan that he is requesting will be used to purchase chicken, eggs, cooking oil, soft drinks, juice, detergent, and other goods. He hopes to be able to improve his home.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Fermin Jose

texts.es: Don Fermin habita en el municipio de el coral junto su familia conformada por su esposa y sus  hijos, el mayor de 10 años y el menor de 4 años de edad. Fermin labora como Alcalde municipal de este municipio, ademas se dedica a las actividades pecuarias, encontrandose con inconvenientes para la realizacion de esta actividad, pues no cuenta con las mejores condiciones para el manejo del ganado ni con los recursos economicos para hecerlo, por lo que esta solicitando su primer credito a AFODENIC esperando contar con el apoyo de kiva para ampliar su galera con el fin de brindar mejor cuido a su pequeño hato bovino y realizar el ordeño de una manera mas higienica. Es muy querido por sus compañeros de trabajo y por la comunidad, quienes lo conocen por ser una persona responsable y de muy buenos valores morales.
texts.en:
Mr. Fermin lives in the municipality of El Coral with his family, which is comprised of his wife and 2 children ages 10 and 4. Fermin is the municipal Mayor. He also works in cattle ranching, but faces some difficulties in this field since he does not work in the best conditions nor does he have the financial resources to do so. For this reason, he is requesting his first loan from AFODENIC, hoping to get Kiva's support so that he may expand his stable and in so doing, providing better care for his small herd of cows and milking them under more sanitary conditions. He is very well-loved by his co-workers and by the community, who know him as a responsible man with high moral values.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve cattle stable

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou G. est une femme de 52 ans, elle est mariée et mère 7 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 8 ans et demi. Elle est très expérimentée en matière de crédit pour en avoir bénéficié 17 fois de suite. Elle développe une activité d'embouche ovine, ce qui lui génère de ressources financières lui permettant de se prendre en charge et de participer aux à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou G. is a 52-year old woman who is married and has seven children. She has been a member of the Village Bank for eight and a half years. She has significant borrowing experience, in that she has had 17 consecutive loans. She is developing a beef fattening activity, which generates the financial resources to allow her to take care of, and participate in, the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer
