loans.use: To strengthen her beef fattening business

loans.name: William Antonio

texts.es: Willian Antonio de 32 años de edad  habita junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa Tania Prado y su hijo William de 2 añitos, es Ingeniero Agronomo de profesion y brinda sus servicios profesionales en la Alcaldia de Nueva Guinea. Adicionalmente se dedica a la actividad ganadera desde hace seis años,  posee su pequeña parcela con un manejo técnificada de sistema silvo pastoril, pasto mejorado, con un inventario ganadero propio, de buena selección, tiene infraestructura para el ordeño de su ganado parido.  Esta solicitando su primer credito y espera ser beneficiado con el fondo kiva, para compra de ternero desarrollo, su mayor sueño es tener su propia empresa agropecuaria y trabajar de manera independiente, así poder crear mejores condiciones para el futuro de su familia, él tiene espiritu de superación, es un joven con mucho liderazgo en el Municipio.
texts.en:
William Antonio is 32 years old and lives with his family, which consists of his wife Tania Prado and their two year old son William. He is an agricultural engineer by profession and provides his professional services to the City of Nueva Guinea. In addition, he has been raising cattle for six years. William Antonio owns a small plot of land that contains a technical forestry management system, improved pastures, and his own herd of well-bred cattle. He also has the infrastructure for nursing the newborn calves.

William Antonio is requesting his first loan and hopes to be a beneficiary of Kiva funds so that he can buy a calf to raise. His greatest wish is to have his own agricultural business and work independently so that he can create better conditions for the future of his family. He has the spirit to succeed and has great leadership within the city.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Ngoné

texts.fr: Ngoné F. est âgée de 36 ans, elle mariée et mère de 6 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de THILAMAKHA depuis 8 ans et demi. Elle a 17 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Son prêt lui permettra de mieux développer son activité d'embouche bovine et ovine. Elle participe activement à la prise en charge de la famille par l'achat de la nourriture et et la prise en charge de la santé.
texts.en:
Ngoné F. is 36 years old, married and has six children in her care. She has been a member of the Village Bank in THILAMAKHA for eight and a half years. She has had 17 consecutive loans. This loan will allow her to develop more easily her beef and sheep fattening business. She contributes actively to providing for her family by buying food and taking care of their health.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her investment activity

loans.name: Jabiel Antonio

texts.es: Jabiel de 32 años de edad, es soltero, habita en la Comarca Villa Alvarez junto a su mamá, a quien le ayuda con las actividades de trabajo del campo, ademas se dedica al cuido de su su pequeña parcela que le heredo su mamá para que iniciara su propio patrimonio,  en la que tiene establecimiento de cultivo, ordeño y cuido de su pequeño inventario ganadero,  brindandoles buen manejo sanitario y nutricional, esta solicitando su 3er crédito para compra de tenero para engordarlos y desarrollarlo para posteriormente comercializarlos cuando obtengan un buen peso con el objetivo de obtener mayores ganancias, con las que brindara mejores condiciones de vida a su núcleo familiar, su mayor sueño es salir adelante, consolidar su inventario ya que es el patrimonio que dejara a sus hijos cuando los tenga.
texts.en:
Jabiel is 32 years old, single, and lives in the Villa Alvarez District with his mother, who helps with the work around the farm. In addition, he looks after a small parcel of land that his mother inherited and will help him start accumulating his own assets. This property will be set aside for raising, nursing, and caring for a small herd of cattle and will help facilitate good sanitation and nutritional management. Jabiel is requesting his third loan to buy calves to fatten and raise for later resale. His objective is for his animals to achieve a good weight so that he can obtain higher earnings and provide better living conditions for his family. He hopes to get ahead and strengthen his herd so that he can leave it as an inheritance for when he has children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La Señora Alicia solicita un nuevo crédito para aumentar su capital y así traer una 
cantidad mucho mayor de mercadería, esto debido a que las dos ultimas semanas de febrero tendrá mucho movimiento y mas demanda del producto.
              
La señora Alicia se dedica a la venta de pescado al por mayor (en latas), se provee de sus parientes que viven en Tiquina (cerca al lago Titicaca) y se dedican a la pesca. La rutina de la señora Alicia comienza los días lunes que viaja a las 4 de la mañana hasta Tiquina para comprar el pescado que pueda a un precio mas bajo por ser pariente de los proveedores, para volver en la tarde y dejar la mayor parte de la mercadería en la Av. Juan Pablo II (final Los Andes) a sus clientes que se encargan de vender la misma por unidad. durante la semana de martes a jueves se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para llegar a la ciudad de el Alto a las 7 30 y cobrar por la mercadería, actualmente la señora incremento sus ventas ya que trae entre 2 a 3 latas mas de pejerrey (el producto que mas le sale) y también consiguió un trabajo de medio tiempo por las tardes como empleada del hogar en Calacoto y recibe un salario mensual e 600 bolivianos aprovechando que su esposo Ramiro sigue trabajando al frente de la casa como albañil y a cargo de los dos niños que todavía no van al colegio.

Esta agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Alicia is asking for a new loan to increase her capital and bring more merchandise because the last two weeks in February she will have a lot of business and more demand for the product. Alicia sells canned fish at wholesale. Her relatives who live in Tiquina (neal Lake Titicaca) are her suppliers; they are fishermen. Her typical routine is a follows: On Mondays, she rises at 4am to travel to Tiquina to buy fish. Because she buys from her relatives, the price she gets is lower. She returns in the afternoon and sells most of her product on Juan Pablo II avenue (cross street: Los Andes) to her customers who then resell it at retail. During the week, from Tuesday to Thursday she rises at 5am in order to be in the city of El Alto by 7:30 to collect on her sales. She has recently increased her sales because she brings between 2 and 3 additional cans of pejerrey (silverside fish), which is the product that sells the most. She also has a part-time job in the afternoon as a domestic employee in a home in Calacoto; she gets a monthly salary of 600 bolivianos for this work. She takes advantage of the fact that her husband, Ramiro, works as a bricklayer in front of their house and he watches over their two children who are not in school yet. She is grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust they have placed in her by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy canned fish.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Don Juan es un pequeño productor de la comarca El Jicaro, su familia la integra su esposa y su hija Maria Jacinta, de 2 año de edad, su principal actividad es la ganaderia y agrícultura,  es dueño de una propiedad, la cual presenta buenas condiciones tècnicas para el desarrollo del hato ganadero, tiene buena infraestructura para el ordeño, él obtiene su mayor ingreso de estas actividades del campo. Esta solicitando su primer credito a AFODENIC esperando contar con el apoyo de Kiva para comprar terneros de desarrollo, para cuidarlos, engordarlos y posteriormente comercializarlos cuando obtengan un buen peso, y asi obterner mayores ganancias que le permitan el sustento familiar. Don Juan sueña con aumentar su inventario ganadero, de esta forma incrementar sus ingreso económicos  y tener mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Don Juan is a small agricultural producer in El Jicaro District. His family includes his wife and their two year old daughter, Maria Jacinta. His main activities are cattle ranching and farming. Juan owns a piece of property that provides good conditions for raising a herd of cattle and has good infrastructure for nursing calves. He earns most of his income from his farming activities.

Juan is requesting his first loan from AFODENIC and hopes to receive the support of Kiva to purchase calves that he can raise, care for, and fatten for later resale when they have achieved a good weight. This will help him obtain better earnings that will allow him to support his family. Don Juan hopes to increase his herd so that he can generate more income and provide a better quality of life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa D. est âgée de 55 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de THILMAKHA depuis 8 ans et demi, elle fait parti des membres du comité de gestion dudit Banc villageois. Elle est très expérimentée en matière de crédit pour en avoir bénéficié 17 fois de suite. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine et ovine et les bénéfices générés par son activité lui permettent de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Awa D. is 55 years old, married and has three children. She has been a member of the Village Bank in THILMAKHA for eight and a half years and she is a member of the management committee of the said bank. She has a good borrowing experience and has had 17 loans. She undertakes beef and sheep fattening, and the profits she generates from her business allow her to support her husband in providing for the family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen and promote her business

loans.name: Donatila Reymunda

texts.es: Donatila Reymunda, es madre de 3 hijos, Abraham de 40 años, Uberlinda de 30 y Juanita de 24, todos le ayuda en las actividades del ordeño y  en las actividades agricola y ganadero, Donatila es dueña de una pequeña finca la cual presenta buenas caracteristicas técnica para el desarrollo del hato ganadero, cuenta con inventario propio. Esta solicitando su primer credito a AFODENIC para la compra de terneros de desarrollo, con el objetivo de cuidarlos, engordarlos y cuando obtengan un buen peso venderlos para obterner mayores ganancias que le permitan mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Su mayor sueño es aumentar su inventario de ganado, pues es el patrimonio que podra heredarle a sus hijos , es muy conocida en la comarca por su liderazgo. Expresa que le gusta trabajar con los credito de institución de AFODENIC, por los interes bajos y la buena atencion que le brindan.
texts.en:
Donatila Reymunda is the mother of three children: Abraham (age 40), Uberlinda (age 30) and Juanita (age 24). All of them help with milking the cows and the other activities that pertain to farming and raising livestock. Donitila owns a small farm that has suitable conditions for raising the herd of cattle that she owns.

She is requesting her first loan from AFODENIC for purchasing calves to raise. Her objective is to care for and fatten them so that they can achieve a good weight for resale. This will help her obtain better earnings so that she can improve her family’s quality of life. Her greatest wish is to increase her herd so that she can leave it as an inheritance for her children. Donatila is well-known in the region for her leadership. She says that she enjoys working with the loans from AFODENIC because of the low interest rates and the good service that she receives.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Doña Maria Teresa es habitante de la colonia Puerto Principe de Nueva Guinea, es casada con el productor Wilfredo Cruz, tiene 6 hijos, los cuales le ayudan al trabajo que desarrolla en las actividades del campo estableciendo cultivos de raices y tuberculos, ordeño y el cuido del hato ganadero, donde obtiene sus ingresos económico, su finca presenta buenas condiciones técnica.  Esta solicitando su 2do credito para compra de terneros para cuidarlos y desarrollarlos, es decir engordarlos para que obtengan un buen peso que al venderlos le permita obtener buenas ganancias que le ayuden a mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. Doña Teresa es una mujer emprendedora en su que hacer de la finca, honesta y de buenas costumbres, sus deseo en el futuro es de incrementar su inventario ganadero, asì tener mejores condiciones para sus hijos, pues es la herencia que podra darles cuando les falte.
texts.en:
Doña Maria Teresa is a resident of the Puerto Principe subdivision of Nueva Guinea. She is married to Wilfredo Cruz, who is an agricultural producer. They have six children who help with the farm activities such as cultivating their root and tuber crops, and nursing and taking care of their cattle herd. Her farm has suitable conditions which help them generate income.

She is requesting her second loan to buy calves to care for and raise. The calves will be fattened to achieve a good weight for resale, which will help them obtain good earnings and help improve the family’s living conditions. Doña Teresa is an enterprising woman who has established her farm through honest work and great discipline. Her wish for the future is to increase her herd so that she can provide her children with better conditions and leave them an inheritance so that they lack nothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Ascencio

texts.es:
El Sr. Ascencio, es cliente nuevo recomendado por su Señora Madre, quien fue cliente antigua y buena  de nuestra Institución, el Señor Ascencio vive solo, ya que hace tiempo se separo de su esposa, la separacion fue un golpe para el pero supo salir adelante por sus dos hijos a quienes mantiene y que continuan estudiando, la actividad que tiene es de transporte urbano, en esta actividad trabaja  ya quince años, los recorridos que realiza son de la zona sur a cualquier punto de la ciudad, teniendo un ingreso semanal de dos mil bolivianos como promedio, por el momento el está con gastos en arreglo de su vivienda por lo que se ve conveniente darle una tasa preferencial. Con el dinero del credito reparara su movilidad.

El Sr. Ascencio esta agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Ascencio is a new client who was recommended by his mother. She has been a long time client and a good client with our institution. Ascencio lives alone because he has been separated from his wife for some time. The separation was a blow for him, but he knew how to get ahead for his two children who he supports and who continue in school. His business is urban transportation. He has worked doing this for 15 years. The routes that he drives are from the southern area to anywhere in the city. He has an average weekly income of 2,000 BOB. At this time he has repair expenses for his house, and it is a good time to get a preferential rate. He will use the money from the loan to repair his vehicle. Ascencio is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in him by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance on his vehicle

loans.name: Daga

texts.fr: Daga N. est mariée, elle est âgée de 32 ans et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois THILMAKHA depuis 8 ans et demi. Elle a 17 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit, son prêt lui permettra de développer une activité de petit commerce de vêtements et de tissus. Elle fait parallèlement de l'élevage de moutons. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Daga N. is married, 32 years old and has two children. She has been a member of the Village Bank in THILMAKHA for eight and half years. She has had 17 consecutive loans. This loan will allow her to develop a small business selling clothes and fabric. At the same time she rears sheep. She contributes to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strength her investment capacity

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: Maria Mercedes pequeña productora del municipio de Nueva Guinea es casada con el señor Henry Leivar, tiene 2 niños,  Juan Carlos de 10 años estudiando 6to grado y Mercedita de 5 años estudia preescolar en el colegio de Villa Alvarez. Maria desde muy pequeña a trabajado en la actividad productiva pues sus padres le enseñaron como es el cuido del ganado y el trabajo a la agricultura, de esta manera pudo realizar su propio inventario ganadero, en la actualidad recibe el apoyo de su esposo para estas actividades.  Esta solicitando su primer crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para compra de ternero desarrollo, con el objetivo de mejorar la calidad de vida del núcleo familiar y comercializarlo a un precio justo donde puede obtener buenas ganancias. Su mayor anhelo es de aumentar su inventario ganadero, brindarle un vida justa y humana a sus hijos, en su comunidad la conocen como una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora, con buenos valores morales.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes is a small cattle rancher in Nueva Guinea. She is married to Henry Leivar and has twho children: Juan Carlos, 10, who is a sixth-grader, and Mercedita, 5, who is a pre-schooler at Villa Alvarez School. Since a very young age, Maria has been in this line of work because her parents taught her how to care for cattle and to farm. She was able to have her own herd of livestock and her husband helps her with her activities. She is asking AFODENIC for her first loan to buy a calf to raise hoping thereby to improve the family's quality of life by selling it at a fair price that will generate good profits. Her greatest wish is to increase the size of her herd and to provide a just and humane life for her children. She is known in her community for being a hard-working, enterprising woman with good moral values.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a calf.

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es: José Miguel, es un joven soltero que habita con su papá y sus hermanos,  desde muy pequeño ha trabajado con su papá en las actividades del ganado y la agricultura, estableciendo cultivos de granos básico, raices y tuberculos, también realiza la comercian de productos lácteos, manteniedo la cadena de compra de la colonia de Naciones Unidas hasta Managua, esta actividad la realiza cada ocho dias donde recibe ingresos adicionales que le ayudan a mejorar sus condiciones de vida.  Esta solicitando su 3er credito para invertirlo en la compra de terneros para cuidarlos y desarrollarlos hasta que obtengan un buen peso y comercializarlos para obtener ganancias que le permitan mejorar el nivel de vida familiar. Jose Miguel es un hombre trabajor, descandose por su diciplina en la comundad como lider, tiene buena referencia personal, principios religiosos,  espera para el futuro aumentar su inventario ganadero.
texts.en:
José Miguel is a young, single man, who lives with his father and siblings. From a very young age he has worked with his father raising cattle and farming. They farm basic grains, roots and tubers. They also sell dairy products starting the production chain in Naciones Unidas and finishing all the way in Managua. This activity takes place once a week and it provides additional income to improve their quality of life. He is asking for his third loan to buy calves to raise until they reach a good weight to sell at a price that will generate good profits to improve the family's quality of life. José Miguel is a hard-working man who stands out as a leader in his community; he has good personal references and religious principles. He hopes in the future to increase the size of his cattle herd.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a calf.

loans.name: Jaime Ramiro

texts.es:
El Sr. Jaime, es cliente nuevo recomendado por su Sr. Padre, quien es cliente antiguo y responsable de Emprender, hace poco él se hizo de pareja, tiene un hijo recien nacido, la pareja se dedica a los trabajos del hogar, en cambio Jaime estudia y trabaja, proximo a egresar como técnico en máquinas, es una persona joven y muy activa, responsable y emprendedor en sus negocios, ya que el viaja por lo menos una vez al mes a conseguir su mercadería a la ciudad de Oruro y a veces hasta Iquique, ya que a la par se dedica a la venta de llantas y repuestos para automoviles.

El deseo del Sr Jaime es el de salir profesional y asi mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, esta agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Jaime is a new client recommended by his father, who is a long-standing, responsible client of Emprender. He became partnered recently and has a new-born son. His partner is a housewife while Jaime studies and works; he is near graduating as a machine technician. He is a young, very active young man who is responsible and enterprising in his businesses. He travels at least once a month to get merchandise in the city of Oruro, sometimes he goes as far as Iquique. He sells tires and automobile spare parts. Jaime's wish is to become a professional in order to improve his family's quality of life. He is grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in him by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy S. est une femme de 40 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois THILMAKHA depuis 4 ans et a bénéficié de 7 crédits qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés régulièrement. Elle fait un petit commerce de sucre, de savon et de biscuits. Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Amy S. is 40 years of age, married and mother of six children, all still under her care. She has been a member of the THILMAKHA “Banc Villageois” loan group for the past four years, and has been granted seven previous loans, all well managed and reimbursed on schedule. She runs a small store selling sugar, soap and cookies. Her objective is to participate in taking care of family expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen and promote her business activity

loans.name: Asuncion Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento ASUNCIÓN es un banco que ya está en su segundo ciclo y el Banco está conformado por 10 Integrantes todas son mujeres y las  socias se dedican al comercio y venta D. comida y otros.

La Sra. FANNY es la presidenta del Banco, esta casada y tiene un hijo pequeño y se dedica a la venta D. carteras y tiene un salon D. eventos en su mismo domicilio y con el prestamo lograra comprar más mercaderia y diseños y decoraciones para su salon y asi para mejorar su calidad D. vida.

La Sra. CARLA es el secretaria en el Banco esta casada y tiene dos hijos y ella es farmaceutica y tiene su farmacia en final buenos aires y con el prestamo comprará más mercaderias para su negocio D. esta forma mejorara sus ingresos economicos y aumentará su capital D. trabajo.

La Sra. YHOVANA es la tesorera del banco y se dedica a la venta D. comida en su mismo domicilio y tiene su pensión y el prestamo se invertirá en compra D. lnsumos requeridos para su venta y así para poder mejorar su calidad D. vida y aumento D. capital D. trabajo.

Todas las socias son personas responsables dinacicas y trabajadoras que en muchos casos sacan a su familia adelante solas, tienen muchos deseos D. superacion y D. mejorar la calidad D. vida D. toda su familia, estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The ASUNCIÓN communal bank is in its second loan cycle; it's maD. up of 10 female members who are involved in various commercial activities, such as: food sales and others. FANNY is the bank president. She's married and has a young son. She sells purses and has an events hall in her home. She will use the funds to buy merchandise, designs and decorations for her events hall thereby improving her quality of life. CARLA is bank secretary. She is married and has two children. She is a pharmacist and her pharmacy is locaten on Final Buenos Aires. She will use the loan to buy merchandise for her business to improve her income and increase her working capital. YHOVANA is bank treasurer and she sells meals from home; she also has a guest house. She will use the loan to buy ingredients for her meals thereby increasing her working capital and her quality of life. All the members are responsible, dynamic, hard-working persons who, in many cases, are the sole support of their families. They very much want to succeed and improve their families' quality of life. They are grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in them in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady N. est une femme de 52 ans , elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc villageois de THILMAKHA depuis 8 ans et demi. Elle y a bénéficié de 17 crédits qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans problème. Elle est détentrice d'une boutique à domicile et son prêt lui permettra de la renforcer en marchandises. Elle y vend du riz, du mil, du sucre, de l'huile etc.. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Khady N. is 52 years old, married and mother of 10 children. She has been a member of the THILMAKHA “Banc Villageois” loan group for the past 8 ½ years, and has been granted 17 previous loans, all reimbursed without problems. She runs a home-based shop selling rice, millet, sugar, vegetable oil, etc., and her loan will allow her to restock her merchandise. She participates in the improvement of her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen and promote her business activity

loans.name: Mbene

texts.fr: Mbène D. est une femme de 60 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de THILMAKHA depuis 8 ans et demi et y a bénéficié de 17 crédits qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans difficultés. Son activité est l'embouche ovine, elle achète les sujets dans les marchés, les engraisse pour les revendre au bout de 5 à 6 mois. Cette activité lui génère de ressources financières lui permettant de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mbène D. is a 60-year old woman who is married and has three children. She has been a member of the Village Bank in THILMAKHA for eight and a half years and has had 17 loans, which she has always repaid without any difficulty. Her activity is beef fattening; she buys her animals in markets and fattens them up to resell them after five or six months. This activity generates financial resources which allow her to contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen and sustain her activity

loans.name: Evelyn Patricia

texts.es:
La Sra. Evelyn, tiene 24 años de edad, se encuentra casada con don Erick con el que tiene un hijo, viven en un departamento en alquiler, la señora tiene como actividad la venta de comida, la misma que se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Las Lomas cerca a la Rotonda donde vende comida en horarios de la noche tiene un menu variado, es responsable y muy trabajadora con el dinero del credito quiere ampliar su lugar de venta ya que tiene muchos clientes y tambien quiere aumentar la variedad de sus platos y poder tomar en anticrético el local de lado del mismo domicilio, pues es mas amplio y le permite colocar más mesas, pues cuenta con una amplia lista de clientes asiduos.

Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada con la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Evelyn, 24, is married to Erick; they have a son and they live in a rented apartment. She sells prepared meals in the Las Lomas neighborhood near La Rotonda. She sells meals during the evenings and has a varied menu. She is responsible and hard-working. She will use the funds to enlarge her sales point because she has a lot of customers. She also wants to increase the variety of dishes she offers and to take over the site next door using the anticrético modality (a transaction not available in the U.S. whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you) because it is quite large and allows for more tables because she has a very large group of regular customers. She is very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in her by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarger her restaurant.

loans.name: Absa

texts.fr: Absa D. est une femme de 56 ans, Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de THILMAKHA depuis 6 ans et demi. Elle a 13 de fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle fait de la transformation de vente d'huile d'arachide. Cette activité lui procure des bénéfices qui lui permettent de participer au bien-être familiale.
texts.en:
Absa D. is a 56-year old woman. She is married and mother to three children. She has been a member of the Village Bank in THILMAKHA for six and a half years. She has 13 consecutive loans and has never had any problem repaying them. She processes and sells peanut oil. This activity brings her sufficient profits to contribute to her family's well being.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen and promote her activity

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma es socia del Banco Comunal Perla.
Norma es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 3 hijos, Norma tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende abarrotes en general y especerías, actividad que realiza todos los días. Norma necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ají, comino, canela, arroz y azúcar.
Norma sueña con salir adelante y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the Perla (Pearl) communal bank. She lives with her life partner, is 32 years old, and has three children. Norma has a stand in the 12 de Abril market where she sells groceries and spices every day. Norma needs 1050 soles to buy chili, cumin, cinnamon, rice and sugar. Norma dreams with getting ahead in life and providing a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chili, cumin, cinnamon, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio es socio del Banco Comunal Perla.
Lucio es soltera, tiene 45 años y 2 hijos, Lucio es mecánico automotriz, tiene un taller en un local alquilado, tiene un personal que le ayuda en el taller, además Lucio vende repuestos en el mismo local.
Lucio necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de repuestos.
Los sueños de Lucio son progresar mas y que sus familia tenga estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Lucio is a member of the Perla (Pearl) communal bank. Lucio is single, 45 years old, and has two children. He is an automobile mechanic. He rents his shop and has an assistant that helps him; Lucio also sells spare parts in his shop. Lucio needs 1050 soles to buy spare parts. Lucio's dream is to make more progress and that his family have economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Perla.
Maria es casada, tiene 29 años y 2 hijos, Maria tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, además vende productos de limpieza personal al por mayor, reparte a las tiendas.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Maria son ampliar su negocio, tener una empresa y buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of Perla (Pearl) communal bank. Maria is married, 29 years old, and has two children. Maria has a grocery store in her home where she sells general merchandise, vegetables, and meats; she also sells personal cleanling items at wholesale, she distributes to other stores. Maria needs a 1200 sol loan to buy rice and sugar. Maria's dream is to enlarge her business, own a company and provide good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: 29 De Enero Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “29 de enero” esta representado por la señora Dioselina y conformado por 14 miembros donde 3 son varones y 11 son mujeres donde todos se apoyan mutuamente. La señora Fátima es casada y tiene 3 niños en edad escolar el mayor esta en colegio y los otros dos pequeños están en escuelas primarias, la señora Fátima se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su propio hogar montando una pequeña tienda de barrio en la cual tiene también la venta de aceites, sodas y enlatados y desea poder agrandas su negocio con muchos mas productos y conservas es por esta razón que requiere del financiamiento; en cuanto a sus expectativas a futuro ella  desea poder agrandar su casa y hacerle algunas refacciones, también poder darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos con una buena educación y un techo mas confortable para el desarrollo de sus actividades. El resto de las socias de este banco comunal tiene su negocio de venta de cosméticos, comida, abarrotes, joyas de fantasía, y negocios como salones de belleza, transporte en moto-taxis y empleos domésticos. Dentro del ámbito comercial la competencia es alta pero loas socios saben como sacar adelante sus negocios con el cambio de mercadería o el traslados de la misma a mercados zonales o ferias de barrio obteniendo clientes leales a su trabajo y que confían en la mercadería que venden.  El destino del financiamiento es para poder ampliar un poco mas su negocio con la adquisición de mercadería, herramientas de trabajo, insumos y con una mejor comodidad para sus clientes. La mayoría de los miembros del grupo son nuevos pero con mucha experiencia en grupos solidarios gracias a créditos en otras instituciones similares, pero se encuentran satisfechos con la descripción del trabajo a realizar con la fundación Agrocapital demostrando unidad en cada una de sus reuniones previas.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “29 de Enero” (January 29th) is led by Sra. Dioselina and consists of 14 members (3 men and 11 women) who are mutually supportive of one another.

Sra. Fátima is married and has three school-age children. The oldest is in high school, while the other two are in elementary school. Sra. Fátima manages a small neighborhood grocery store located inside of her home. She sells products such as oil, sodas, and canned goods and hopes to expand her business by adding more products. For this reason she is requesting a loan. In the future, she hopes to enlarge her house and make a few repairs. She also wants to provide her children with a good future by paying for a good education and having a comfortable home where they can develop in all of their activities.

The other members of this Communal Bank have businesses involving cosmetics, food, groceries, fine jewelry, beauty salons, motorcycle taxis, and housekeeping services. Competition is high in the commercial sector, but the members know what it takes to succeed in their businesses by turning over their merchandise or establishing their businesses at the regional markets or neighborhood fairs where they can obtain the most loyal customers who are in need of their products. This loan will be used to expand their businesses by purchasing merchandise, equipment, and supplies. They will also provide more comfortable conditions for their customers. Most of the members are new to the group, but they have plenty of experience working with solidarity group loans at other institutions. They are satisfied with the objectives they have to achieve with Fundación Agrocapital and so far have demonstrated teamwork in each of their previous meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Carmen Milagros

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Perla.
Carmen es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 1 hijo, Carmen vende leña en su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Carmen junto a su esposo se dedican a la reventa de gaseosas, para lo cual tiene un carro.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña.
Los sueños de Carmen son aumentar su negocio y brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Communal Bank “Perla” (Pearl). She is 34 years old, in a common law marriage, and has one child. Carmen sells firewood from her house, an activity she engages in every day. Her husband has a car from which he sells soft drinks.

Carmen needs a loan of 1200 PEN to purchase firewood. Her dreams are to increase her business and provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto es socio del Banco Comunal Perla.
Humberto es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Humberto tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende repuestos, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Humberto necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de repuestos.
El sueño de Humberto es progresar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Humberto is a member of the Communal Bank “Perla” (Pearl). He is 30 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Humberto has a store in a rented location from which he sells spare parts, an activity he engages in every day.

Humberto needs a loan of 1200 PEN in order to buy more parts. His dream is to keep progressing in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts

loans.name: Las Cariñosa Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Las Cariñosa” esta representado por la señora Petrona y conformado por 15 miembros los cuales 3 son varones y 12 mujeres los cuales han demostrado ser unidos y muy trabajadores todos  residen en el mismo barrio y se conocen a la perfección. 

La señora Petrona tiene una niña en edad escolar y esta casada, vive por el momento en la casa de sus mama pero desea independizarse y conseguir una casa en alquiler o anticrítico su esposo es transportista y le ayuda con los gastos de la casa y con la educación de su niña, la señora Petrona se dedica a la costura de prendas de vestir teniendo clientes a las cuales les gusta el acabado de las prendas pero para seguir creciendo requiere adquirir una surf hiladora y una bordadora y poder expandir su negocio en al M. de la confección de prendas al por mayor y obtener mejores ingresos que le permitan cumplir su deseo de poder obtener un techo para su familia y un mejor futuro para su hija y su esposo. 

El resto de los socios se dedican a la  venta de comida, promotoras líderes de Avon, Yambal, Esika, venta de leche, pan, dulces y a la elaboración de muebles a pedido y don Alberto se dedica  a la música. La competencia no representa mayores dificultades donde ellos tienen sus puestos de venta gracias a la buena ubicación de sus negocios que son paradas de flotas y buses Inter departamentales y locales. El crédito será utilizado en el mejoramiento de sus negocios con la compra de insumos, mercadería y la compra de herramientas para efectuar un trabajo más eficiente y obtener un mejor ingreso para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias y poder darles un hogar mejor establecidos. La gran mayoría de los clientes tienen experiencia de trabajar bajo la modalidad de banca comunal, gracias a créditos en instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital con la cual están agradecidos por el apoyo económico y la confianza brindada.
Lamentablemente dos personas de las cuales se ven solo parte de sus rostros porque se escondieron al momento de la fotografía.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Cariñosa” (The Affectionate Ones) is led by Sra. Petrona and consists of 15 members, 3 men and 12 women, who have proven to be united and hardworking. They all live in the same neighborhood and know each other perfectly. Sra. Petrona is married and has a school-age daughter. At the moment, she lives at her mother’s house but wishes to become independent and either rent a house or secure one through an “anticretico” arrangement (the owner pawns the property to the renter). Her husband works as a driver and contributes toward the household expenses and their daughter’s education. Sra. Petrona sews garments and her customers like the finishing touches she puts on her dresses. In order to expand her business, she wants to acquire a spinning machine and an embroidery machine so that she can start making garments in bulk and generate better income. She hopes to fulfill her dream of securing a home for her family and providing a better future for her daughter and husband. The other members are engaged in selling food, cosmetics (such as Avon, Yambal, and Esika), milk, bread, and sweets. Some make furniture and Don Alberto is a musician. The competition does not present great difficulty since their vending posts are well-located near the local and inter-district bus terminals. This loan will be used to improve their businesses by purchasing supplies, merchandise, and equipment to help them become more efficient and generate better income to provide their families a better quality of life and stable households. Most of the members have been part of a solidarity group as a result of the loans they have received from other institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital. They are grateful for the financial support and trust that is being demonstrated to them. Unfortunately, two group members hid when the photo was taken, so only part of their faces are visible.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
El Banco de Emprendimiento LAS TRIUNFADORAS, representadas por su mesa directiva 

La Sra. Ceferina tiene como actividad la venta de plasticos en general en la Av principal de Villa Fátima, esta casada y tiene hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, con el dinero del credito comprara mercaderia al por mayor y asi poder surtir su puesto de venta para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

La Sra. Patricia es la Secretaria de Actas, su actividad es pormotora de cosméticos y venta de chompas a pedido en su mismo domicilio,esta casada y con el dinero del credito comprara productos de belleza al por mayor ya que esta de promocion y despues poder venderlos al precio original.

El sr. Victor V. es el tesorero, su actividad es la elboración y venta de manzanas con dulce en diferentes ferias de La Paz, Cochabamba y Oruro. Estas tres personas son la  cabeza del banco de emprendimiento conformada por 8 personas que se garantizan, se conocen y se colaboran mutuamente para este crédito el 80% tiene negocio rentable  y fijo el otro  20% es ambulante pero son personas responsables y esta es su segunda secuencia.

Todas las socias estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Las Triunfadoras (The Winners) communal bank is represented by its governing board. Ceferina sells assorted plastic items in Villa Fátima's main avenue. She is married and has school-age children. She will use the funds to buy merchandise at wholesale so that she can stock her sales stand and offer better customer service. Patricia is recording secretary. She sells cosmetics and sweaters on order at home. She is married and will use the funds to buy beauty products at wholesale that are on sale so that she can then sell them at full price. Victor Velasques is treasurer. He makes and sells candied apples in various markets in La Paz, Cochabamba and Oruro. These three people are the bank leaders. The bank is made up of 8 people who back each other up, know each other well and collaborate on this loan. 80% have fixed, profitable businesses and 20% are peddlers but all are responsible people. This is their second loan cycle. They are all grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in the by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Tarija Group

texts.es: El grupo “Tarija” esta representado por la señora Lucia y conformado por 14 miembros 10 mujeres y cuatro varones los cuales residen en la misma zona y se conocen bien. La señora Fabiola es la socia destacada en este grupo debido a que es madre soltera de un niños y se dedica  a la elaboración y distribución de pan casero el cual reparte a algunas tiendas cercanas y el resto del producto lo vende en la esquina de la casa de sus mama en la cual reside por el momento, es una persona muy inteligente y capaz, pero para poder obtener un ingreso extra para mantener a su hijo requiere agrandar su negocio es por esta razón que solicita el crédito para la compa de mas insumos y un horno de mayor proporción que le ayude a generar mayores ingresos para poder ayudar a su madre que ya es mayor de edad y poder salir adelante con la educación de su pequeño. El resto de las socias tienen su negocio como la venta de hamburguesa, venta de comida, venta de productos de cosméticos, frutas y al servicio de soldadura y transporte público de pasajeros. La competencia en el M. es alta y es realmente difícil, especialmente en la venta de comida y en la venta de cosméticos que no cuentan con mucho capital disponible para trabajar. El crédito será utilizado en el mejoramiento de sus negocios con la compra de insumos, mercadería y la compra de herramientas para efectuar un trabajo más eficiente y obtener un mejor ingreso para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias y poder darles un hogar mejor establecidos. La gran mayoría de los clientes tienen experiencia de trabajar bajo la modalidad de banca comunal, gracias a créditos en instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital con la cual están agradecidos por el apoyo económico y la confianza brindad.
texts.en:
The “Tarija” Group is led by Sra. Lucia and consists of 14 members (10 women and 4 men) who live in the same area and know each other well. Sra. Fabiola is a distinguished member of the group who is a single mother of one child. She produces homemade bread and distributes some of it to nearby shops. The rest of it is sold from the corner of her mother’s house, where she resides for the moment. Fabiola is a highly intelligent and capable person, but in order to generate extra income to support her child, she needs to enlarge her business. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy more supplies and a larger oven to help generate more income so that she can help her elderly mother and pay for her child’s education. The remaining members have businesses selling hamburgers, food, cosmetics, fruit, or providing services such as welding and public transportation. Competition in the marketplace is high and really difficult, especially in the food and cosmetics businesses in which there is little available operating capital. This loan will be used to improve their businesses by purchasing supplies, merchandise, and equipment to make their work more efficient and help generate additional income to improve their families’ quality of life and provide them with stable homes. Most of the members have experience working in a Communal Bank setting because they have taken out loans with other institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital. The members are grateful for the financial support and the trust being placed in them.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Javier Oswaldo

texts.es:
Javier es un padre de familia de 39 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en Puerto Malabrigo, distrito de Razuri, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace ocho años a trabajar en una empresa procesadora de pescado, Puerto Malabrigo es conocido en la zona por poseer varias plantas de procesamiento de este producto hidrobiológico para su conversión en harina de pescado. La mayoría de los pobladores encuentran en estas fabricas una fuente de trabajo e ingreso económico para sacar a su familia adelante.

Tal es el caso de Javier, que se apoya en este trabajo para mantener a su familia, los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le han permitido mantenerlos sin problema, pero hace unas semanas las lluvias que azotaron las ciudades del norte del país, hicieron algunos daños en la estructura de su vivienda. Por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de materiales para hacer mejoras en la estructura de su vivienda.

Javier es una persona honesta y muy trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es instalar una bodega en su vivienda con la cual la economía de su familia goce de un ingreso extra y de mayor estabilidad. El es conocido y respetado por sus vecinos quienes lo consideran un hombre honorable y que siempre ayuda a los que lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Javier, 39, lives with his wife and children in Puerto Malabrigo, Razuri district, Ascope province, La Libertad region, which is three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region. For the last 8 years he has worked for a fish processing plant. Puerto Malabrigo is well known in the area for having several fish processing plants specializing in turning fish into fish meal. Most of the area residents find employment and income to support their families in these plants. Such is Javier’s case. He relies on this job to support his family. Income from this work has made it possible for him to support them problem-free. However, a few weeks ago heavy rains pelted the cities in the north of the country causing structural damage to his house. For this reason, he is asking Edpyme Alternativa, for the first time, for a loan of 1000 new soles to buy building materials to repair his house. Javier is an honest, very hard-working person. His greatest wish is to set up a store in his home so that the family’s economy can enjoy an extra source of income and more stability. He is known and respected by his neighbors who consider him to be an honorable man who always helps those in need.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

location.town: Puerto Malabrigo - Rázuri - Ascope - La Libertad

loans.name: Betsi

texts.es:
Betsi es socia del Banco Comunal Perla.
Betsi es casada, tiene 50 años y 4 hijos, Betsi vende comida típica en su casa, actividad que realiza los días domingos, además Betsi se dedica a la preparación de tortas y postres a pedido.
Betsi necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina, gelatina, azúcar.
Betsi sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y progresar.
texts.en:
Betsi is a member of the Perla (Pearl) communal bank. Betsi is married, 50 years old and has 4 children. She sells typical meals in her home on Sundays. In addition, Betsi makes cakes and desserts to order. Betsi needs 1200 soles to buy flour, gelatin and sugar. Betsi dreams that her children become professionals and succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, gelatin, sugar.

loans.name: 1Ro De Febrero Group

texts.es: El grupo  “1ro. D. Febrero” esta representado por la señora Mariluz  y conformada por 19 miembros,  14 mujeres y 5 varones todos residentes D. la misma zona.  La socia destacada del grupo es la señora Juanita que tiene tres hijos su esposo es chofer D. una línea D. minibuses y vive en un alquiler en una casa independiente por el momento, ella se dedica a lavar ropa para los vecinos y gente D. confianza por un costo D. 6 bolivianos la docena, es una señora muy trabajadora y sacrificada los sábados realiza pavitas y otro sándwich para llevar a la P. D. trufis donD. trabaja su esposo y ganarse algo extra para el sustento D. su hogar y ahorrar para comprarse un lote y darle a sus hijos un hogar, La señora Juanita desea el financiamiento para capital D. trabajo y empezar un negocio mas establecido D. venta D.  comida ya que le va viven los fines D. semana vendiendo sándwiches y comida rápida, su mayor expectativa es poder obtener un buen capital para comprarse un lote y hacerse una casita para que vivan tranquila su familia sin pagar alquileres. El resto D. las socias se dedica a la  venta D. hamburguesa, venta D. pan, venta D. comida, venta D. productos D. cosméticos. La competencia entre las socias es realmente difícil, especialmente en la venta D. comida y en la venta D. cosméticos, ya que cada socia espera cada día un buen resultado en sus ventas. El crédito lo destinaran para poder surtir sus tiendas y comprar más productos y ofrecer mejores servicios a sus clientes para que a futuro tengan sus negocios con mayores ingresos y una mejor situación económica. Como es un grupo nuevo se les ha dado una capacitación que están satisfechas y contentas D. ser clientes D. Agrocapital  pero algunas D. las socias ya poseen experiencia gracias a créditos similares en otras entidades
texts.en:
The “1 D. Febrero” group is represented by Mariluz and maD. up of 19 members: 14 women and 5 men, all residents of the same area. The member we are highlighting is Juanita. She has three children and her husband is a minibus driver. They live in a rented house at present. She takes in laundry at 6 bolivianos per dozen. She is very hard-working has had a difficult life. On Saturdays she makes sandwiches that she takes to the minibus stop where her husband works to sell in order to make a little extra for household expenses and perhaps save a little to buy a lot and proviD. a home for her children. Juanita wants financing to launch a more settled food sales business because she does well on weekends selling sandwiches and fast food. Her greatest expectation is to acquire capital to buy a lot and build a house where her family can live peacefully not having to pay rent. The rest of the group members are involved in the following: hamburger sales, food sales, cosmetic sales. Competition among them is quite difficult, especially in food and cosmetics sales, since each one expects a good result from her daily sales. They will use the funds to stock their stores, to buy more merchandise, and to offer better customer service so that their business will earn higher income in the future and they will have a better economic situation as a result. Because this is a new group, they have been given training and they are happy to be Agrocapital clients although some of the members already have some degree of experience thanks to loans they have with other similar entities.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital.

loans.name: Las Bendecidas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Bendecidas” esta representado por la señora Amparo y conformado por 14 miembros los cuales van cursando un segundo ciclo demostrando unidad, responsabilidad y ganas de seguir ¡creciendo para salir adelante y progresar mas cada día. La señora amparo C. P. (presidenta) tiene su negocio de venta de cosméticos y gracias a su esfuerzo ella sigue adelante en su trabajo día a día, ella tiene 2 hijos y separada de su esposo por lo que sabe sobrellevar las cosas para sacar adelante a sus hijos, es una mujer trabajadora y a demostrado ser muy responsable, ella vive en anticrítico, y sueña con tener su propio hogar donde pueda vivir ella y sus dos hijos, por ello la señora Amparo se esta esforzando mucho para poder llegar a su sueño, el destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para poder seguir creciendo en su negocio. En este grupo todos son multifacéticos, les gusta trabajar mucho, tienen venta de comida, venta de abarrotes, venta de pollos, venta de refrescos y empanadas, venta de leche, venta de verduras, venta de majablanco y otros. En este caso no hay competencia porque todos tienen diferentes negocios y todos les va muy bien porque salen a distintos puntos de venta tanto en la ciudad como en las afueras de ella para poder vender su mercadería. El destino del crédito es  para poder incrementar sus insumos, mercaderías y productos para poder obtener mejores ingresos y para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Las socias ya tiene bastante experiencia con respecto a lo que es créditos solidarios, es un grupo antiguo, y muy bueno, termino muy bien en su primer crédito con nosotros y hasta la fecha siguen demostrando ser gente muy trabajadora y responsable por lo que la Institución les brinda un nuevo apoyo económico para que puedan progresar y darles a sus familias una mejor calida de vida.
texts.en:
The “Las Bendecidas” (The Blessed Ones) is represented by Amparo and made up of 14 members who are in their second loan cycle. They have shown unity, responsibility and the desire to continue growing to get ahead and make more progress every day. Amparo C. P. (group president) has a cosmetics sales business. Thanks to her efforts, she continues to move forward in her work day to day. She has two children and is separated from her husband. Because of this, she overcomes obstacles in order to get her children ahead in life. She’s a hard-working woman and has shown herself to be very responsible. She lives under the anticretico modality (a transaction not available in the U.S. whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you) and dreams with having her own home for her and her two children. Amparo is making a great effort to reach this goal. She will use the funds as working capital to continue growing in her business. All the members of this group are multifaceted; they enjoy work very much. Some sell food; others sell groceries, chickens, soft-drinks and turnovers. Some sell milk, others vegetables. Some sell maja blanco (a sweet). In this case, competition is non-existent because they all have different businesses and they all do well because they go out to different points of sale both within the city and to its outskirts in order to sell their merchandise. The funds will be used to increase their ingredients, supplies and products in order to generate better income and meet customer demand. The members already have quite a bit of experience in the field of group loans. This is an established, very good group. They completed their first loan cycle well with us and, to date, continue to prove themselves as being very hard-working and responsible people. The institution, therefore, grants new economic support to them so that they may continue to succeed and provide their families with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital.

loans.name: Felicita Esperanza

texts.es:
Felicita P. de 34 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y solo cuenta con luz como servicios básicos. Su esposo es agricultor con el tiene una niña de 2 años. 

Felicita inicio  hace 2 años su negocio con la ayuda de su hermana vendiendo arroz y azúcar a las afuera de su casa. Aunque era de molestia el polvo de la calle ella continúo con su negocio.  

Ahora ella tiene una pequeña tienda. Trabaja todos los días desde las 06h30 hasta las 19h00, vende arroz, azúcar, aceites etc. Una de las complicaciones que tiene es ir a comprar los productos al mercado porque tiene que evitar que le roben. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar enlatados, embutidos y bebidas para su tienda. En el futuro quiere tener una papelería.
texts.en:
Felicita P., 34, lives in a periurban zone of Paraíso de Guayaquil. Her house is cement and the only basic service it has is electricity. Her husband is a farmer and they have a 2-year-old daughter. Felicita began selling rice and sugar outside her house two years ago with her sister's help. Although the dust from the street was a real nuisance, she continued with this work. Now, she has a small store. She is open for business every day from 6:30am until 7pm; she sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc. One of her obstacles is having to go to the market to buy her supplies because she has to avoid being robbed. She will use the loan to buy canned goods, cured meats and beverages for her store. In the future she would like to have a stationery store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For canned goods, cured meats, beverages.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma S. is a 57-year-old married woman who lives in Cogon 1, Brgy. Alimango, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running a general store.

Her husband, Edwin, is 49 years old and has a repair shop business. They have four children who are between 25 and 31 years old, all of whom earn their own living and help support the family's household needs.

Guillerma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in her business. Now she earns an average monthly income of $90 from her business activities.

Guillerma is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of 11,000 PHP was used to fund the operations of her general store, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is on her 9th cycle loan which she intends to use as working capital for her general store. Guillerma is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie G. is a 48-year-old married woman who lives in Nangka, Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by running a rice retailing business.

Her husband, Ricardo, is 51 years old and works driving a habal habal (a single motorcycle that is the only mode of transportation in most  mountainous areas). They have two children who are 20 and 21 years old.  One works as a delivery boy and the other helps her parents in their business.

Rosemarie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in the rice retailing business. Now she earns an average monthly income of $326 from her business activities.

Rosemarie is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP was used to fund the operations of her rice retailing business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is on her 15th cycle loan, in the amount of 23,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional working capital for her rice retailing business. Rosemarie is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
Evangelina es una madre de familia de 61 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace más de diez años en un pequeño kiosko ubicado a un lado de la carretera Panamericana (la carretera mas importante del país que atraviesa la ciudad), allí ella ofrece desayunos y almuerzos, también vende caldos de gallina, que son muy consumidos por los choferes que tienen que cubrir rutas largas.

Este negocio ha sido de mucha importancia para su familia, ya que con el sacó adelante a sus hijos, que ahora ya son independientes, su esposo trabaja como obrero agrícola en una empresa agroindustrial de la zona y con el dinero que ambos juntaban han podido mantenerse durante todo este tiempo.

Evangelina desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más insumos con los cuales pueda preparar más platos de comida, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Evangelina es una mujer bastante alegre y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y llegar a tener un restaurante. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Evangelina, 61, lives with her husband in Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region, which is two-and-a-half hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. For over 10 years now she has sold food in a small stand located along the Pan-American Highway (the most important highway in the country; it goes through the city). She offers breakfasts and lunches (she also sells chicken soup) that are very popular with long-haul drivers. This business has been very important to her family because it has made it possible for her to raise her children, all of whom are now independent. Her husband is an agricultural laborer for an agro industrial firm in the area. The money they both earn has allowed them to support themselves all this time. Evangelina wants to enlarge her business, to buy more ingredients so that she can prepare more dishes. She is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan that will help her reach this goal. Evangelina is a hard-working, quite cheerful woman. Her greatest wish is to continue to grow as a businesswoman and to have a restaurant some day. She has collaborated with our institution previously and has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality with respect to repayment commitments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meals.

loans.name: Mil Flores Group

texts.es:
Mil flores es un grupo unido y que trabaja en equipo  esto es debido según expresaron a que se conocen desde hace tiempo y saben la importancia de trabajar en equipo para sus negocios. La coordinadora de este grupo es señora Ángela María López A. es dueña de una pequeña venta que instalo en su hogar y la cual su hija de 14 años atiende por las tardes luego de clases mientras López y su esposo trabajan. 
	
Las otras integrantes del grupo son María Teresa
texts.en: Mil Flores (Thousand Flowers) is a united group that works as a team. The members have known each other for a long time and know the importance of working together for their businesses. The group's coordinator is Ángela María López A., who runs a small convenience store out of her home, which her 14-year-old daughter tends to in the afternoon while Ángela and her husband work. The other members are María Teresa

loans.use: Purchase products such as basic grains, meat, sausages, etc.

loans.name: Sarita Group

texts.es:
Sarita es un grupo  integrado por  tres mujeres trabajadoras y  unidas una de ellas es la señora Adela de los Ángeles Pavón quien desde hace 7 años tiene una pulpería. Ella junto a dos de sus hijos trabajan en conjunto apoyándose mutuamente  en el negocio el cual ha ido mejorando.

Las otras integrantes son Yohana D.  quien tiene una fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en la venta de alimentos fritos y Natividad Mercedes Pavón también tiene una Fritanga.
texts.en:
The Sarita Group consists of three hard-working and united women, including Adela de los Ángeles Pavón, who for the past seven years has had a convenience store. She along with her two children work together to support each other in the business, which has been improving. The other members are Yohana D., who has a popular fried-food stand, and Natividad Mercedes Pavón, who also has a fried-food stand.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products such as basic grains, sausages, meat, etc.

loans.name: Cereza Group

texts.es:
El grupo Cereza lo integran tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es la joven Linda Urania F. López quien como muchas jóvenes nicaragüenses son madres y padre para sus hijos. Ella con tan solo quince años tuvo que aprender a ser estudiante, madre y comerciante lo cual ha logrado durante estos seis años.  F. se dedica a la venta de cerdo y todos sus derivados como nacatamales, frito, chicharro, moronga en fin platos típicos a base de este animal.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son María Milagros A. M. vende café, cigarros, galletas, bombones entre otros productos y María Leonida Galán comercializa platanitos, frescos y helados desde hace 19 años.
texts.en:
The Cereza (Cherry) Group consists of three hard-working women, including Linda Urania F. López, a young woman who like many Nicaraguans her age is a parent to children. In only 15 years she had to learn how to be a student, a mother and a merchant, a job she has been doing for the past six years. Linda makes a living selling pork in all varieties, such as tamales, fried pork, rinds, sausage in typical regional dishes. The other members are María Milagros A. M., who sells coffee, cigars, cookies and chocolates, among other products, and María Leonida Galán, who has sold plantains, sweets and ice creams for the past 19 years.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food products

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “YANAPAY”, ella vive en la ciudad del Cusco y se reúne cada treinta días en el distrito de Wanchaq en el local de Asociación Arariwa. La palabra quechua “Yanapay” traducido al castellano significa “Ayuda”.  

Francisca tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene cuatro hijos (Rai, Larry, Mario y Alison), ella vende quesos en el mercado “Molino II” y hace 19 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, la socia antes vendía de manera ambulatoria y ahora con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio tiene su propio stand. Francisca requiere el préstamo para comprar más quesos, aceitunas, huevos y quesos, ella hace un año que es socia de la Asociación Arariwa. 

La socia en general agradece la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Francisca belongs to the "Yanapay" (Quechua for "Help") Community Bank and lives in the city of Cusco. She meets every month with Kiva partner Asociación Arariwa at its site in the district of Wanchaq. Francisca is 35 years old, lives with her partner and has four children (Rai, Larry, Mario and Alison). She has sold cheeses at the Molino II market for the past 19 years, and it has gone very well thanks to all the effort she puts into her work. She previously sold her products as street vendor but now with a lot of hard work and sacrifice she has her own stand. Francisca is requesting the loan to purchase more cheeses, olives and eggs. She has been a member of Asociación Arariwa for one year and is grateful for the opportunity it provides. She promises to fulfill her payments in the established time period.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cheeses, olives and eggs

loans.name: Ana Del Pilar

texts.es:
Ana es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el sector La Pradera, una zona urbano marginal situada a cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace dos años adquirió una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) con la cual se genera el sustento para sacar adelante a su familia, el vehículo es manejado por su esposo dentro de la ciudad de Chiclayo y este es la unica herramienta de trabajo mediante la cual se generan ingresos.

El continuo uso brindado a la mototaxi y la mala situación de algunas carreteras por donde transita ha hecho que la unidad movil empiece a sufrir algunos desperfectos que requieren de reparacion urgente para que el vehículo siga funcionando, por ello Ana se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles.

Ana es una mujer honesta y muy entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es ver convertidos a sus menores hijos en unos profesionales exitosos. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Ana is a 32-year-old mother who lives with her husband and her two children in La Pradera, an urban zone situated five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Two years ago she acquired a mototaxi, with which she has been able to earn a livelihood to keep her family moving forward. Her husband drives the mototaxi within the city of Chiclayo, and it is their sole means of income. The continued use of the vehicle and the poor condition of some of the thoroughfares has caused damages to the mototaxi that require urgent repairs in order for it to keep working. Because of this, Ana has seen the necessity to request a loan of 700 soles from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa. Ana is an honest woman who is very devoted to her family. Her biggest goal is to see her children becomes successful professionals. She has previously worked with this lending institution and has shown herself to be a punctual and responsible client.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairs and maintenance for mototaxi

loans.name: Mainiqui Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “MAINIQUE”, actualmente se encuentra en el III ciclo y esta conformado por 16 mujeres trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, es un banco comunal conformado por socias que viven en la provincia D. Urubamba del departamento Cusco que se encuentra ubicada a 50 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco, Cusco urbe se caracteriza por su Centro Histórico, sus paisajes, su historia siendo una ciudad encantadora D. la Región Sur del país. 

Las actividades económicas D. los socios a las que se dedican son el comercio D. productos agrícolas y servicios D. venta D. artesanía. El banco comunal tiene varios ciclos D. funcionamiento, como manifiestan las socias, se encuentran contentas y satisfechas con los servicios D. crédito, ahorro y capacitación, por el tiempo D. permanencia en el banco comunal un aspecto D. valoración es el ahorro por la posibilidad D. capitalización que les brinda este servicio. 

Feliciana es socia del banco comunal Mainique, tiene 48 años D. edad, es casada y madre D. seis hijos D. las cuales 4 son independientes y dos dependen D. ella todavía, sus hijos menores estudian en el colegio. Feliciana se dedica a la venta D. jora (Maíz fermentado) en el mercado modelo D. Urubamba y también hace chicha (bebida regional del sur del Perú elaborada a base D. Jora). Feliciana nos cuenta que también alquila un terreno donD. cultiva productos agrícolas y después D. cosechar manda para vender a las ciudades D. Quillabamba y Cusco. La socia requiere el crédito para comprar maíz. El sueño D. la socia es hacer graduar a su hija mayor como profesional D. guía D. turismo.
texts.en:
The “MAINIQUE” communal bank is currently in its 3rd cycle. It is maD. up of 16 hard working women who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead and who strive daily to give their children a better future. The members of the communal bank live in Urubamba province, department of Cusco, located 50 minutes from the city of Cusco. The city of Cusco is known for its Historic Center, its scenery and its history as an enchanting city in the Southern Region of the country. The members make their livings with the sales of agricultural products and handicrafts. The communal bank has been active for several cycles, as evidenced by the members, who are happy and satisfied with the credit, savings and training services. An ongoing valuable aspect of the communal bank is the service offered of group savings, which allows for the possibility of building up capital. Feliciana is a member of the Mainique communal bank. She is 48 years old, married and the mother of six children, 4 of whom live independently from her and two who are still dependent. Her younger children are in school. Feliciana makes her living selling "jora" (fermented corn) in Urubamba's standard market, and she also makes "chicha" (a regional beverage of southern Perú maD. with a base of Jora). Feliciana tells us that she also rents a plot of land where she grows agricultural products, and after the harvest sends them to be sold in the cities of Quillabamba and Cusco. This member needs the loan to purchase corn. Her dream is to help her oldest daughter graduate as a professional tour guiD..

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member needs the loan to purchase corn.

loans.name: Jilma

texts.en:
Jilma C. is from the village of Dr. Jose Rizal. She is 45 years old. Jilma is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she sells a variety of fruits to members of the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $158 a month from this activity.
