loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret W. M. is 47 years old. She has three children who range in age from 20 to 25 years old. She makes a living in the town of Ngong, Kenya by raising cows and selling their milk. She would like to diversify her business by applying for a loan of Kes 40,000 to buy inventory for a new retail shop. While she does this, she hopes to continue to engage in her true passion, which is dairy farming. She works very hard to keep her business doing well and hopes to make all her dreams come true.

loans.use: To open a new retail shop.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is 23 years old and lives in Bint Jbeil southern Lebanon. For the last two years, he has made a living selling CDs and cassettes. He also owns DJ equipment, which he rents our for private parties. When he started his business, he didn’t have enough cash, which is why he took out a loan to buy merchandise and improve his opportunities. He is now applying for a second loan, to buy more merchandise to sell. He has always repaid debts on time, and feels confident he can continue to do that because he has a lot of experience in sales and and meeting clients' needs. Most of his customers are friends, neighbors and people from the surrounding villages. He went into business because he likes to work independently, and plans to keep on improving his business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to his customers

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La señora Doris Guzmán R. tiene 68 años y vive en el barrio Educador de la ciudad de  Cartagena de Indias.   Es dueña de un negocio, donde presta servicios de internet, llamadas internacionales  y servicio de  fotocopiado a clientes que en su mayoría son jóvenes  estudiantes de bachillerato y universitarios. Su negocio inició desde el momento en que su hermano se lo ofreció en Mayo del 2009;  al principio  contó con la experiencia de él, pues la acompañó por dos meses día a día,  por eso ella aprendió a manejarlo muy bien.  

La señora Doris es  soltera y no tiene hijos pero vive con sus tres hermanos, uno de ellos es alérgico y como su casa  tiene piso de plantilla rustica en mal estado, emite mucho polvo a pesar de hacer limpieza constantemente;  ella quiere mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y por eso pide este, su segundo crédito a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo por valor de $2,300,000 pesos, para comprar las materiales de construcción y mejorar  el piso y el baño, que se encuentra en el patio, también en muy mal estado; Igualmente quiere que su casa sea mas segura levantando una   paredilla para tener más control de las personas que ingresan a ella,  pues el patio tiene comunicación con los vecinos.  

La señora Guzmán es una mujer activa, hace parte de la comunidad pastoral social de la iglesia y además es voluntaria en el comedor del colegio ubicado en la parroquia.  Su familia se caracteriza por ser muy unida, solidaria y fieles servidores de la iglesia de Dios.  Su sueño es triunfar en sus proyectos de negocio y todos los días pide a Dios que le vaya bien, para contribuir con su país en la generación de empleo.
texts.en:
Doris Guzmán R., age 68, lives in the Educador neighborhood in the city of Cartagena de Indias. She has a business where she offers internet services, international calls, and photocopies. Most of her customers are young students attending high schools and universities. Her business started from the time her brother offered it to her in May of 2009. At first she counted on his experience. He stayed with her everyday for two months. That is how she learned to manage it so well. Doris is single, and she does not have children. She lives with her three siblings. One of them is allergic. The floor in her house is very rudimentary and in bad shape. It emits a lot of dust even though it is constantly cleaned. She wants to improve the house’s conditions, and that is why she is asking for her second loan for 2,300,000 pesos from the Mario Santo Domino Foundation. She will buy construction materials to improve the floor and the bathroom, which is on the patio. It is also in very bad shape. At the same time, she want her house be more secure by putting up a wall. That way she will have more control over the people who enter. The patio is not sheltered from the neighbors. Mrs. Guzmán is a very active woman. She participates in the social pastoral community in the church. She also volunteers in the school dining room, which is located in the parish. Her family is characterized as being very united, supportive, and loyal followers of the church of God. Her dream is to be successful in her business projects. Everyday she asks God for it to go well so that she is able to contribute to the generation of jobs in her country.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to improve the floor, fix up the bathroom, and raise a wall on the patio

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a 26 year old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil in southern Lebanon with her husband and their two children. Sahar has owned a hair salon for almost three years now. She also does makeup, hair removal, and sells beauty products. She is successful in her industry because she knows how to treat her customers well; her clients feel comfortable going to her salon since not only does she offer a wide variety of services, but more importantly, she is good at her work and is always aware of the newest hair styles and fashions.

When Sahar first started her business, she didn’t have trouble attracting clients because she already had faithful customers from her previous job. She decided to start her own business because she wanted to be independent. Her clients are her friends, neighbors, and other people from her region. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase beauty products for her salon. This is the first time that Sahar has requested a loan. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products for her salon.

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.en: Madeleine T. is 43 years old, married and the mother of four children. She lives in Diourbel, Senegal, and has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NGASCOP for 13 years. Like many of her neighbors, she raises animals (cattle, sheep and pigs) which she sells at the grand market in the nearby town of Bambey. This loan will allow her to buy more cattle and sheep to raise and sell.

loans.use: To buy cattle and sheep to raise and sell

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 36 year old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Khalil has owned a water tank since 2002. In Lebanon, due to the lack of water and to the political situation, a lot of people have do not have access to water for everyday use. Therefore, Khalil owns a water tank and when his clients need him, they call him and he provides them with water. His clients are people from his region, individuals, companies, and farmers that need to water their land.

This is the first time that he has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. He has reqeusted a loan to purchase a water generator that provides pressure for the water and help him provide for his clients. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his business in order to supply the best to his clients.

loans.use: To purchase a water generator.

loans.name: Karen Elena

texts.es:
Karen Barón  B., tiene 26 años  vive en el barrio Altos de San Isidro, en la ciudad de Cartagena  de Indias Municipio de Bolívar;  comenzó  su negocio con un pequeño capital que le quedo de un trabajo temporal en sus vacaciones de estudio;  con sus ganancias pagó su colegio porque desde muy joven tenia negocios con sus compañeras de clases.
Cuando se casó su esposo(a su lado en la fotografia) le recomendaba compañeros de trabajo como clientes y una vez él quedó sin trabajo, también empezó a comercializar con ella durante un año manteniéndose  esta pareja de las ganancias producidas: ellos vendían  de puerta en puerta y de barrio en barrio, alli se dieron a conocer y ganaron muchos clientes ; cuando posteriormente los clientes aumentaron sus pedidos de mercancía, tenían que esperar hasta recoger sus cuentas por cobrar para responderles, así muchas veces dejaron de ser oportunos y por eso recurrieron a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo buscando recursos para financiarse.  Hoy su esposo trabaja de mensajero  en una empresa, pero también gestiona la venta de mercancía que Karen vende entre sus compañeros de trabajo, ayudándola  a conseguir mucha clientela de sus conocidos.  Karen ha recibido 2 créditos de la Fundación en la línea de capital de trabajo, con ellos ha podido aumentar sus utilidades porque tiene más venta debido a que con este dinero pudo comprar más mercancía y hacer una oferta  diversificada; en la actualidad  solicita su tercer crédito por valor de $ 2.200.000 para comprar ropa, calzado e interiores para damas caballeros y niños, tendidos para camas, para lo cual viajará a  Barranquilla, ciudad a dos horas de Cartagena, porque incluyendo transporte su mercancía  sale a un mejor costo y puede venderla a un precio adecuado entre sus clientes.
Con su  negocio Karen se siente útil para los planes futuros que tienen ella y su esposo, porque sabe que pude lograr el sueño de adquirir su vivienda propia y  piensa que puede también tener un local al lado de su casa. Su gran desafío es terminar los estudios  y con su esposo tener un  gran almacén de ropa y brindar a los hijos que planean,  un futuro prometedor.
Karen se siente contenta, vive en un barrio que fue producto de invasión pero entre todos los vecinos  se organizaron y lograron  acceder a todos los servicios públicos y especialmente a la pavimentación de sus calles que hace fácil el acceso a su negocio.
texts.en:
Karen Barón B., age 26, lives in the Altos de San Isidro neighborhood of the city of Cartagena de Indias, within the municipality of Bolívar. She began her business with a small amount of capital that she obtained from temporary work during school vacations. She also paid high school fees with her earnings because, beginning when she was very young, she did business with her classmates.

When she married her husband (standing next to her in the photo) he sent friends from his job to her as customers. Once, when he became unemployed, he began working with her for a year, and the couple continued to produce profits. They were selling from door-to-door and neighborhood-to-neighborhood, and they say they got to know and win over many customers.

Later, when customers increased their orders for merchandise they had to wait until they had collected on their accounts in order to fill them. As a result, many times they lost opportunities. Because of this, they resorted to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, looking for resources to finance themselves. Today, her husband works as a messenger in a business, but he also tries to sell Karen's merchandise to his fellow employees, helping her to get more business from among his acquaintances.

Karen has received two loans from Fundación for working capital. With these she was able to increase her earnings because she had more sales due to the fact that she was able to buy more merchandise and offer greater diversity. Currently, she is applying for her third loan for 2,200,000 Columbian pesos in order to purchase clothing, footwear, and underwear for ladies, gentlemen and children. For these she will travel to Barranquilla, a city two hours from Cartagena, because, even including transportation, she can obtain her merchandise at a better price there and can sell it at a good price to her customers.

With her business Karen feels good about the future plans that she and her husband have because she knows that they can succeed in their dream of acquiring their own home, and she thinks that she can also have a shop next to their house. Her great challenge is to finish her schooling and with her husband have a large clothing store and offer the children they plan to have a promising future.

Karen feels contented. She lives in a neighborhood that was informally settled but all the neighbors organized themselves and succeeded in obtaining public services and especially the paving of their streets, which makes access to her business easy.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: In order to purchase clothing, footwear and underwear for ladies, gentlemen, and children and bed linen

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 41-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their six children. For the last five years, he has made a living running a grocery store where he sells fruits and vegetables, including lettuce, tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers, radishes, potatoes, apples, oranges and other items. His customers, most of whom live nearby, like shopping in his store because he has good-quality merchandise. He has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua to buy more merchandise to sell. Ali has always paid loans on time, and plans to keep on improving his work by diversifying his merchandise.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 33-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, in southern Lebanon, where he has worked as a van taxi driver since 2006. When he first started his business, he faced competition from lots of other taxis and vans. Despite that competition, he succeeded because he knows how to treat his clients and also because of his punctuality. He has applied for a loan from A. Majmoua to do some maintenance work on his car. His clients are friends, neighbors and people who live in his region. In the future, he plans to expand his business by offering transportation services in surrounding villages.

loans.use: To do maintenance work on his car.

loans.name: Amor Y Paz 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Lidia is the coordinator of her group, Amor y Paz (Love and Peace), and her story is representative both of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural area surrounding Santiago, a town known for its production of tobacco and beef where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her child.

Lidia is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza  after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing by purchasing a package of used clothing imported in bulk from places like the Salvation Army in the United States to sell in her community. She will use the profits to construct a sink in her home as well as investing in clothing and school supplies for her child. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Purchase a package of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Marie Thérése

texts.en: Marie Thérése N. is 42 years old and lives in the region of Diourbel, Senegal. She is married and the mother of four children. In the 12 years she has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NGASCOP she has always paid back her loans in time. Her activity consists of raising animals which she sells at the grand market of nearby Bambey. With this loan, she will purchase new cattle and sheep to raise. The earnings from her activity allow her to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and sheeps

loans.name: Zib

texts.en: Zib is a 45 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Zib has owned a butcher shop since 1999. When he first started his business, he had some financial issues because of the cost his machines and also had difficulty finding the proper place to open his shop. He decided to open his shop because of his experience as another butcher's employee. Zib is known for his good quality meat. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase meat for his shop. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time; his previous loan was also to purchase meat. His clients are his friends, neighbors, and people from his region. In the future, he plans on improving his business and always providing his clients with the best meat.

loans.use: To purchase meat for his shop.

loans.name: Louai

texts.en:
Louai is a 30-year-old engaged man who has worked in the construction industry for the past 10 years. He is a specialist in concrete works. Louai works on a freelance basis in addition to working with some entrepreneurs. He works hard to earn an income and is getting married soon. 

Today, Louai is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy additional construction supplies and wood needed to improve his business level and attract more customers.

loans.use: To buy additional construction supplies and wood

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en: Abbass is a 38 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Abbass has been working as a taxi driver since 1993. When he first started his business, he faced hard competition since there were a lot of other taxi drivers. However, he is a specialist because of his punctuality. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his car, such as repainting it. This is his second loan cycle and he has always paid on time. Abbass' previous loan also was used to repair his car. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his car

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame Fatou Touré âgée de 40 ans est une femme mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont les âges varient entre 2 et 20 ans. Elle fait le commerce de divers produits  depuis 15 ans. Elle l’a hérité de sa mère qui était une vendeuse de beignets très connue à Notto une communauté rurale dans le département de Thiès où la culture de légumes est très développée de par sa position dans la zone des Niayes au Sénégal. Cependant, Madame Fatou Touré mène en parallèle une autre activité depuis 2007. C’est la couture qui dit-elle lui permet de satisfaire ses besoins en tant que femme qui a un mari avec des moyens très limités.
C’est ainsi, pour avoir une bonne assise dans son activité et de soutenir son mari à la maison, elle sollicite un prêt de 25 000 FCFA auprès de sa caisse U-IMCEC Notto. Elle veut crée de nouvelles styles sur des draps qu’elle compte acheter afin de pouvoir les vendre à bon prix.
texts.en:
Madam Fatou Toure is a 40 year old married woman and the mother of 6 children whose ages vary between 2 and 20 years of age. She's been trading in various products for 15 years. She inherited the business from her mother, who was a well known seller of donuts in Notto, a rural community in the district of Thies, where the cultivation of vegetables is well developed by virtue of its position in the Niayes zone in Senegal. Meanwhile, Madam Fatou Toure has been doing another business since 2007. It is sewing, according to her, which enables her to meet her needs being a wife of a husband with limited means. In order to have good foundation in her business and to support her husband in the house, she is requesting 25 000 FCFA from her Notto U-IMCEC account. She wants to create new styles on sheets that she intends to buy in order to be able to sell at good price.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply of sheets and accessories

loans.name: Agnés

texts.en: Agnés S. is a 44 year-old woman from the region of Diourbel, Senegal. She is married and the mother of two children. Madame S. has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NGASCOP for eight years and has paid back her previous loans in time. Like many others in her village, she raises cattle which she sells in the grand market in nearby Bambey. With this loan she can buy new cattle.

loans.use: To purchase young cattle

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 49 year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil southern Lebanon with his wife and their five children. Ali has owned a shoe shop since 2007. He decided on this business because of his experience in shoe sales and likes his work. He requests a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for the coming season. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. His clients are people from his region. In the future, he plans on improving his store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for the coming season.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en: Fadi is a 26 year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Fadi has been working in agriculture for eight years -- a field that he has been familiar with all his life. He owns livestock and also plants fruits and vegetables. He is known for the good quality of his goods. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he had to face competition and make himself known to the public since there is a lot of agriculture and livestock production in his region. Fadi requests a loan from A. Majmoua in order to increase his livestock. By doing so, he will be able to increase production and therefore his income. This is the first time he has requested a loan. In the future, he plans to keep on expanding his business.

loans.use: To increase his livestock.

loans.name: Nayef

texts.en: Nayef is a 58 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Nayef owns a home product shop. When he first started his business, he didn’t face any difficulties except making himself known to the public. Nayef decided to enter into the home products business because of his experience. He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to change the décor of his shop. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. His clients are people from his region. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To change the décor of his shop.

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.en:
Suzanne D. is a 40 year old widow from the region of Diourbel, Senegal. She has seven children.

Madame D. has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NGASCOP for 12 years and always paid back her loans on time. She has a small shop where she sells a variety of goods. This loan will allow her to equip her retail shop with new products.

loans.use: For the purchase of various products

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 41 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Mohammad has been working as a car painter. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties except making himself known by the public. His clients can be anyone from his region.  He decided on doing this business because of his experience.

He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase paint and painting tools for his work. He also purchased paint and tools for his work with his previous loans.  This is his fourth loan and he has always paid on time.

Mohammad is special in his work because he does it well and does his best to have the newest tools in order to improve his performance. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase paint and painting tools for his work.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 43 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Hassan has owned a restaurant for over a year. He does all types of sandwiches, as well as mankoucheh, which looks like a folded pizza. The most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning.

Hassan is special in his work because he is known for his good and tasty mankoucheh. He does chicken, meat, escalope and all types of other sandwiches. When he first started his business, he passed through some financial issues, so Hassan requested a loan in order to purchase a refrigerator for his work.

This is the first time that Hassan has requested a loan. Hassan is special in his work because he knows how to meet his clients' demands; he is known for doing the sandwiches on demand. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator for his work.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 48-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. He has been working in agriculture since 2002. He grows olives, and either produces oil, or sells his olives.

When Youssef first started his business, he didn’t produce as much as he does today, and his number of clients has increased. His clients are people from his region, as well as people from other regions. Youssef decided on doing his business because he took over his family’s business.

Youssef requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to pay for the harvesting of his olives. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

Youssef is special in his work because he does his best to produce the best quality of olives and oil. In the future, he plans to keep on expanding his business by producing more.

loans.use: To pay for the harvesting of his olives

loans.name: Maarouf

texts.en:
Maarouf is a married man, 40 years old, and has four school-age children. He works in the construction business, specializing in stonemasonry work. He makes special designs because he's talented in that work. He takes on both home projects and shop projects.

Today, Maarouf is requesting $1,200 to buy more tools and supplies needed for his job because he's planning to take on a new home project in the coming month and he needs to be ready.

loans.use: To buy more tools and supplies

loans.name: Zapora

texts.en:
Zapora sells cellphone recharge cards and also provides phone calls. She has been in business for a year but before now she sold bean cake.

Zapora has improved her business since she joined LAPO micro-finance. She is grateful to LAPO micro-finance and Kiva for this wonderful initiative that has greatly improved lives.

Zapora is requesting a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more rechargeable cellphone cards to sell and promises to repay at the due-date.

Zapora is 33 years old and is married with four children, her youngest child being 3 years old.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable cellphone cards to sell

loans.name: Luz Divina 1,2,3 Group

texts.en:
Sonia is the coordinator of her group Luz Divina (Divine Light) and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Sonia’s group is located in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty, industrial town north of the capital where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure as a single mother with her child.

Sonia is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing. She will purchase tennis shoes, blouses, skirts and pants in the main market in Santo Domingo and bring them back to her community to sell.

Sonia will use the profits to invest in her home by purchasing an inverter that will store power when the electrical grid is working so that it can run basic utilities such as fans and light bulbs when the power is out. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy tennis shoes, blouses, skirts and pants to sell

loans.name: Zulfiyya

texts.en:
Zulfiyya H. is 25 years old and has sold cleaning items in a small shop for the last four years. She started her business with the 100$ starting capital. Over time she expanded her business and now she has a grocery store where she sells her goods.

Weekly Zulfiyya travels to the neighboring town for purchasing new goods. Currently she is requesting a loan of 1600 AZN for purchasing more items to expand her business.

Zulfiyya sincerely thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to be accurate with the loan repayment.

loans.use: purchase more items to increase profit

loans.name: Suwebat

texts.en:
50-year-old Suwebat sells pap (a traditional porridge made from ground maize) from her home. She buys maize in bulk and processes it into pap which she supplies to big buyers who sell it together with bean cake. Most people prefer taking pap as breakfast due to its light nature.

Suwebat travels far from the city to purchases maize from the farmers, especially when it is out of season, to make sure her customers are supplied. She has been in this business for the past eleven years and has improved on her living standard. She is married and has four children.

Suwebat is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more maize in bulk for making pap. She expresses her huge thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more maize in bulk for making pap

loans.name: Famila

texts.en:
Famila M. sells different kind of dishes. She is 56 years old, married and has five children. She rents a place to sell her goods which is located in one of the local markets. Famila has been running this business for seven years. Her main clients are brides who usually comes to her shop to purchase dowry before a wedding party. With only a couple of competitors in the market, she is doing well with her business. 

Today she is requesting a loan of 1606 AZN to purchase new dishes and increase her range of goods. Famila thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to be accurate with her loan repayments.

loans.use: purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Kamran

texts.en: Kamran M. is 27 years old, married has one child. He works in a school as a teacher. Kamran started his small convenience store eight years ago when he was unemployed and needed a way to pay the bills. His biggest dream is to have a general store where he can sell household products as well as cleaning items. With the loan Kamran expects to keep growing little by little and with the earnings he'll keep improving his quality of life and economic situation along with his business until he achieves his goal As this business is the main source of income, Kamran applied for 1600 AZN in case to expand it. His wish in life is to see his child as professional with prosperous businesses.

loans.use: purchase  more merchanise

loans.name: Yafas

texts.en: Yafas I. has been able to support his family in an honorable way by selling different kinds of foodstuff in his grocery store. He is married with three children. In order to improve the quality and quantity of his products, he wants to buy more foodstuff. For this purpose he needs a loan of 1600 AZN. Yafas has put a lot of effort into developing his business; he would like to keep growing as a micro-entrepreneur, and with your help this could be possible. Yafas and his family are sincerely grateful for your generosity and support.

loans.use: purchase more foodstuff

loans.name: Agazahid

texts.en:
Agazahid A. is married with four children and he has always been a hard-working man who has made sure, from his young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread.

Agazahid has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs. With a small starting capital, thanks to his perseverance and dedication, he began this enterprise four years ago. Today, Agazahid needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase the range of his goods. For this purpose he is requesting a loan of 1600 AZN. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

We believe Agazahid’s perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: purchase more foodstuff to sell

loans.name: Samah

texts.en:
Samah is a 21-year-old single woman living with her father and four siblings. Her father owns agricultural land and she used to accompany him for the past five years when he worked on it.

And in 2008, Samah took the opportunity to help her father with the cultivation after he became old. She cultivates vegetables and she distributes the harvest to the agricultural markets. She’s a very hardworking woman.

Today, Samah is requesting $1,200 to buy farming supplies like seeds and fertilizer in addition to some tents to use when packaging the produce.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer plus some tents

loans.name: Shukufa

texts.en: Shukufa A. is a married woman with four children. She runs a grocery business selling different kinds of foodstuffs. Her four years of being in business have helped her store flourish into a successful enterprise. Shukufa would like to see her business grow still further. She believes additional financial assistance will help guarantee expansion and higher profits. Shukufa’s integrity, good reputation and rich experience working in commerce should secure prompt repayment of this loan and consistent progress in her business.

loans.use: purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more merchandise to increase profit

loans.name: Sadita

texts.en:
Sadita is a member of LAPO micro-finance; she borrows and repays on time. She is 48 years old and is married with five children.

Sadita sells groceries like sweets (candies), biscuits (cookies), tomato paste, soap, and baking items. She started the business six years ago and she likes doing the business as it gives her an opportunity to interact with customers.

Sadita opens her shop every day from Monday to Saturday and manages the business with the help of her children, especially when they are on holidays. She does this to make a living in Lagos State, Nigeria.

Sadita is asking for a loan of NGN 120,000 to purchase more groceries and baking items in bulk as this will enable her get a better discount and so earn more profit. She expresses her gratitude to all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and baking items in bulk to sell

loans.name: Matlab

texts.en:
Matlab N. is a very hard-working and responsible entrepreneur. He and his family live in the small village of Agsu.

Matlab works in the central city market selling shoes and clothing for men. His business is characterized by stability and consistent growth. He has been working in the market for 19 years. Once a month he travels to the neighboring city for purchasing new goods. Matlab likes to work for himself. His business has been the main source of income for his whole family.

Today Matlab would like to ask for a loan of 1600 AZN to purchase new clothing and shoes to sell. We believe his drive for success will help this young entrepreneur succeed and thrive in business. You can be an important part of the growth of Matlab’s business.

loans.use: purchase seasonal shoes

loans.name: Doumouh

texts.en:
Doumouh is a 24-year-old married woman. She has six years of experience in the hairdressing and beauty business. After getting married, she decided to open a beauty salon and start receiving clients. She was able to make a good number of clients from the whole region due to her good services.

Today, Doumouh is requesting $1,200 to buy additional tools, hair accessories and beauty products to meet her customers’ demands and to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy additional tools, hair accessories and beauty products

loans.name: Camino Al Exito Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “CAMINO AL EXITO”, actualmente se encuentra en el IV ciclo y esta conformado por 14 personas trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, es un banco comunal conformado por socios que viven en la provincia D. Cusco del departamento Cusco.  Cusco es una cuidad que se caracteriza por su Centro Histórico, sus paisajes, su historia siendo una ciudad encantadora D. la Región Sur del país. 

Las actividades económicas D. los socios a las que se dedican son el comercio como por ejemplo venta D. comestibles, venta D. comida, venta D. golosinas, venta D. ropa, venta D. leña, venta D. artesanía, venta D. bebidas alcohólicas y venta D. útiles escolares y otros brindan servicios D. transporte y servicio D. cocina. El banco comunal tiene varios ciclos D. funcionamiento, como manifiestan las socias, se encuentran contentas y satisfechas con los servicios D. crédito, ahorro y capacitación, por el tiempo D. permanencia en el banco comunal un aspecto D. valoración es el ahorro por la posibilidad D. capitalización que les brinda este servicio. 

Hirazema es socia del banco comunal Camino al Éxito, tiene 39 años D. edad, es soltera y aun no tiene hijos. La socia trabaja en la ONG  “Bartolomé D. las Casas” en la ciudad del Cusco como consejera D. limpieza, su labor como empleada empieza a las 7am hasta las 9am y D. 5pm hasta 7:30pm todos los días. Hirazema es una mujer emprendedora que tiene un pequeño negocio D. confección D. ropa D. lana como por ejemplo chompas, ponchos, chalinas y chulos. La socia requiere el crédito D. los 600 soles para comprar 100 madejas D. lana.
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Camino al Exito” (Road to Success) is currently starting its fourth loan cycle and consists of 14 hardworking individuals who view each moment as an opportunity to get ahead. Through their daily efforts, they are able to proviD. a better future for their children. The members of the Communal Bank live in the Province and Department of Cusco. Cusco is a city known for its Historical Center, its landscapes, and its history for being one of the most enchanting cities in the southern part of the country.

The business activities of the members incluD. selling groceries, food, candy, clothing, firewood, handicrafts, alcoholic beverages, school supplies, or services such as transportation and catering. The Communal Bank has participated in various loan cycles and the members are content and satisfied with the loans, savings, and training sessions. One ongoing aspect of the Communal Bank that is of value is the group savings account that opens the possibility for building up assets, which is what this service provides.

Hirazema is a member of the Communal Bank “Camino al Exito”. She is 39 years old, single, and does not have children. She works for the NGO “Bartolomé D. las Casas” in the city of Cusco as a janitor. Her cleaning duties are performed between 7am to 9am and from 5pm to 7:30pm every day. Hirazema is an enterprising woman who has a small business producing clothing maD. of wool such as sweaters, ponchos, scarves, and caps. She is requesting a loan of 600 PEN in order to buy 100 skeins of wool.

The members are grateful for this opportunity and commit to making their payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en:
Ramiz A. is 57 years old. He is married with three children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foodstuffs like: cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, detergents and many others in his grocery store which he built 5 years ago. Today Ramiz is requesting a loan of 1600 AZN to increase his stock. 

He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is that his children progress by means of their studies, for which he is doing his best. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: purchase more foodstuff to increase income

loans.name: Veronica Atieno

texts.en:
Veronica Atieno is a 30-year-old single mother to Shalin Achieng, who is 10 years old and in primary school, and Wallace Otieno, who is 4 years old and is in nursery school. They live in Nyalenda, a town in Kisumu city.

Veronica runs a hairdressing salon and she has been operating it for the last eight years. She has a gift in plaiting ladies’ hair as she started doing it while still young.

Veronica is applying for her first loan through KADET to enable her to purchase a hairdryer to add to her salon. It has been a challenge when customers come to have their hair set to find that she doesn’t have a hair dryer available. 

Veronica’s desire is to diversify into selling clothes and in future open a boutique alongside her hairdressing salon.

loans.use: To buy a hairdryer for her salon

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 48-year-old widowed lady and the mother of two children who are all grown-up and working.

Christine operates a general kiosk selling foodstuffs which is her primary business. She also sells clothes as a secondary business and from both businesses she gets a total profit of Ksh 5,000 per month. Her clients are mainly the residents of the Zimmerman area.

Christine was introduced to KADET by her friend and this is her sixth loan with KADET. She has never borrowed elsewhere before. She has applied for a loan which she will use in the following manner: Ksh 20,000 to purchase new clothes for resale, Ksh 10,000 to restock the kiosk, and Ksh 7,000 to buy food products. She plans to top up the rest of the money from her own savings.

Christine plans to continue expanding her business with the extra income she will earn from this loan.

loans.use: To restock her kiosk, buy foodstuffs and plasticware to sell and to add more clothes to her stall

loans.name: Khikmet

texts.en: Khikmet J. operates a grocery store in his neighborhood. He started his operation 20 years ago. He is a 45 year-old father of three children whom are currently in school. He sells products like rice, canned foods, drinks, cooking oil, assorted biscuits, candies and beverages. With the loan, he wants to buy more of these and other products to increase his stock of goods. With increased stock and increased varieties, Khikmet hopes to make more income to provide for the educational needs of his children. He would appreciate your assistance very much. He wants to provide his children with university education. Khikmet is grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: purchase more foodstuff

loans.name: Rispah

texts.en:
Rispah A. is married to Harold and they have two children who are in college pursuing different courses: Jane who is 22 years old and Robert 20 years old. They live within Vihiga town in Kenya's Western province.

Rispah runs a greenhouse and has been in the business for the last 5 years. She is applying for a second loan from Kadet Limited after successfully completing the first one. Rispah wants to use the money to expand her greenhouse, buy watermelon seeds, and expand her poultry by buying 300 chicks. Her clientele mainly include the supermarkets around where she sells green vegetables, eggs, and watermelons.

Her dream and desire is to expand the greenhouse to accommodate production of a variety of vegetables and fruits to supply to all supermarkets in the Western province.

loans.use: Expand the greenhouse, buy watermelon seeds, and buy 300 chicks

loans.name: Fidaa

texts.en:
Fidaa is a 40-year-old married woman and mother of 4 school-aged children. In 2005, she opened an accessories and make-up shop in her town after seeing a need for such services in the region. Her business developed automatically and she has started distributing her products to beauty salons and making a good profit. 

Today, Fidaa is requesting to borrow US$ 1,200 to buy the latest collections of products and accessories for the new summer season so as to be always up-to-date with the market.

loans.use: buy the latest collections of products and accessories

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 36-year-old married lady with two children. She owns and manages rental houses in Dandora Estate which is a low income area. She has been in business for the last sixteen years and her houses are normally very strategically placed due to the population. Her husband Simon is a businessman.

Elizabeth was introduced to KADET by a friend and this will be her first loan. She had initially borrowed from another microfinance institution before joining Kadet.

Elizabeth plans to purchase scrap metals and plastic ware worth Ksh 10,000 and plastics worth Kshs 5,000 for resale.These scrap metals and plastics are used for recycling purposes and this will also enable her get more income to support herself and her family.

She hopes to venture further into real estate in the near future.

loans.use: purchase scrap metals and second-hand plastic ware

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Moussa S. pratique la  maçonnerie depuis 30 ans. Actuellement, c’est un très grand entrepreneur et gagne beaucoup de marchés dans son secteur. Il est membre de U-IMCEC Thiès  il a soldé 3 prêts sans de grandes difficultés. Pour augmenter cette fois ci son stock de planches, Monsieur  S. souhaite un renouvellement de prêt afin d’acheter le maximum possible de planches.  Les planches sont d’une importance capitale pour ses différents chantiers qu’il gère à travers la ville de Thiès et même parfois en dehors de la ville. S’il n’a pas de chantiers, chose rare, Monsieur S. peut mettre en location ses planches aux intéressés.
Cependant, Monsieur Moussa S. envisage de s’investir dans le business transport  avec les profits tirés de son activités pour diversifier son activité, augmenter ses revenus. Ainsi, il porte un grand espoir sur ce prêt.
texts.en:
Mr. Moussa S. has practiced masonry for 30 years. Now, he is a large entrepreneur and wins over a lot of markets in his sector. He is a member of U-IMCEC. He has paid off three loans without great difficulty. This time, to augment his stock of boards, Mr. S. is wishing for a loan renewal in order to buy the maximum possible amount of boards. Boards are of capital importance for the different construction sites which he manages around the village of Thiès and even sometimes outside of the village. If he does not have work to do - a rare occurrence - Mr. S. can rent his boards with interest. However, Mr. Moussa S. envisions investing in a transport business with the profits from his work in order to diversify and increase his revenue. Thus, he carries much hope for this loan.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of boards

loans.name: Akif

texts.en: Akif R. is a successful father and dedicated husband and together with his wife he has a daughter. Akif began a small grocery store 14 years ago with a small amount of savings. He was assisted by his father who helps him with serving his clients. Today, his clientele has grown greater and his grocery store becomes more popular. He is asking for a loan so that he may expand the variety of goods that are sold in his store. Akif is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve successes in his business with this loan.

loans.use: purchase more detegents to sell

loans.name: Fikret

texts.en: Fikret A. is 54 years old and married with four children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foodstuff, like candies, cookies, preserved food, soft drinks, juice, tea, and many other items in the grocery store he built many years ago. Today, Fikret is requesting a loan of 1600 AZN to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is that his children progress by means of their studies, for which he is doing all the best. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: purchase more foodtuss to sell

loans.name: Mirdamet

texts.en: Mirdamet A. is married with three children. He’s a market vendor from Agsu city where he's sold men’s shoes for the last 13 years. A reasonable pricing policy and client-friendly service has always been priorities in his work and have helped to ensure the success of his business. Currently, Mirdamet is requesting a loan of 1600 AZN to increase his inventory. He believes that having this additional turnover capital will help him minimize his sales risk and provide stable financial support for his family. Moreover, it will help him get closer to his ultimate goal of purchasing a big store of his own.

loans.use: purchase seasonal shoes

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is a 26-year-old man. He has been running a unisex beauty salon and shop for four years. He has employed two people in his business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya he has been able to relate and socialize with his group members.  

Ronald hopes to grow his business to a wholesale shop and also hopes to supply cosmetic products countrywide.  He has requested a loan of Kes. 80,000 to buy hair accessories and add to his stock of beauty products. He describes himself as an aggressive man.

loans.use: Add to his stock of beauty products and personal care products

loans.name: Germaine

texts.en:
Germaine N. is 58 years old and lives in the region of Diourbel, Senegal. She is a widow and mother of 6 children. Madame N. has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NGASCOP for twelve years and has paid back all her previous loans on time. She raises cattle, an activity which is very common in her village because there is a big agricultural market nearby. 

With the loan she will buy new cattle that she will raise and sell at the market. The revenues from this activity enable her to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase young cattle

loans.name: Beug Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Beug Fallou sollicite un prêt de 300 000 FCFA. En fait Beug Fallou est une expression wolof (la langue nationale au Sénégal)  qui signifie « Fans de Serigne Fallou » un grand marabout de la confrérie mouride (une confrérie musulmane fondée par Cheikh Ahmadou Bamba). C’est un groupement composé de 4 femmes avec comme présidente Madame Astou S.. 
Madame Astou S.  est âgé de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants qui ont 17 ans et 3 ans. Elle est commerçante et gère une table de légumes et divers produits alimentaires au marché de Notto, une communauté rurale située dans le département  de Thiès. Elle est dans ce métier depuis 1995  sous l’influence de quelques de ses voisines qui s’activait dans de petits commerce au niveau du marché. Avec cette activité, Madame Astou S. pense qu’elle a gagné beaucoup de connaissances au niveau de sa localité Gouye Diama  sise à quelques dizaines de kilomètres de Notto. Sa part du crédit va lui permettre d’acheter des poissons fumés, séchés et autres. Ainsi, elle pourra avec ses profits renforcer sa boutique d’alimentation  que sa fille gère à la maison.
Pour les autres membres du groupement en l’occurrence Madame Dior G., Madame Ndack N. et Madame Seynabou W., elles comptent avec leur part  comme Madame Astou S. équiper leurs tables respectives en produits car elles vendent les mêmes produits que la présidente au marché de Notto.
texts.en:
Beug Fallou is requesting a loan of 300 000 FCFA. Infact, Beug Fallou is an expression in wolof ( the national language of Senegal) which means "Fans of Serigne Fallou" a great marabout of the mouride brotherhood ( a muslim brotherhood founded by Cheikh Ahmadou Bamba). It is a group made up of 4 women with Madam Astou S. as president. Madam Astou S. is 39 years old, married and the mother of 2 children who are 17 and 3 years of age. She is a trader and runs a vegetables business on a table and various food products in the Notto market, a rural community located in the district of Thies. She's been in this business since 1995 under the influence of some of her neighbors who were into petty trading in the market. With this business, Madam Astou S. thinks that she has gained much knowledge in terms of her Gouye Diama locality situated about some 12 kilometers of Notto. Her part of the loan will enable her to buy some smoked, dried fish and other items. Thus, she will be able, with this profit, to strengthen her food shop that her daughter runs in the house. For the other members of the group, specically Madam Dior Gueye, Madam Ndack N., and Madam Seynabou W., they intend to stock their respectives tables with products with their part of the loan like Madam Astou S.,since they sell the same products as the president in the Notto market.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply products for sale

loans.name: Queen

texts.en:
Queen is 40 years old, married and has three children. She owns a pig farm. She works very hard to make sure her farm is productive and she believes that hard work pays. She buys piglets and rears them for sale. She has been in this business for some years. With the proceeds from her pig farm, she can save and assist her husband in providing the family's needs in the areas of feeding, clothing and more.

Queen hopes to improve her pig farm by expanding the size of the farm and purchasing more piglets for her farm. 
She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more piglets for her farm. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets for her farm.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 30 years old and married with one child.  He has been running a photography, video coverage and card production business for seven years.  He also runs a transport business where he offers rides with his motorcycle.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become financially empowered and has learned customer care skills.  He hopes to open a national service media and be the director of that business in the future. He has requested a loan of KES. 80,000 to buy a motorcycle for his business.  He describes himself as a hardworking, patient, aggressive and ambitious man.

loans.use: Buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Paulette

texts.en: Paulette N. is a 74-year-old woman. She is a widow and lives in the region of Diourbel, Senegal. Madame N. has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NGASCOP for 13 years and has never had problems paying back her loans. She runs a little grocery store. This loan will allow her to buy products such as sugar, milk, coffee and peanut oil and sell them in her store.

loans.use: To purchase new products

loans.name: Ramona Albertina

texts.es:
la señora Ramona Albertina M. tiene 60 años de edad, es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos, solo uno depende de ella, tiene casa propia.
Ramona se dedica a la comercializacion de productos como ser perfumenes, desodorantes, lociones, cremas y otros productos para la limpieza de la casa.
 
esta solicitando el credito para comprar productos al por mayor, asi los compra mas baratos y obtiene mayores ganancias. 
 
su mayor deseo es que sus hijos sean personas de bien para la sociedad.
para Ramona esta actividad es su unica fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Ramona Albertina M., 60, is single and has four children, one of whom still depends on her; she has her own home. Ramona sells a variety of products like: perfumes, deodorants, lotions, creams and cleaning products for the home. She is asking for funding to buy at wholesale because she can get her merchandise at a better price and thus make higher profits. Her greatest wish is that her children become useful members of society. For Ramona, this activity is her sole source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy floor disinfectants, creams, liquid soap, hair gel, deodorants, lotions, perfumes.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Philoméne

texts.en: Philoméne F. is 38 years old, married and the mother of seven children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NGASCOP for 13 years and has always paid back her loans on time. As her main activity, she raises sheep, which she sells at the grand agricultural market in nearby Bambey. This loan allows her to buy 15 new sheep. With the revenues generated by this activity, she can improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase young sheep

loans.name: Noyolot Group

texts.es:
GRUPO NOYOLOT (FLAT)
     El grupo se llama noyolot, y significa amor mió en náhuatle, esta localidad esta situada en los altos de Morelos en el municipio de Tétela del volcán donde se cosecha fruta de temporada casi durante todo el año.

     Las 5 integrantes del grupo son: Flor E. Pérez, Yolanda Alonso Domínguez, Herlinda N. Domínguez, Eduviges A. N., Ernestina A. B., todas ellas son residentes de esta localidad de hueyapan, Flor junto con su esposo se dedica a la elaboración de muebles en madera, Herlinda tiene una pequeña estética de belleza, Yolanda vende antojitos mexicanos lo que son dobladas frutas. Eduviges y Ernestina venden fruta de temporada y también hace  velos tejidos a mano.

     Flor es la representante del grupo, esta casada con el sr. Fausto  tienen 2 hijos uno se llama: Néstor Arturo el únicamente curso la secundaria y Martín que y  no quiso estudiar y prefirió irse a trabajar al campo, y el Sr. Isaías que es el papá de la Sra. Flor. 

Ella necesita un préstamo para que su negocio tenga una mejor presentación, necesita construir un espacio dentro de su casa para que ahí pueda guardar  los muebles y no se dañen con el ambiente, ella ya comenzó a constuir este espacio, sin embargo aún le hace falta mucho para poder terminarlo. Aunque en su comunidad existen negocios como este, sus clientes la prefieren a ella por que los muebles que ella vende son de mejor calildad y duran mucho más. 

Ella junto con sus compañeras trabajarán muy duro para salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
NOYOLOT GROUP (FLAT) The group is called noyolot, which in the Nahuatl language means “my love”. The town is situated in the highlands of Morelos in the municipality of Volcano Tétela where seasonal fruit is harvested almost year-round. The 5 members of the group are: Flor E. Pérez, Yolanda Alonso D. D., Herlinda N., Eduviges N. A., and A. Ernestina B.. All are residents of this town of Hueyapan. Flor and her husband make wood furniture, Herlinda has a small beauty salon, Yolanda sells Mexican snacks of pressed fruit. Hedwig and Ernestina sell seasonal fruit and also make hand-woven veils. Flor, the group representative, is married to Mr. Fausto and they have 2 children. One child, Nestor Arturo, has just started high school and the other son, Martin, would rather go to work in the fields than study. Mr. Isaiah is Ms. Flor’s father. She needs a loan to improve the presentation of her business. She needs to build a space inside her home so they can store the furniture there without it getting damaged by the weather. She already began to construct this space, but there is still much to be done. Although there are other businesses in her community like this, her customers prefer the furniture she sells as the quality is much better and it last much longer. She and her colleagues work very hard to get ahead and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material to construct the storage hall for the furniture they sell

loans.name: Leida Johanna

texts.es:
Leida B. de 26 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento. Solo cuenta con luz como servicio básico. Su esposo es chofer en una pastelería con el tiene 4 hijos de 6, 5, 3,2 años.   

Leida inicio su tienda hace 4 años con arroz y enlatados. Al tener capital bien establecido decidió poner un local en las afueras de su casa. Aunque no tenia experiencia en esta actividad tuvo que continuarla para poder mantener su hogar. 

Ahora ella trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 20h00 todos los días. Tiene en el día un promedio de 20 clientes. Vende arroz, aceite y carnes, una de las complicaciones para su tienda son las lluvias. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, aceite, azúcar para su tienda. En el futuro quiere tener sucursales de su tienda en todo Guayaquil.
texts.en:
Leida B., 26, lives in a periurban area of Fortín de Guayaquil. Her house is cement and the only basic service it has is electricity. Her husband is a delivery man for a pastry shop; they have 4 children, who are 6, 5, 3 and 2 years of age. Leida initiated her store four years ago selling rice and canned goods. Once she had accumulated some capital, she decided to set up her store outside her house. Although she had no experience in this line of work, she had to stay with it in order to provide support for her home. Now, she is open for business from 7am until 8pm every day. She averages 20 customers per day. She sells rice, cooking oil and meats. One of the obstacles she faces in her store is the rains. She will use the funds to buy rice, cooking oil and sugar for her store. In the future she would like to have branch stores in all of Guayaquil.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For rice, cooking oil, sugar.

loans.name: Las Vegas Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “LAS VEGAS”, actualmente se encuentra en el V ciclo y esta conformado por 13 personas trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, es un banco comunal conformado por socios que viven en la provincia de Cusco del departamento Cusco.  Cusco es una cuidad que se caracteriza por su Centro Histórico, sus paisajes, su historia siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región Sur del país. 

Las actividades económicas de los socios a las que se dedican son el comercio como por ejemplo venta de productos de construcción y venta producto de belleza y otros brindan servicio de docencia, servicio de llamadas de forma ambulatoria, servicio de administración de las discotecas “Las Vegas” y  “El Palacio del Folklore”, servicios de azafata en la discoteca Las Vegas, servicio de recepcionista y servicio de biología. El banco comunal tiene vaR. ciclos de funcionamiento, como manifiestan las socias, se encuentran contentas y satisfechas con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación, por el tiempo de permanencia en el banco comunal un aspecto de valoración es el ahorro por la posibilidad de capitalización que les brinda este servicio. 

Kathia es socia nueva del banco comunal Las Vegas, tiene 36 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene tres hijos. La socia Kathia vende producto de belleza y venta de ropa. La socia Kathia nos cuenta que ella trae la ropa de la ciudad de Desaguadero y la ciudad de Tacna y loS vende a personas conocidas y también a instituciones. La socia requiere el crédito para aumentar el negocio de venta de ropa y cosméticos y también para la educación de su hija mayor. La socia pide que sigan dando este tipo de créditos pues le da oportunidad para incrementar el negocio. Sobre todo ella nos cuenta que hay muchas mujeres que no tienen donde trabajar de forma independiente porque como mamas necesitan estar al cuidado de sus hijos y tener un ingreso adicional. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The “LAS VEGAS” communal bank is in its fifth loan cycle; it’s made up of 13 hard-working members who are always searching for opportunities to get ahead in life and to provide a better future for their children through their daily efforts. This is a communal bank composed of members who reside in Cusco province, Cusco department. Cusco is a city that is renowned for its historical city center, its scenery and its history; it is an enchanting city in the south of the country. The members are involved in a variety of commercial activities. For example: sales of building materials and beauty products; some are teachers and others sell phone services. Another administers the “Las Vegas” and “El Palacio del Folklore” discotheques while another is a hostess at the Las Vegas discotheque. One is a receptionist and another provides biological services. The communal bank has had several loan cycles. The members state that they are happy and satisfied with the credit services, the savings and the training received. They are particularly pleased with the savings that they can accrue by leaving their funds in a common account over time. Kathia is a new member of the Las Vegas communal bank. She is 36 years old, lives with her life partner and their three children. She sells beauty products and clothing. She tells us that she brings the clothing from the cities of Desaguadero and Tacna and sells them to acquaintances and to institutions. She needs financing to increase her stock and also to pay her oldest daughter’s school costs. She asks that she continue to receive this kind of loan so that her business can grow. Above all, she tells us that there are a lot of women who are unable to work independently because, being mothers; they must care for their children and have additional income. The members in general are grateful for the opportunity offered and pledge to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and cosmetics and for her oldest daughter's school costs.

loans.name: Fanny Maritza

texts.es:
la señora Fanny Maritza F. M. tiene 25 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Agustin Montalvan y tienen una niña pequeña a quien quieren mucho,  son una pareja muy trabajadora y con buenos principios morales.
la señora F. tiene una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, tiene 5 años de tener su negocio, desde un inicio fue una bonita pulperia bien ordenada y poco a poco a ido creciendo, la sra. F. esta solicitando un prestamo para surtir mas su negocio.
nos comento que esta muy feliz porque todo le esta saliendo bien y que espera que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Fanny is 25 years old. She is married to Agustin and they have a baby daughter whom they love very much. They are a very hard working couple with good moral principles. Fanny runs a grocery shop from her home. She has been running this business for five years. It’s been a nice and well organized shop since the start and she has been growing it little by little. Fanny is requesting this loan in order to offer a greater variety to her business. She tells us that she is very happy because everything is turning out well for her and she expects that her business will continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jamilett Del Carmen

texts.es: Jamilett Del Carmen tiene 37 años de edad, su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que es una mujer que disfruta con sus clientes el ofrecer sus productos, ella sale de su vivienda todos los días en busca de nuevos clientes, por lo que además tiene un trabajo en la alcaldía es aquí ya que busca la amanera de obtener más ingresos para su familia por lo que tiene 3 hijos de los cuales tiene que hacerse cargo. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Jamilett Del Carmen, 37, sells general merchandise. She has been in this line of work for over 5 years; she enjoys interacting with her customers when she offers her products. She leaves home every day in search of new customers. She also works for City Hall and looks for ways to earn extra income for her family. She has three children to support. For this reason, she is asking for funding to buy merchandise. Her desire is to improve her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory.

loans.name: Marie Ndiolé

texts.en: Marie Ndiolé D. is 30 years old, married and the mother of four children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NGASCOP for 3 1/2 years and has always paid back her loans on time. As her main activity, she sells groceries and various other products. With this loan, Madame D. will buy cereals and vegetables to bolster her shop.

loans.use: To purchase cereals and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more eggs, beans, salt and tomatoes.

loans.name: Esperanza En Cristo Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario Esperanza en Cristo esta ubicado en la colonia Buena Vista cerca del campo de futbol. este grupo esta integrado por tres miembros, todos vecinos de la comunidad y se conocen desde hace tiempos,  se han organizado en grupo para obtener un prestamo monetario y asi salir adelante con sus negocios. a continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:
 
el señor Oscar Romeo R. tiene cuatro hijos que estan estudiando, la madre de sus hijos se fue a España en busca de trabajo y le manda dinero para sus hijos. Oscar trabaja vendiendo agua en su coche y quiere comprarse otro carro ya que a visto que el negocio de venta de agua es muy bueno y es por esta razon que solicita el credito para completar el dinero que le cuesta el carro.
la señora Belkis Marina A. E. tiene 25 años de edad, el padre de sus hijos se fue a USA
en busca de trabajo y el le ayuda economicamente con los dos hijos que tienen.
Belkis esta solicitando el credito para compra de carnes y verduras, Belkis se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de golosinas y jugos naturales.
la señora Oneyda Yamileth R. A. tiene 30 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de abarroteria y frescos  esta solicitando el credito para surtir un poco mas su negocio, desea tener su
pulperia surtida para poder cubrir con todas las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Esperanza en Cristo” (Hope in Christ) communal bank is located in the Buena Vista neighborhood close to the football field. The group is composed of three members, all neighbors who have known each other for a long time. They have formed into a group to seek funding to move their businesses forward. Following are their various commercial activities: Oscar Romeo Rodríguez has four children who are students. Their mother went to Spain in search of work and she sends back money for the children. Oscar drives around in his car selling water and he would like to buy another car because the business of selling water is a good one. This is why he’s asking for a loan: to complete what he needs to buy the car. Belkis Marina A. E. is 25 years old. The father of her children went to the United States to seek work; he sends financial help for their two children. Belkis is asking for funding to buy meats and vegetables; she makes and sells snacks and natural fruit juices. Oneyda Yamileth Rodríguez A. is 30 years old. She sells groceries and soft-drinks. She is asking for funds to stock her store. She wants to have a well-stocked store to meet customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables, beans, rice, sugar, coffee, bread, soft-drinks, juices, canned and bagged water, beef, pork and chicken.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Amigos Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “AMIGOS EMPRENDEDORES”, actualmente se encuentra en el IX ciclo y esta conformado por 15 personas trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, es un banco comunal conformado por socios que viven en la provincia de Cusco del departamento Cusco.  Cusco es una cuidad que se caracteriza por su Centro Histórico, sus paisajes, su historia siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región Sur del país.

Las actividades económicas de los socios a las que se dedican son el comercio como por ejemplo venta de prendas de vestir,  venta de comestibles, venta de comida, venta de ropa y venta de útiles escolares y otros brindan servicios de guía de turismo. El banco comunal tiene varios ciclos de funcionamiento, como manifiestan las socias, se encuentran contentas y satisfechas con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación, por el tiempo de permanencia en el banco comunal un aspecto de valoración es el ahorro por la posibilidad de capitalización que les brinda este servicio. 

Lorenza es socia del banco comunal Amigos Emprendedores, tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos (Maria, Lisbeth y Patricia). La socia se dedica a la venta de ropa en el centro comercial “San José” en la calle Trinitarias de la ciudad Cusco. Lorenza nos cuenta que ella trae ropa de la ciudad de desaguadero como por ejemplo casacas. Ya son 10 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone su trabajo. La socia requiere el crédito de los 800 soles para comprar útiles escolares. La socia también nos cuenta que cuando empieza la campaña escolar guarda su mercadería de ropa y arreglar su tienda para vender útiles escolares. 
        
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The “AMIGOS EMPRENDEDORES” (ENTERPRISING FRIENDS) communal bank is in its 9th loan cycle; it is composed of 15 hard-working persons who are always seeking opportunities to get ahead in life and to provide, through their daily efforts, a better future for their children. They reside in Cusco province, Cusco department. Cusco is a city that is renowned for its historical city center, its scenery and its history; it is an enchanting city in the south of the country. The members are involved in a variety of commercial activities. Some sell clothing, others sell food. Others sell clothing or school supplies and some are tourist guides. The communal bank has had several loan cycles and the members state that they are happy and satisfied with the credit services, the savings and the training they receive. They are particularly happy with the savings they can accrue by leaving their funds in a common account over time. Lorenza is a member of the Amigos Emprendedores communal bank. She is 45 years old, married, and has three children (Maria, Lisbeth and Patricia). She sells clothing in the “San José” shopping center on Cusco’s Trinitarias street. Lorenza tells us that she brings the clothes, like coats, from the city of Desaguadero. She has been in this line of work for 10 years and has done well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She need and 800 sol loan to buy school supplies. She tells us that when the new school year is about to start, she puts away all her clothing and concentrates on selling school supplies. The members as a whole are grateful for the opportunity granted by this means and pledge to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies.

loans.name: Marie Dianké

texts.en: Marie Dianké G. is a 34-year-old married woman from the region of Diourbel, Senegal. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NGASCOP for 9 years and has paid back her previous loans on time. She raises cattle and sells them at the nearby agricultural market of Bambey. This loan allows her to buy new cattle. With the earnings from selling them at the market, she can improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase young cattle

loans.name: William De Los Reyes

texts.es: El señor William tiene 1 hijo de dos años de edad, es casado. El señor William anteriormente solicito un préstamo para compra de medicamentos, ahora está solicitando este nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de medicamentos veterinarios, ya que el señor sale a vender a la zona norte del país y además ahora está saliendo a vender al Caribe, ya que compro una moto y le permite movilizarse con mayor facilidad. Cabe señalarse, sus productos los compra en Managua al por mayor para obtener mejores precios y obtener mayores ganancias. Don William dio inicio a su negocio hace ya 5 años, buscando una fuente alternativa de ingresos para brindarle manutención a su familia. Poco a poco fue haciéndose de inventario y fue de esta manera que consiguió sus clientes que ahora solicitan pedidos grandes. Este crédito será invertido en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercancías, ya que desea surtir con una mejor variedad de productos para ofrecer distintas mercancías en la búsqueda de vender más. Su sueño continua siendo convertirse en un distribuidor de mercancías veterinarias al por mayor.
texts.en:
William is married and has a 2-year-old son. He requested a prior loan to buy medicine. Now he is asking for a new loan to buy veterinary medicines because he travels to the north of the country to sell them; he is now also traveling to the Caribbean coast too because he bought a motorcycle that makes it easier for him to move about. It is worth mentioning that he buys his products in Managua at wholesale to get better prices and sell for higher profits. William started his business 5 years ago seeking an alternative source of income in order to feed his family. Gradually, he acquired more inventory and customers who now place large orders with him. This loan will be used to buy larger amounts of product because he wants to have a wider variety of stock available in an effort to sell more. He continues to dream with becoming a wholesale veterinary products distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy veterinary medicines.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es: El Sr. Elias es casado y tiene 4 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar,  vive y trabaja en surutu hace 21 años,  trabajan justamente con su esposa, siembran maiz, arros, mani, y papa, tiene 33 años   y hace 4 años que el viene trabajando con EMPRENDER por la facilidad de pago. surutu se encuentra al oeste de el torno a 41 km, El Sr. Elias es una persona responsable nunca tubo problemas con el pago de su cuota, es muy trabajador y siempre esta viendo que mas plantar en sus tierras ya que con 4 hijos aveces no le alcanza el dinero y tiene que darse modos para llevar el pan de cada dia a su casa. Con el dinero del credito comprara semillas para plantar Papa en sus tierras ya que es temporada de siembra, esta agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Elias, 33, is married and has 4 school-age children. He has lived and worked in Surutu, which is 41 kilometers west of El Torno, for 21 years. He and his wife work together farming corn, rice, peanuts and potatoes. He has collaborated with EMPRENDER for 4 years because of the easy payment terms. Elias is a responsible person; he never had any problems repaying his loans. He is very hard-working and is looking for other products to plant on his lands because, with four children to raise, sometimes income isn't sufficient and he has to find ways to provide sustenance for his family. The funds will be used to buy potato seed because now is planting season. He is grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in him by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potato seed.

loans.name: Togetherness Group

texts.en:
Alpha K. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Togetherness Group.  He is 44 years old, married, and has seven children who range from four to 20 years old.  Alpha was unable to attend school due to poverty. For six years, Alpha has been selling charcoal at the Boaka Town Market, just north of downtown Monrovia.
