He says he is friendly with his customers, which keeps them returning. Alpha plans to use his 10,000 Liberian dollar loan to buy more charcoal.  His goal is to open his own shop and to send all of his children to school. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Alpha is the one holding the sign.  Sanii B. is inset at lower right.

About LEAP:

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase additional charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more charcoal.

loans.name: God Gift Provision Business Center Group

texts.en:
Varney M. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called God Gift Provision Business Center. He is 40 years old, married, and has four children who range from five to eight years old. He was only able to attend school through sixth grade due to poverty. For 15 years, Varney has been selling dry goods such as candles, soap, and body cream in the Moulton Corner Market in Monrovia, Liberia.  He sells dry goods in a friendly manner, which keeps customers returning.  Varney plans to use his 10,000 Liberian dollar loan to buy more dry goods, such as candles, soap and body cream. His goal is to own a store and to continue to support his family.  He also wants to give his children a good education so that they can have a better future. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Varney is the one holding the sign. Makai S. is inset at the lower right.

About LEAP:

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more dry goods, such as candles, soap and body cream.

loans.name: El Buen Pastor Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario el Buen Pastor esta ubicado en el mercado viejo de San Lorenzo, esta integrado por tres personas las cuales tienen mucho tiempo de conocerse. a continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:
 
la señora Maria Pricila O. tiene 43 años de edad,  tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella, es madre soltera, esta solicitando el credito para la compra de frutas.
 
la señora Zoila Ernestina A. tiene 44 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Jose Francisco Hernandez. Zoila se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas, las vende en el mercado viejo de san lorenzo, esta solicitando el credito para comprar harina de maiz, leña, cal y agua.
Tiene la ayuda de sus hijas para la produccion de sus tortillas.
 
la señora Kledyn Yolibeth R. F. tiene 24 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos pequeños,  no tiene casa propia. Kledyn se dedica a la venta de tamales y chorizos. Kledyn esta solicitando el credito para comprar carne de cerdo y pollo para hacer los tamales. su deseo es tener algun dia su casa para darle un buen futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Buen Pastor Communal Bank is located in the old market of San Lorenzo. It is comprised of three people who have known each other for a long time. What follows are the details of their different business activities: Maria Pricila O. is 43 years old and has two dependent children. She is a single mother. She is requesting the loan to buy fruit. Zoila Ernestina A. is 44 years old. She is in a common law marriage with Jose Francisco Hernandez. Zoila makes and sells tortillas. She sells them in the old market of San Lorenzo. She is requesting the loan to buy corn flour, firewood, lime, and water. Her daughters help her make the tortillas. Kledyn Yolibeth R. F. is 24 years old. She is a single mother, and she has two small children. She does not have her own house. Kledyn sells tamales and sausages. Kledyn is requesting the loan to buy pork and chicken to make the tamales. Her dream is to one day have a house to give her children a good future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruit, corn flour, lime, firewood, pork, chicken, sausages, vegetables and condiments

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more slippers and underclothes for sale.

loans.name: Ilarion

texts.es: El Sr. Ilarion, esta casado y tiene hijos pequeños y hace 20 años que viene trabajando en su comunidad a 41 km del torno y hace 4 años que biene trabajando con EMPRENDER es un cliente responsable en el pago de sus cuotas, muy trabajador y siempre pensando que va a sembrar segun la temporada, despues de cosechar los productos. lo comercializa en un mercado de la zona, con el dinero del credito comprara semillas para la siembra de Papa, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Ilarion is married and has three children. He has worked in his community, which is 41 kilomenters from El Torno, for 20 years. He has collaborated with EMPRENDER for 4 years and has proven to be a responsible client with respect to repayments, very hard-working and always thinking about what he will plant each season. After harvesting his crops, he sells them in a local market. He will use the funds to buy potato seed. He is very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in him by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potato seed.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: El señor Gilberto tiene 50 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad y viven aparte. El señor se dedica al transporte de materiales de construcción, negocio que atiende en su casa de habitación para realizar los contratos, el tiene un camión para ir a traer los materiales. El señor dio inicio a este negocio desde hace veinte años, dio inicio con pequeños viajes al mercado oriental a comprar productos ferreteros, cuando logro adquirir una camioneta fue que empezó a comprar materiales de construcción y fue hace 6 años que logro tener lo suficiente ahorrado para poder comprar un camión, que es el que utiliza actualmente para trasladar los materiales de construcción. El señor está solicitando este crédito con el objetivo realizar compras de materiales variados, ya que estos actualmente han subido de precio y cada día necesita manejar mayor capital para dar respuesta a sus clientes, ya que él tiene que comprar en efectivo y hasta después le pagan los clientes. El señor hace unos años fue diagnosticado de cáncer, lo cual le impidió trabajar por un tiempo ya que fue operado y estuvo en recuperación, sin embargo a la fecha se encuentra en óptimas condiciones. Su sueño, es tener un centro bien establecido de venta de materiales de construcción como la de su competencia, en la cual sus proveedores puedan llevarle los materiales.
texts.en:
Gilberto is 50, married, and has two children. The children are grown and live separately. He transports construction materials. He takes care of the business in his house; he makes the contracts there. He has a truck to go get the materials. He started this business 20 years ago. He started with small trips to the Eastern market to buy hardware products. It was when he got a van that he started to buy construction materials. Six years ago he had enough saved to be able to buy a truck. That is what he currently uses to transport the construction materials. He is asking for this loan to buy various materials. The prices have currently risen, and everyday he needs more money in order to make deliveries to his customers. He needs to buy with cash, and his customers pay later. A few years ago he was diagnosed with cancer. That kept him from working for a time. He had an operation, and then there was recuperation. Now he is in great condition. His dream is to have a well established center, like the competition has, for selling construction materials. His suppliers could bring the materials to him there.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: El señor Francisco José tiene 55 años de edad, es casado pero no tiene hijos. El señor brinda negocio de transporte, ya que es poseedor de una unidad de taxi. francisco  tiene trece años de dedicarse a esta actividad, sin embargo fue hace siete años que logro obtener su taxi propio, con los ahorros que obtuvo durante 5 años, lo cual le ha brindado una mayor estabilidad económica ya que ahora las ganancias le quedan a él. El señor está solicitando este crédito con el objetivo de realizar unas compras de artículos para el vehículo, ya que necesita algunas reparaciones. Cabe señalar, que el vehículo está en muy buen estado, sin embargo desea mejorarlo. Actualmente, al igual que todo el sector transporte está enfrentando el desafío de mantener los precios y las ganancias, pese a la alta inestabilidad del combustible, lo cual hace que cada día sea más cara la canasta básica y todos los artículos. Su sueño es tener una empresa de taxis de al menos 5 vehículos, y con las ganancias poder algún día comprar su propio terreno y su propia casa.
texts.en:
Francisco José is 55 and married, but he does not have children. He is in the transportation business; he has a taxi. He has been in this business for 13 years. Seven years ago he got his own taxi with five years of savings. This has given him greater economic stability because now the earnings stay with him. He is asking for this loan to buy some things for his vehicle because it needs some repairs. He points out that the vehicle is in very good condition, but he wants to improve it. Like everyone else in the transportation sector, he is confronted with the challenge of maintaining his prices and earnings amid the great instability of gas prices. This makes the price of basic needs more expensive everyday. His dream is to have a taxi business with at least five vehicles. With the income he would one day be able to buy his own land and his own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: La Hermandad Group

texts.es:
el grupo La Hermandad esta integrado por tres mujeres que son muy amigas y son dedicadas al comercio,
este grupo esta solicitando el credito para invertirlo en sus negocios. a continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:
 
la señora Gloria Jamileth S. tiene 33 años de edad, vive en union libre con Luis Armando Medina Castro quien se dedica a la construccion, tienen 3 hijos que estan estudiando. doña Gloria se dedica a venta de pescado y camaron, solicita el credito para invertirlo en dicha actividad. en esta epoca de semana santa se vende mucho el pescado.
 
la señora Gloria Argentina M. tiene 52 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Miguel Angel S. quien se dedica  a la construccion, no tienen hijos. La señora M. se dedica a la venta de productos de la canasta basica como ser azucar, harina de maiz, manteca, refrescos, aceite y otros.
esta solicitando el credito para invertirlo en su pulperia
 
La señora Eiby Melissa H. tiene 27 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Francisco Zamora quien se dedica a la venta de mariscos.
Tienen 2 hijos pequeños, Eiby se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion. ahi vende azucar,café, jugos, jabon, refrescos, pollo, verduras, y tambien pescado. esta solicitando el credito para surtir un poco mas su negocio.
texts.en:
The La Hermandad group is comprised of three women who are very good friends, and they are devoted to commerce. The group is asking for a loan to invest in their businesses. What follows are details of their different economic activities: Gloria Jamileth Sanches is 33 years old and in a common law marriage with Luis Armando Medina Castro, a construction worker. They have three children who go to school. Gloria sells fish and shrimp. She is requesting the loan to invest in this activity. A lot of fish is sold during this time of Holy Week. Gloria Argentina M. is 52, and she is married to Miguel Angel S., a construction worker. They do not have children. Mrs. M. sells basic needs food products like sugar, corn flour, shortening, soft drinks, oil, and others. She is requesting the loan to invest in her mini-market. Eiby Melissa H. is 27, and she is in a common law marriage to Francisco Zamora. He sells seafood. They have two small children. Eiby sells popular consumption products. She has a mini-market in her home. She sells sugar, coffee, juice, soap, soft drinks, chicken, vegetables, and fish. She is requesting the loan to stock her business a little more.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fish, shrimp, beans, rice, corn, tortillas, sugar, coffee, bread, crackers, churros, soft drinks, soap, pastas, salsas, soup, preserves, juice, shortening, and oil

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es: Alba Luz tiene 37 años, ella se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, por lo que tiene más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella es una persona muy luchadora y que diariamente se gana el pan de cada día. Además de realizar esto los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de comida, pues ciertos vecinos llegan a disfrutar de sus deliciosos platillos, ella se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para comenzar la preparación de los refrescos naturales que son muy deliciosos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo gaseosas, frutas naturales, bolsas, azúcar entre otras cosas. Su deseo es proporcionar mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Alba Luz is 37 years old, and she sells soft drinks. She has been in this business for over six years. She is a very tenacious person, and everyday she earns her daily bread. Also, on the week ends she sells food. Some of her neighbors come to enjoy her delicious dishes. She gets up at five in the morning to start preparing the natural soft drinks that are so delicious. The loan she is requesting is for working capital for soft drinks, natural fruits, bags, and sugar, among other things. Her wish is to make improvements to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Qorichaska Del Cusco Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “QORICHASKA DEL CUSCO”, actualmente se encuentra en el XIII ciclo y esta conformado por 16 personas trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, es un banco comunal conformado por socios que viven en la provincia D. Cusco del departamento Cusco.  Cusco es una cuidad que se caracteriza por su Centro Histórico, sus paisajes, su historia siendo una ciudad encantadora D. la Región Sur del país. (Qorichaska es una palabra D. la lengua nativa del quechua que  traducido al español significa estrella D. oro). 

Las actividades económicas D. los socios a las que se dedican son el comercio como por ejemplo venta D. prendas D. vestir,  venta D. cosméticos,  venta D. zapatos, venta D. ropa y venta D. útiles escolares y otros brindan servicios transportes, enseñanza y costura.  El banco comunal tiene varios ciclos D. funcionamiento, como manifiestan las socias, se encuentran contentas y satisfechas con los servicios D. crédito, ahorro y capacitación, por el tiempo D. permanencia en el banco comunal un aspecto D. valoración es el ahorro por la posibilidad D. capitalización que les brinda este servicio. 

Yaneth es socia del banco comunal Qorichaska, tiene 60 años D. edad, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijas (Karen y Krystel). La socia se dedica a la venta D. artículos según  la temporada por ejemplo en las fiestas D. navidad venD. por ejemplo vinos y por campaña escolar venD. por ejemplo útiles como uniformes y mochilas. Yaneth nos cuenta que ella trae los uniformes D. la ciudad D. Tacna. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone su trabajo. La socia Yaneth pertenece al banco comunal hace a 15 años y al principio se prestaba 100 dólares, ahora las socia requiere el crédito D. los 300 dólares para la educación D. su hija. La socia también nos cuenta que uno D. sus anhelos es abrir una tienda donD. pueda vender sus productos y viajar al país D. México. 
        
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. (Los socios Luzmila, Cira y Delfín no aparecen en la fotografía porque pidieron permiso a la junta directiva para no asistir al desembolso).
texts.en:
The “QORICHASKA DEL CUSCO” communal bank is in its 13th loan cycle; it is composed of 16 hard-working people who are always seeking ways to get ahead in life and, through their daily effort, proviD. a better future for their children. The members are residents of Cusco province, Cusco department. Cusco is a city that is renowned for its historic city center, its scenery and its history; it is an enchanting city in the south of the country (Qorichaska is a Quechua word that means “golden star). The members are involved in a variety of commercial activities. Some sell clothing, other sell cosmetics, shoes or clothes. Some sell school supplies while others proviD. public transportation services, are teachers or seamstresses. The communal bank has had several loan cycles and the members state that they are happy and satisfied with the credit services, the savings and the training they get. They especially appreciate the savings they can accrue by leaving their funds in a common account over time. Yaneth is a member of the Qorichaska communal bank. She is 60 years old and is a single mother of two daughters, Karen and Krystel. She sells seasonal articles. For example, during the Christmas season she sell wine and when the new school year is about to start, she sells school supplies like uniforms and knapsacks. Yaneth tells us that she brings the school uniforms from the city of Tacna. She has been in this line of work for several years and has done well thanks to the efforts she puts into it. She has been a member of the communal bank for 15 years. At the beginning she would borrow 100 dollars but now, she heeds 300 dollars to pay educational costs for her daughter. She also tells us that among her goals is opening a store in which to sell her products and to visit Mexico. The members, as a whole, are grateful for the opportunity provided and pledge to repay in a timely fashion. (The members Luzmila, Cira and Delfín do not appear in the group photo because they asked the governing board for permission to miss the disbursement meeting).

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For her daughter's school expenses.

loans.name: Mujeres Necesitadas 1 Group

texts.en:
Altagracia is a thirty-two-year-old borrower who lives in Hato Mayor, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Mujeres Necesitadas (Women in Need), and her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Altagracia and her husband have five children and live in a simple home in Hato Mayor, a small rural town in the agricultural area in the eastern part of the Dominican Republic. Life in the Dominican Republic can be rough; they do not have potable running water, there are frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with), and the health care is inadequate. Despite these difficulties, Altagracia runs a successful business selling clothing. With this loan, Altagracia plans to purchase new clothing to sell at a small markup to her friends and neighbors.
 
This is Altagracia’s eighth loan with Esperanza International, and she hopes to continue taking out loans to grow her business and improve life for her family. With her profits, she also hopes to one day build her own home. Altagracia looks forward to sending her children to college someday, an opportunity she did not have as a young adult. This will give her children a step up in society and allow them to pursue any career that they choose.

Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in eleven offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for lending to Altagracia and the Mujeres Necesitadas group!

loans.use: To buy new clothing for resale

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Guadalupe de edad de 36 años, vive junto a su familia, su esposo y tres hijos que procreo, su esposo se dedica al comercio a la venta de repuestos de vehiculo. El negocio de la señora Guadalupe es la venta de ropa y variedades, pues lleva varios años en las ventas, el cual inicio con venta de zapatos, con ayuda de su compañero y ahorros que tenia. Con los financiamiento de la institución ha venido ah incrementar el negocio pero esta vez lo quiere para comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un cuarto en la parte de atrás del terreno, el cual comprara piedra, arena, cemento, hierro y zinc. Y lograr con esta mejora una mejor comodidad, sus planes es poder aumentar sus ventas y seguir ayudando a sus pequeños para un porvenir mejor.
texts.en:
Guadalupe, 36, lives with her husband and three children. Her husband is a merchant; he sells vehicle spare parts. Guadalupe sells clothing and general merchandise. She has been in this line of work for several years; she started out selling shoes using some of her savings and help from her husband. With the institution's loans she has been able to enlarge her business but, what she needs on this occasion, is to buy building materials to build a room in the rear of her property. She will buy stone, sand, cement, iron and zinc metal sheeting, hoping to increase her comfort level with this addition. Her plans are to continue expanding her sales and continue to help her little ones attain a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Mano Amiga 1, 2 Group

texts.en:
Juliana is the coordinator of her group Mano Amiga (Friendly Hand), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican  clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the Samana peninsula, a lush, rugged area with a nascent tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their two children.

Juliana is excited to be taking her sixth loan  with Esperanza  after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing and Avon beauty products by purchasing pants, shirts, skirts, creams, perfumes, and makeup in the capital and then bringing her merchandise back to her community to sell. She will use the profits in her home by constructing a bathroom, to help her children by purchasing school supplies, food, and clothing for them, and in her business by purchasing a scooter to make moving around with her merchandise easier. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and beauty products for sale

loans.name: Anita Maria

texts.es:
Anita M. de 36 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y si cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su esposo es albañil con el tiene 2 hijos. 

Anita inicio hace 6 años atrás vendiendo almuerzo a sus vecinos, aunque no era mucho lo que ganaba decidió invertir sus ahorros en el restaurante. 

Con ayuda de la inversión ahora tiene un restaurante a las afuera de su casa. Trabaja desde las 06h00 hasta las 23h00 todo los días. Los platos que vende son los típicos del Ecuador como arroz con pollo, guatita, caldo de bola, caldo de pata etc.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar carnes, arroz, legumbres para su restaurante. En el futuro quiere tener muchos mas clientes y así darles un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Anita M., 36, lives in a periurban area of Paraíso de Guayaquil. Her house is cement and has all basic services. Her husband is a brick layer and they have two children. Anita started selling lunches to her neighbors 6 years ago. Although her earnings weren't large, she decided to invest her savings in a restaurant. With help from this investment, she now has a restaurant outside her home. She is open for business from 6am until 11pm every day. She sells typical Ecuadorean dishes like: rice and beans, guatita (stewed beef tripe in peanut sauce), caldo de bola (green plantain dumpling soup), caldo de pata (a broth containing chunks of boiled cow hooves, considered a delicacy by locals and believed by hopeful men to increase virility), etc. She will use the funds to buy meats, rice and vegetables for her restaurant. In the future, she would like to have many more customers and to provide better service to them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For rice, meats and vegetables.

loans.name: Renovacion 2-5 Group

texts.en:
Sujeiri, 29, is a borrower who lives in Samana, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Renovación (Renewal), and her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Sujeiri and her husband have one child and live in a simple home in Samana, a beautiful and sparsely populated peninsula in the northeastern part of the Dominican Republic. Life in rural areas of the Dominican Republic can be rough, with no potable running water, frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with), and inadequate access to healthcare. Despite these difficulties, Sujeiri runs a successful business running a small eatery. With this loan, Sujeiri plans to purchase more food including rice, beans, and sugar.
 
This is Sujeiri’s sixth loan with Esperanza International, and she hopes to continue taking out loans to grow her business and improve life for her family. With her profits, Sujeiri hopes to purchase equipment so that she can also start baking cakes. She will also use her profits to purchase school supplies for her daughter, including a backpack, notebooks, and pencils. Sujeiri is currently studying as well, and her loans have provided her business with the profits that will get her through school. In the future, Sujeiri hopes to build a house of her own that she can pass along to her family.

Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in eleven offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for lending to Sujeiri and the Renovación group!

loans.use: To purchase rice, beans, and sugar for meal preparation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Anita

texts.es: Anita se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, por lo que tiene más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que tiene que mantener a sus 2 hijos que son menores de edad. Por lo que desde muy temprano ella se levanta a organizar los productos que tiene que mostrar a cada uno de sus clientes, por lo que cada uno tiene diferentes gustos y además los encargos son diferentes. Pues ella es una persona muy responsable. Ella necesita este financiamiento para la compra de lápiz labial, maquillaje, cremas, colonias y shampoo. Su deseo es establecer una tienda en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Anita has sold cosmetics for over 3 years. She is in this line of work because she has two, minor children to support. Because of this, she rises very early in the morning to organize the products that she must show each of her customers because each one of them has her own particular taste and the orders placed are all different. She is a very responsible person. She needs the financing to buy lipsticks, make-up, creams, colognes and shampoo. Her wish is to set up a store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Adriana Del Socorro

texts.es: Adriana Del Socorro tiene 57 años, ella es muy buena persona pues tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000, siempre se ha preocupado por pagar en tiempo y forma sus cuotas. Su actividad que es la venta de tortillas y además la elaboración y venta de comida demuestran lo emprendedora que es Adriana pues siempre mantuvo a sus 6 hijos, de una forma digna y responsable. Ella se levanta a las 5 de la mañana pues una persona tiene que ir al moler el maíz para tener lista la masa, después ella se encarga de la elaboración de sus tortillas, es una persona muy reconocida en su cuadra por sus vecinos. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de cal, maíz, leña, bolsas plásticas entre otras cosas. Ella desea proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda y tener una persona que le ayude a la elaboración de las tortillas.
texts.en:
Adriana Del Socorro, 57, is a very good person who has collaborated with Fundación León 2000 for a long time. She has always striven to make her payments in a timely fashion. She makes and sells tortillas and prepared meals. She has proven herself to be an enterprising woman for she has supported her 6 children in a dignified and responsible way. She rises at 5am because she has to go grind the corn to have the dough ready, then she makes the tortillas; she is very well-known on her block by her neighbors. She will use the funds to buy corn, firewood, lime powder and plastic bags, among other items. She wants to do some home improvements and to employ someone to help her make the tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lime powder, firewood, plastic bags, etc.

loans.name: Santos Ramon

texts.es:
el señor Santos Ramon C. tiene 30 años de edad, vive en union libre con la señora Maria Estela C. Aguilar quien se dedica a cuidar a sus dos hijos y realiza los oficios de la casa.
ellos viven en la aldea San Martin. Santos Trabaja como guardia de seguridad en una empresa privada en la ciudad de San Lorenzo. labora de lunes a sabado.
Ramon esta solicitando el prestamo para el comienzo de una construccion en la aldea Guanacastillo 
Pavana en donde construira una casa, ya que en dicho lugar adquirio un terreno y se van a ir a vivir ahi cuando termine de construir, ya tiene varios materiales pero le hacen falta unos para empezar con su casa. 
Terminando de construir su casa les dara una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Santos Ramon C., 30, lives with his life partner, Maria Estela C. Aguilar, who cares for their two children and does the household chores. They live in the village of San Martin. Santos works as a security guard in a private firm in San Lorenzo, Monday through Saturday. Ramon is asking for funding to start a building project in the village of Guanacastillo Pavana where they will build a house because they bought a lot there and will move there when the house is finished. He has some of the materials but still needs others to start the construction project. Finishing the house will improve his family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cesar Eduardo

texts.es:
Cesar M. de 32 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y si cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su esposa trabaja en una tabacalera con ella tiene 2 hijos. 

Cesar inicio con una pequeña tienda hace ya muchos años, cuando solo tenía arroz y azúcar para vender implemento vender aceite y enlatados. 

Ahora el tiene una tienda muy surtida con enlatados, carnes, frutas, aceites y otros productos. Trabaja desde las 06h30 hasta las 21h30. Quiere implementar la venta de ropa y artículos personales. Uno de los inconvenientes que tiene en su negocio es la delincuencia en el sector.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, zapatos y arroz para su tienda. En el futuro quiere trasladar su tienda a otro sector para evitar la delincuencia.
texts.en:
Cesar M., 32, lives in a periurban area of Paraíso de Guayaquil; his house is cement and it has all basic services. His wife works on a tobacco farm and they have two children together. Cesar started with a small store many years ago when he only sold rice and sugar; later he added cooking oil and canned goods. Now he has a well-stocked store with canned goods, meats, fruit, cooking oil and other products. He is open for business from 6:30am to 9:30pm. He wants to start selling clothing and personal articles. One of the obstacles he faces is the high crime rate in the area. He will use the funds to buy notebooks, shoes and rice for his store. In the future he would like to move his store to a different neighborhood to avoid the crime.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For notebooks, shoes and rice.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.en:
Roxana, the owner of Sweet Voices Daycare Center, has a clear vision for the future of her business and the determination and experience to back it up. After working at a pre-school for ten years, Roxana enrolled herself in classes through a community resource center that focused specifically on how to start a daycare. In 2003, armed with grant funding and her childcare certificate, Roxana opened her own in-home daycare business.

Since starting her own daycare seven years ago, Roxana has continued to take child development classes in order to integrate new learning programs into her work with the children she cares for. The classes, she explains, complement a natural affinity for her chosen career. “God has given me the patience and wisdom I need for this job. Child development taught me about the character of each child. They respect me, and I respect them. I love this work; it is my calling.”

A loan of $5,000 will pay for two computers (one to help Roxana manage her business and the other with learning software for the children) as well as a desk, new games, and safety improvements to the patio for outside activities. “I’m not content to stay where I am. I want to keep growing, I want to accomplish more. And when I want to do something, nothing can get in my way.”

loans.use: To buy two computers, computer software, furniture, safety equipment and games

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
el señor Teofilo O. tiene 55 años de edad, vive en union libre con la señora  Juana Hernandez, tienen dos hijos que dependen de ellos,  tiene una pulperia en donde vende arroz, frijoles, maiz, azucar, frescos, jugos, harina de maiz y otros productos de la canasta basica familiar.
 
este negocio lo tiene desde hace varios años, el cual esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion en la aldea El Caimito, esta solicitando el credito para compra de varios prodcutos al por mayor. el lugar en donde el vive es un poco retirado y cuesta que lleguen los carros repartidores, solo una vez por semana, esto le dificulta a el, ya que muchas veces se le termina el producto y tiene que esperar hasta que pase de nuevo el carro repartidor para poder abastecerse de mercaderia, por tal razon es que esta solicitando el credito.
texts.en:
Teofilo O., 55, lives in a common-law relationship with Juana Hernandez; they have two children that depend on them. He has a grocery store where he sells rice, beans, corn, sugar, soft-drinks, juices, cornmeal and other products that are part of the basic family shopping cart. He has had this store for several years; it is located in his home in the village of El Caimito. He is asking for funding to buy several products at wholesale. The place where he lives is a bit remote and it's difficult for delivery trucks to come by; they only do so once a week. This is a problem for him because he often runs out of a product and has to wait until the delivery truck comes by again to resupply; this is why he needs funding.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beans, rice, sugar, coffee, water, soups, toilet paper, candles, matches, milk, soap, soft-drinks, lard, cooling oil, cookies, bread.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Martha Patricia

texts.es: Martha Patricia tiene 35 años, por lo que su actividad económica es ofrecer el servicio de costura. Por lo que tiene más de 10 años de proporcionar este servicio que es su único medio de ingreso para mantener a sus 2 hijos. Además de Martha tiene conocimiento de otro negocio que es la crianza de cerdos, ya que este negocio se lo heredo su Mama y fue así que aprendió esta otra actividad. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como tela, zipper, agujas y tijeras. Martha sueña con establece un taller en su vivienda ya que en su comarca hay muchos pedidos.
texts.en:
Martha Patricia, 35, is a seamstress. She has been in this line of work, which is her sole source of income to support her two children, for over 10 years. In addition, Martha also raises pigs, an occupation she inherited from her mother, who taught her these skills. She is asking for funding to buy supplies like: fabric, zippers, needles and scissors. Martha dreams with establishing a workshop in her home because she gets a lot of work orders in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es:
el señor Modesto G. tiene 47 años de edad, vive en union libre y tiene 4 hijos, dos de ellos estan en la escuela. Su mujer trabaja en una empacadora de camaron y le ayuda con algunos gastos del hogar.
Modesto se dedica a atender una pulperia que tiene en su casa de habitacion desde hace 2 años, sus ventas son diarias de lunes a domingo, vende productos tales como arroz, maiz, harina, refrescos, jugos, lacteos, embutidos, agua en bolsa y otros.
esta solicitando el credito para la compra de abarroteria en general al por mayor, asi los compra mas baratos y obtiene mayores ganancias, las cuales las necesita para cumplir con todas sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Modesto G., 47, lives with his partner; they have 4 children, two of whom are in school. His wife works at a shrimp packing plant and contributes to household expenses. Modesto has had a grocery store in his home for the last 2 years. He is open for business seven days a week; he sell such things as: rice, corn, flour, soft-drinks, dairy products, cured meats, bags of water, etc. He is asking for funds to buy groceries in general at wholesale so that he can get them for a lower price and earn higher profits when he sells them; he needs these profits to meet all his obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beans, tortillas, coffee, batteries, matches, candles, rice, soups, pasta, sauces.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is a 64-year-old married father of three. He operates a hardware business in Eastleigh where he sells building nails, bolts, glue, and metallic items among other products. He has been in this business for five years and employs two people. He describes his business environment as competitive and says that his customers are consistent. He has requested a loan of Kes. 80,000 to buy more nails, bolts and glue. He also says that since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become more accountable. He hopes to open more business centers across Nairobi and supply the materials in large scale in the future. He describes himself as aggressive and patient.

loans.use: To add to his stock

loans.name: Placida

texts.es: Placida tiene 61 años de edad, ella se dedica a la producción de ganadería y venta de cerdos. Hace más de 22 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues ella tiene 1 hijo de 12 años de edad que esta su cargo, el cual le enseña de ambos negocio para que el día de mañana sea un hombre trabajador y luchador. Ella sale con un amigo que le ayuda a escoger el ganado, ya que siempre está manteniendo activo su negocio, sus vecinos saben que su ganado es de muy buena calidad. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de ganado y cerdo. Ella sueña con aumentar su negocio con mucho ganado.
texts.en:
Placida, 61, raises cattle and sells pigs. She has been in this line of work for over 22 years because she has a 12-year-old son to support. She is teaching him both skills so that someday he will become a hard-working man. She has a friend that goes out with her to help gather the cattle because she always keeps her business active. Her neighbors know that her cattle is of very good quality. She will use the funds to buy cattle and pigs. She dreams with enlarging her business with lots of head of cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs and cattle.

loans.name: Iris Yolanda

texts.es:
la señora Iris Yolanda C. tiene 34 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Julio Cesar Nuñez quien labora como guardia de seguridad en una agencia banco Atlantida en San Lorenzo. tienen un hijo que depende de ellos.

la señora C. se dedica al comercio tiene una pequeña pulperia y venta de golosinas. 
En su casa de habitacion tiene su negocio en donde vende arroz, frijoles, maiz, refrescos, jugos, harina y otros,  ademas hace golosinas como tacos, enchiladas, y pastelitos. Esta solicitando un credito para surtir su negocio y asi obtener mejores ganancias.
 
su meta es hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Iris Yolanda C., 34, lives with Julio Cesar Nuñez, who works as a security guard for a branch of Atlantida Bank in San Lorenzo; they have a son that depends on them. Mrs. C. has a small grocery store and she sells snacks. She has her store in her home where she sells such things as: rice, beans, corn, soft-drinks, juices, flour, etc. In addition, she makes snacks like: tacos, enchiladas and little cakes. She is asking for funding to stock her store so that she can produce better profits. Her goal is to enlarge her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereal, toilet paper, soap, rice, beans, lard, tortillas, flour, soft-drinks, juices, pastas, candles, matches, eggs and salt.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Tobias

texts.en: Tobias is a 38-year-old businessman. He is married with six children who go to school. He provides welding and fabrication services to the residents of Bahati in Nairobi. He employs five people and describes his business environment as competitive. He has been running this business for the last eight years. Before this, he ran a small hardware shop. He has requested a loan of Kes. 50,000 to add stock of winding wires, metal plates and iron sheets. He describes himself as ambitious and enterprising and hopes to open a workshop.

loans.use: To add to his stock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a 26-year-old mother of two girls who are in school. She has been running a retail shop (Mteja Shop) selling foodstuffs for three years. She earns additional income through houses that she rents out. She employs one person and says that her business environment is conducive. She has requested a loan of Kes. 40,000 to add stock of maize and wheat flour, soda, rice and other foodstuffs. She describes herself as dedicated and hardworking and hopes to own a home and be a role model.

loans.use: To add to her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy soft-drinks, water, dairy products, meats, beans, cheese, rice, sugar, candles, soups, churros, bread, cookies, sardines, salt, and spices.

loans.name: Angela Adriana

texts.es: Ángela Adriana tiene 62 años, este no es el primer financiamiento que ha solicitado con Fundación pues por la responsabilidad del pago de sus cuotas ha mantenido su record. Esta emprendedora Señora tiene más 4 años de tener este negocio, por lo que ha luchado con muchas dificultades en su vida para salir adelante una de ellas fue tener un tramo propio en el mercado en donde ofrece sus productos, porque no tenía el capital suficiente para esto, con la ayuda de los financiamiento logro obtenerlo. Actualmente solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima queso, mantequilla, maíz entre otras cosas. Su deseo es mejorar la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Angela Adriana is 62 years old. This is not the first loan that she requested from Fundación and she has maintained a good credit record through the responsible payments of her installments. This enterprising woman has had her business for more than 4 years. In order to get ahead, she has conquered many difficulties in her life. One of those was the obtaining of her own space at the market where she offers her products, she did not have enough money to get one but was able to do so by getting the loans. She is currently asking for this loan to purchase raw materials such as cheese, butter, corn meal and others. Her wish is to improve the quality of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Arcoiris Group

texts.es:
GRUPO ARCOIRIS (FLAT)

     Le pusieron arco iris al grupo por que les pareció muy alegre y por que les inspira que cada día será mejor, es en la localidad de Jantetelco Morelos y de donde ellas son residentes: Gregoria A. C., se dedica a la elaboración de comidas para banquetes, Noralit Marín H. vende topper ware, Janet V. Aragón vende nopalitos preparados y patitas de cerdo en vinagre, Bárbara Domínguez T. cuenta con un pequeño lavado de autos, Martha B. González ella vende Tortas de varios ingredientes.

      La señora Gregoria, o Gollita como la conocen, es viuda con ella viven 2 nietas que están a su cargo: Kenia Jaquelin Benítez A. y laura jayún Benítez V. ambas estudian actualmente la secundaria, tiene 5 hijos Enrique, Salvador, Guadalupe, Georgina, Alejandra todos mayores de edad y ya casados, únicamente 2 de ellos están en estados unidos, pues tuvieron la necesidad de emigrar.

Ella junto con su esposo hace 40 años se dedicaban a la venta de comidas para como: mixiotes, carnitas de puerco, barbacoa y hasta la fecha continua con esta actividad, ella solicita un préstamo para comprar los ingredientes necesarios para seguir con la venta de comidas. Ella solicita éste préstamo debido a que las ganancias que había tenido de éste negocio las invirtió en iniciar la venta de abarrotes por que la única tienda que existe en su comunidad les quedaba muy lejos, entonces ella visualizó la oportunidad de negocio y comenzó con su tienda.

Así al iniciar el negocio de la tienda de abarrotes se quedó sin dinero para invertir en la venta de comida, es por ello que solicita el préstamo.

Doña Gollita sueña con poder acondicionar bien su terreno como criadero de animales. 

A ella y a las demás les beneficia mucho el crédito por que con esto compraron mas utensilios, producto de ganado, verduras etc. Se sienten muy contentas por que recibieron por primera vez el apoyo económico por parte de Fundacion Realidad y Kiva, Agradecen que no les cobren interés y que les permitan seguir trabajando con la institución y que no los van a defraudar, muchas gracias.
texts.en:
GRUPO ARCOIRIS (“Rainbow”) The group chose the name Arco Iris (“rainbow” for the group because it seemed very happy and because it inspires them to think that each day will be better. The group is based in the town of Jantetelco Morelos, where all of the members live: Gregoria A. C. makes a living preparing food for banquets, Noralit Marín H. sells Tupperware, Janet V. Aragón sells prepared prickly pears and pigs’ feet in vinegar. Bárbara Domínguez T. has a small car wash. Martha B. González sells different kinds of sandwiches. Gregoria, or ‘Gollita’ as she is known, is widowed and lives with 2 granddaughters who are in her care: Kenia Jaquielin Benítez A. and Laura Jayún Benítez V. are both currently in secondary school. She has 5 children: Enrique, Salvador, Guadalupe, Georgina, and Alejandra, all of whom are adults and are already married. Two of her children are in the United States, since they needed to emigrate. For 40 years she and her husband made a living selling food such as “mixiotes” (steamed individual meat stews wrapped in a maguey leaf), barbecued pork, and slow cooked meat. Gregoria maintains the business to this day. She is asking for a loan so that she can purchase the ingredients she needs in order to sell her food. She is requesting this loan because she invested her earnings from her business when she began selling groceries, since the only store in her town is very far away. She therefore saw the business opportunity and started up her store. When she started her grocery store she was left without money to invest in her food sales, and that is why she is requesting the loan. Gollita dreams of turning her land into an animal farm. Gollita and the others are greatly benefiting from the loan, which they will use to purchase more utensils, livestock products, and vegetables, etc. They are very pleased to be receiving economic help from Fundacion Realidad and Kiva for the first time. They are grateful that they would not be charged interest and could keep working with the institution, and they will not let the institution down. Many thanks!

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing ingredients, goats and pigs for preparing food, and a small investment in a store

loans.name: Julia Liliana

texts.es: Julia Lopez es una mujer trabajadora la cual se ha dedicado a la costura y reposteria profesional, el negocio esta situado en su domicilio y lleva 20 años, Doña Juliana es viuda desde hace 15 años y trabaja como comerciante, gracias a la ayuda y apoyo de sus 4 hijos, ella actualmente tiene su propio negocio al cual le ha sado mucho provecho. Doña Julia nos cuenta que ahora su negocio es mas grande, y poco a poco se ha podido ir superando y ha podido alcanzar varias de sus metas, pero en este momento necesita un crédito para invertirlo en su negocio de costura, ya que ella elabora uniformes de varias escuelas aledañas, y asi poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y poder tener una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Julia is a hard working woman who has been sewing and tailoring professionally out of her home for 20 years. Juliana has been a widow for 15 years and has her own business, thanks to the help and support of her four children. Her business has helped her very much. She tells us that her business has grown and, little by little, she has been able to get ahead and has been able to reach several of her goals. She needs this loan in order to invest into her business, as she makes uniforms for schools in the surrounding area and she wants to be able to provide better service to her customers and build a better life for herself.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest into her business

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson is a 35-year-old businessman. He is married and is a father to two school-going children ages 12 and eight years. Samson says that he has learned business management through Faulu Kenya client training programs. He sells shoes at retail in one of the open markets in Nairobi. He has requested a first loan of Kes. 25,000 to increase his stock of both new and old shoes for sale. He describes himself as very ambitious and hopes to become a shoe wholesaler.

loans.use: To add more stock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alba Marina

texts.es: Alba tiene 52 años, por lo que su actividad es la una librería y la venta de ropa. Por lo que tiene más de 32 años de dedicarse a este negocio, Alba siempre está buscando la manera de obtener ingresos para su familia. Esta no es la primera experiencia con financiamientos por lo que le han sido de ayuda necesaria para su negocio, además con ciertas ganancias logro comprar un poco de ropa para venderla a unos cuantos clientes. Sus 4 hijos trabajan de manera independiente y le ayudan en la atención con sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de cuadernos, lápices, borradores e invertir un poco en la compra de ropa. Su deseo es prosperar con sus 2 negocios.
texts.en:
Alba is 55 years old. Her activity is a bookstore and selling clothes. She has been working at this business for more than 32 years. Alba is always looking for a way to get income for her family. This is not her first experience with financing; it has been a necessary help for her business. With some earnings, she was able to buy a little clothes to sell to a few clients. Her four children work independently and they help her attend to customers. The financing she is asking for is to purchase notebooks, pencils, erasers and to invest a little in the purchase of clothes. Her wish is to prosper with her two businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase video game discs, controls, memory cards, and a television

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: La señora Rosa Argentina, tiene un negocio que es una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Es madre de 3 jóvenes los cuales asisten al colegio, compra sus productos a  camiones repartidores y en el mercado oriental donde los precios le resultan más favorables, su esposo trabaja como sastre, con el esfuerzo de ambos han logrado mantener activo el negocio, pese a que la situación económica se encuentra baja. Actualmente está solicitando este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para su negocio. Su deseo es mejorar su actividad económica y obtener otra fuente de ingreso.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Argentina manages a convenience store inside of her home. She is the mother of three teenagers who attend high school. Rosa purchases her products from the delivery trucks and at the eastern market where the prices are more favorable. Her husband works as a tailor. Through their efforts, both of them have managed to maintain active businesses despite facing challenges in their financial situation.

Rosa is currently requesting a loan to use as operating capital for her business. She hopes to improve her finances and obtain another source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana Z. de 57 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es mixta de caña y tablas y solo cuenta con luz como servicio básico. Es viuda con dos hijos mayores de edad. 

Ana inicio a vender ajo cuando el esposo murió ya que tenía que sustentar los gastos del hogar. Compro ajos a un bajo precio los pelaba y los vendía por fundas.    

Ahora ella vende el ajo en funda a muchas personas. Trabaja desde las 08h00 hasta las 18h00, lo que ella quisiera es tener su propio puesto de venta de ajo y granos, pero su situación económica no le ha sido favorable. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, hierro y bloques para poder construir su casa de cemento y así no le filtre las lluvias su casa. En el futuro quiere tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Ana Z. is 57 years old and lives in the periurban district of Paraíso in Guayaquil. Her house is a mixture of reeds and wooden boards, and receives electricity as its only basic service. She is a widow with two adult children.

Ana started selling garlic after her husband died so that she could continue paying her household expenses. She buys garlic at a low price and then sells it after it has been peeled. Many people now buy peeled garlic from her. Ana works from 8am until 6pm. What she wants most is to have her own vending post where she can sell garlic and grain, but her financial situation has not been favorable.

With this loan, she wants to buy cement, iron, and blocks so that she can build a cement house that does not leak when it rains. In the future, she wants to open a store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for building a cement house

loans.name: Marlene Margarita

texts.es: La  Señora Marlene tiene 25 años de edad, a su corta edad es una joven muy emprendedora que ha logrado salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo, ella tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo.  Es una persona muy humilde pero tiene los conocimientos básicos como leer y escribir. Además de esto Marlene sabe muy bien coser ropa, por lo que algunas veces realiza ciertas piezas de ropa por encargo. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa, hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. El financiamiento lo está solicitando para capital de trabajo para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, shorts y vestidos. Siempre ha soñado con tener su propio establecimiento para mostrar sus productos a sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Sra. Marlene is 25 years old and has three dependent children. At such a young age, this enterprising woman has managed to succeed through hard work. Marlene is a very humble person who possesses basic reading and writing skills. Since she is well-known for sewing clothes, there have been times when Marlene is asked to make customized articles of clothing. However, most of her time is spent buying and selling clothing, which she has been doing for three years.

The loan she is requesting will be used as operating capital to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, shorts, and dresses. Marlene has always dreamed of having her own establishment where she can show off her products to her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase trousers, shirts, skirts, shorts, and dresses

loans.name: Juvenal

texts.es:
Juvenal tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en el sector El Sandial del distrito de Pítipo, provincia de Ferreñafe, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace un año se dedica a la agricultura, actualmente ha sembrado una hectarea de maiz en un terreno ubicado en la misma zona en donde vive. El nos cuenta que anteriormente se dedicaba a trabajar como peón agrícola en diversos campos de cultivo cercanos y que poco a poco ha ido aprendiendo el manejo de diversos productos agrícolas. Juvenal depende de las ganancias que le genere esta actividad para solventar sus ingresos personales y ayudar al mantenimiento de su familia.

Su cultivo de maíz ya lleva varios dias instalado y Juvenal desea brindarle algunos riegos y aplicarle abonos y pesticidas. Por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de maíz para asegurarse una buena producción.

Juvenal es un joven bastante responsable y trabajador, el sigue laborando como peón agrícola en otros campos de cultivo durante sus tiempos libres y ya se ha ganado el respeto y aprecio de los agricultores de la zona.
texts.en:
Juvenal is 19 years old, single, and lives with his parents and siblings in the area of El Sandial in Pitipo District. This community is in the Province of Ferreñafe, located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Juvenal has been farming for one year. He currently grows corn on a hectare of land located in the same area where he lives. Juvenal says he previously worked as a field laborer on different farms nearby and gradually learned how to manage different agricultural products. He depends on the income he generates from is crops to cover his personal expenses and help support his family.

Juvenal just planted a crop of corn several days ago and wants to provide some irrigation and also apply compost and pesticides. For this reason, he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN so that he can maintain his crop of corn and be assured of good production.

Juvenal is a responsible and hardworking young man. He continues to work as a field laborer on other farms during his free time and has already earned the respect and appreciation of other farmers in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & pesticides

loans.name: Ernesto Ramón

texts.es: Don Ernesto M. es trabajador de la Alcaldía Municipal de Chichigalpa desde hace 1 año, donde se desempeña como guarda de seguridad, es casado y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar, a él se le han otorgado 2 créditos los cuales han sido para mejoramiento de vivienda y nos expresa que han sido de gran ayuda, ya que poco a poco ha mejorado las condiciones de vivienda para su familia.
texts.en:
Don Ernesto M. has been an employee of the Chichigalpa municipal government for one year. He is employed as a security guard, is married, and has two children of school age. He has been granted 2 loans which have been for the improvement of his dwelling. He tells us that they have been a great help since little by little he has improved his family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials for repairing the roof of his home (zinc, wood, and nails).

loans.name: Mariela Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora Mariela  Del Carmen tiene 30 años de edad, esta no es la primera vez que solicita financiamiento pues ya ha tenido la experiencia. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio como es la pulpería, Mariela enfrento un gran desafío como es la poca afluencia de clientes en su negocio, pero esto no ha detenido a esta mujer que tiene todas las fuerzas de luchar y sacar adelante a su familia. Ella es madre de 2 hijos que se esfuerza por proporcionarle lo necesarios. El deseo de Mariela es que sus hijos tengan un lugar propio donde vivir. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariela Del Carmen is 30 years old. This is not the first time requesting funding as she has already had the experience. Over the past 5 years Mariela has been dedicated to her grocery store. Although she has faced a major challenge due to the low flow of customers, this has not stopped this strong woman with the fight to move her family forward. She is mother of 2 children who strives to provide for their needs. Mariela's dream is for her children to have a proper place to live. She requests this loan for working capital for purchasing raw materials.


Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Responsabilidad Group

texts.es:
Don M. es profesor de profesión siempre se dedico a la enseñanza lo cual es vocación lamentablemente el sueldo que percibía era muy bajo esto lo incentivo a ver otras formas de lograr un ingreso adicional, es así que  decide formar su propia empresa “JMW FUMIGACIONES” dedicada a prestar servicio de fumigación a empresas e instituciones publicas y privadas, acondiciono un lugar  en su propia casa y empezó con muy  poco.  La ayuda de su familia. Fue vital ya que el seguía ejerciendo su carrera de maestro, con el pasar de los años siente que ha logrado muchas cosas una de ellas que su negocio haya prosperado y  lo principal  que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.
El señor M. tiene muchos planes a futuro quiere que su negocio siga progresando ahora cuenta con trabajadores  y muchos clientes, por otro lado junto con  vecinos y amigos forman el grupo “RESPONSABILIDAD” del cual es  presidente, su compromiso con el grupo es serio y lo desempeñara de la mejor manera, este es su primer  préstamo y lo utilizara para comprar una maquina nebulizadora necesaria para su negocio y cumplir sus deseos de ser un empresario exitoso.

*E l Señor M. es el que viste camisa verde
texts.en:
M. is a teacher by profession and has always made a living in teaching. Unfortunately, it is a job in which the pay is very low, and that is why M. began looking for other ways to earn additional income. He decided to form his own business, “JMW FUMIGATIONS,” dedicated to providing a fumigation service for businesses and institutions, both public and private. He set his business up in his own home and began with very little, with help from his family. His business was vital, since he was going on to pursue his graduate degree. As the years have passed he feels that he has achieved many things, most importantly, that his business has prospered and his children have a good education. M. has many plans for the future. He wants his business to keep progressing, now that he has employees and many customers. He is the president of the “RESPONSABILIDAD” group, which he formed with his friends and neighbors. He takes his commitment to the group seriously, and will fulfill his duties in the best way. This is M.’s first loan and he will use it to purchase a nebulizer machine; he needs it for his business and in order to achieve his goal of being a successful businessman. * M. is the one wearing the green shirt.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing a nebulizer machine for fumigation

loans.name: Mara Yadira

texts.es: Esta joven tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera y con dos hijos a su cargo, una mujercita y un varón, la mujercita ya es mayor de edad y va a comenzar sus estudios universitarios, el varón es menor todavía y está en escuela primaria, ella trabaja en un hospital como responsable de extracción de sangre, los créditos obtenidos en nuestra institución en su momento fueron para un pequeño negocio que ella tenía, hoy le hemos estado financiando para gastos personales.
texts.en:
This young woman is 36 years old, and a single mother with 2 children in her charge, a young woman and a boy. The young woman is becoming an adult and is about to commence university studies. The boy is still a minor and is in primary school. Mara works in a hospital as a phlebotomist, drawing blood. Her past loans with our institution were for a small business which she had. Today, we are financing some of her personal expenses (paying her daughter's university tuition).

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PAYING UNIVERSITY MATRICULATION FOR HER DAUGHTER

loans.name: Milagro Jamileth

texts.es:
la sra. Milagro Jamileth R. es una señora de 38 años de edad, esta casada con el señor
Carlos Espinoza Rivera quien labora para la policia nacional.
 
es madre de tres hijos jovenes los cuales estan estudiando.
Milagro  se dedica a la venta de refrescos, agua, jugos y tambien hace golosinas en la glorieta que arrienda en el interior de las instalaciones de la policia Nacional desde hace 2 años.
su trabajo es todos los dias y vende de contado y crédito a los miembros de la policia.

esta solicitando el credito para comprar refrescos, jugos y agua, ya que la zona de San Lorenzo es muy caliente y estos productos se venden bien rapido. las ganancias las necesita para el sustento de su hogar. Su deseo es poder graduar a sus hijos de la universidad.
texts.en:
Milagro Jamileth R. is 38 years old and is married to Carlos Espinoza Rivera, who works for the National Police. She is the mother of three young children who are in school. Milagro makes a living selling soft drinks, water, juices, and candies at the stand that she has rented inside the National Police installation for the last 2 years. She works every day and sells her products to members of the police force for cash and credit. Milagro is requesting this loan so that she can purchase soft drinks, juices, and water, since the San Lorenzo area has very hot weather and these products sell very quickly. She needs the earnings so that she can maintain her home. Milagro's wish is that her children will be able to graduate from university.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing soft drinks, juices, and water

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio Cesar tiene la actividad económica de venta de hot dog y una pulpería, el tiene 49 años de edad. El tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación pues desde hace tiempo empezó con su humilde negocio y los financiamientos fueron de gran apoyo. El inicio hace más de 23 años, por lo que tenía mucha necesidad de mantener a su familia es un hombre trabajador, que se levanta muy temprano a realizar las compras para sus 2 negocios humildes pero productivos. El sueña con obtener una distribuidora. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para la compra de salchichas, carbón, bolsas, salsa tomate, cebolla entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar sells hot dogs and he has a mini-market. He is 49 years old. He has worked with the Foundation for a long time. Some time ago he started his humble business, and the loans were a great help. He started over 23 years ago because of the great need to support his family. He is a hard-working man. He gets up very early to make the purchases for his two humble, yet productive, businesses. He dreams of getting a distributorship. He is currently asking for a loan to buy hot dogs, charcoal, bags, tomato sauce, and onions, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Juana Yamilette

texts.es: Juana Yamilette tiene 35 años, su actividad económica es compra y venta de ropa. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio ella tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000, ella tiene 2 niños menores de edad a su cargo, por lo que ha demostrado ser una persona muy capaz al administrar muy bien su negocio. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de ropa interior, cosméticos, pantalones y camisetas por lo que tiene que viajar hasta Managua para comprar más favorable. Su deseo es seguir creciendo con su negocio que es su único medio de vida.
texts.en:
Juana Yamilette is 35 years old. She buys and sells clothes. She has been in this business for over six years. She has worked with the Fundación León 2000 for a long time. She has two minor children. She has demonstrated herself to be a person who is very capable of running her business very well. She is currently requesting a loan for working capital to buy underwear, cosmetics, pants, and t-shirts. She needs to travel to Managua, where shopping is more favorable for her. Her wish is to keep growing in her business, which is her only means of earning a living.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Rogelio tiene 36 años de edad, es casado y tiene cinco hijos. Vive junto a su familia en el caserío Cerro Escute, ubicado en el distrito de Pacora, provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar como vendedor ambulante de pescado y verduras desde hace un año. Anteriormente trabajaba como obrero agrícola, pero como los ingresos que percibia de esta actividad no le bastaban para solventar la economía de su hogar decidió emprender un negocio más estable.

Rogelio ofrece sus productos en una mototaxi que alquila y con la que recorre los caseríos cercanos de la zona. Su rutina empieza desde las cuatro de la mañana que es cuando adquiere su mercadería en el terminal pesquero de la región y en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, luego se dirige a los caserios que usualmente recorre y ofrece sus productos hasta el mediodía. 

Su negocio goza de mucha acogida entre sus clientes ya que les provee de productos de consumo diario por los que tendrían que ir hasta el distriro de Pacora para adquirirlos, vale decir que los caseríos donde distribuye sus productos se encuentran muy alejados del mencionado distrito.

La continua demanda por los productos que ofrece ha hecho que Rogelio piense en ampliar su negocio con la compra de más pescado y verduras para ofrecer a sus habituales clientes, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Rogelio es un hombre honesto y bastante trabajador. Sus vecinos y conocidos lo estiman mucho y lo consideran una persona confiable. Su mayor anhelo es instalar una bodega en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Rogelio, age 36, is married and has five children. He lives with his family in the rural community of Cerro Escute, which is located in the Pacora district in the Lambayeque province. It is one hour from the city of Chiclayo. He has been selling fish and vegetables as a traveling salesman for one year. He previously worked as a farm worker, but the earnings he received were not enough to support his household. He decided to undertake a more stable business. Rogelio offers his products from a “mototaxi” (three wheeled motor vehicle) that he rents. He travels to the rural communities in the area. He starts his routine at four in the morning. That is when he gets his merchandise at the fish terminal in the region and in the city’s wholesale market. He then heads out to the rural communities that he usually goes to and offers his products until midday. His business is well-received among his customers because he provides them with the products they eat everyday. Otherwise they would have to go to the Pacora district to get them. He points out that the rural areas where he distributes his products are very far from the Pacora district. The continuous demand for the products he offers has made Rogelio think about expanding his business by purchasing more fish and vegetables to offer to his regular customers. That is why he is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 500 PEN. Rogelio is an honest man and a very hard-worker. His neighbors and acquaintances hold him in high esteem, and they consider him to be a trustworthy person. His greatest desire is to set up a convenience store in his house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fish and vegetables to expand his business

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Esta joven es maestra de escuela primaria tiene 41 de edad es madre soltera, tiene un hijo a su cargo el cual es menor de edad, ella es maestra de computación en la escuela Ricardo Morales Avilés en el municipio de Posoltega de donde es originaria, ella está trabajando con nuestra institución desde el año 2006, los créditos que se le han otorgado han sido para mejorar su vivienda y este último que se le está otorgando es para solventar  el pago del título de su carrera.
texts.en:
This young woman is a primary school teacher, 41 years old, and a single mother with a child who is a minor in her charge. She teaches computation at the Ricardo Morales Avilés School in the municipality of Posoltega where she comes from. Reyna has been working with our institution since 2006. The loans she has received have been for improvements to her house and this latest loan we have agreed to is for paying the fee required for receiving her professional degree.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PAYING THE FEE FOR HER UNIVERSITY DEGREE

loans.name: Fátima Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Fátima es una persona que se dedica al destace de cerdos la cual ella vende en su casa el producto como es la carne lonjas de la cual saca chicharrones así como también fritos y nacatamales atraves de su negocio ella ha podido sacar  adelante a su familia ya que es madre soltera con los créditos brindados por ceprodel ella ha logrado aumentar su negocio con estos en la actualidad ha logrado que una d sus hijas logre estudiar en la universidad.
Este crédito lo solicita para incrementar sus ventas ya que ella es bien reconocida en este municipio como vendedora de carne de cerdos ya que llegan hasta su casa a comprarle el producto
texts.en:
Mrs. Fátima is a person that butchers pigs. She sells pork products such as fried pig skin and pork tamales from her house. Because of this business her family is able to move forward. She is a single mother. With the loans from Ceprodel she has been able to grow her business. With her earnings her daughter has been able to study in the university. She is asking for this loan in order to increase her sales. She is well known in the community as a pork vendor that will come to your house to sell her product.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es: La Sra. Concepción R. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, habita en el barrio cerro de hule donde tiene ubicado su negocio el que consiste en una pequeña pulpería bien surtida de productos básicos para el hogar, la cual tiene ocho años de tenerla. Tiene tres años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde le han otorgado cuatro créditos los cuales los ha invertido siempre en su negocio. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, pan, etc. con el objetivo de satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y así poder obtener mayores ingresos para brindarles un mejor nivel de vida a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Concepción R. is from El Sauce and lives in the Cerro de Hule neighborhood where she has her small grocery store. She has had her store for 8 years and she stocks it with all the usual basic household items. She has collaborated with Ceprodel for 3 years and has had 4 loans that she has always invested back into her business. The loan requested now will be used to buy rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, bread, etc. in order to meet customer demand, have higher income and provide a better standard of living for her two children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, beans, bread, cooking oil, snacks.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es una esposa muy tierna y una madre muy amorosa con sus 4 hijos. Tiene 61 años y vive en su humilde casa, que está a medio construir, en un barrio marginal de la zona sur de la ciudad de Lima.

Durante toda su vida ha trabajado en diversos negocios relacionados a la venta de comida. Actualmente, elabora y vende tamales (platillo a base de maíz molido); los viernes por la tarde hierve el maíz y su esposo le ayuda a moler los granos, mientras que ella se avoca al aliñado del tamal, adicionalmente vende una sopa típica de su tierra llamada “caldo de cabeza”. María se siente feliz de lo que hace, ya que con estas ganancias ayuda a cubrir los gastos de su hogar junto a su esposo. Ella es una mujer muy laboriosa, de buen carácter y muy buena sazón, dones heredados de su madre, que ahora le dan la posibilidad de generar dinero. Sus clientes ya saben que cada fin de semana pueden saborear la comida de María y ella alegremente los atiende, ya que gracias a esa preferencia su negocio le es muy rentable. Lo que anhela para el futuro es  terminar de construir su casa y tener un espacio donde pueda acondicionar un pequeño restaurante.
