Este es su octavo préstamo con MFP, donde hace el compromiso de seguir trabajando con la misma responsabilidad. Ella forma un grupo solidario con una amiga, con la que se lleva muy bien y eso las mantiene unidas.

El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de los comestibles e insumos necesarios para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Maria is a very caring wife and loving mother of four children. She is 61 years old and she lives in a humble home. It is half built in an area on the outskirts of town, south of Lima. She has worked in different businesses related to selling food her whole life. At present, she is making and selling tamales (a cornmeal based dish). Friday afternoons, she boils the corn and her husband helps her grind the grains while she prepares the tamale filling. She also sells a traditional soup from her land called "caldo de cabeza". Maria feels happy with what she does, since these earnings she helps cover the household expenses with her husband. She is a hardworking woman and a good cook. She inherited her gifts from her mother and now they give her the chance to make some money. Her clients know that every weekend they can taste Maria's food and she will serve them happily. Thanks to this preference her business is very profitable. What she longs for for the future is to be able to finish building her house and have space to put in a small restaurant. This is her eighth loan with MFP, where she is committed to keep working with the same responsibility. She is a member of a support group with a friend. She gets along with her very well and they stay close that way. They money she is asking for now is to buy the necessary foodstuffs and ingredients to prepare her food.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs and ingredients for her food

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
La señora María Elena se dedica a la venta de ropa ya que anteriormente trabajaba en la zona franca como obrera  y al cerrar estas ella se dedico a esta actividad la cual tiene 3 años de experiencia ella es madre soltera única sostén de su hija.
Las ventas las realizas por encargos ya que ella distribuye muestra en revista y las personas que miran y le gustan las muestras se las encargan.
Este crédito es para la compra de ropa de verano ya que se acerca dicha época en este sector y donde tiene ya productos encargados
texts.en:
María Elena sells clothing; she used to work in the tax-free zone as a laborer. When it shut down she started selling clothes; she's been in this line of work for 3 years now. She is a single mother and the only source of support for her daughter. Her sales are based on prior orders. She shows samples in magzines to her customers who look them over and decide what they want to order from her. She will use the funds to buy Summer clothing because the season is about to start in this area and she already has pending orders on hand.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana es una creativa mujer de 35 años, vive al lado de su esposo e hijos en su casa propia.
Ella se dedica al bordado de vestidos, actividad que le demanda prácticamente todo día, puesto que debe ser muy minuciosa con los acabados. La manera de trabajar de Ana consiste en recibir pedidos de diferentes comerciantes de ropa, quienes le dan cierta cantidad de prendas para que las adorne con diferentes y novedosos diseños y así hacerlas más llamativas. A ella le gusta mucho su trabajo porque le permite usar su creatividad y buen gusto, la parte difícil radica en que debe tener muy buena vista para ensartar las mostacillas con las que adorna la ropa, puesto que son muy pequeñas y debe ser muy hábil a la hora de trabajar.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y hasta el momento ha demostrado ser muy puntual en el pago de todas sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará materiales para el adorno de las prendas. Para el futuro le gustaría tener una tienda donde pueda exhibir y vender ella misma su trabajo.
texts.en:
Ana is a creative 35 year old woman. She lives with her husband and her children in her own house. She embroiders clothes, an activity that takes almost all day because you need to be very meticulous with the finishings. Ana’s work consists of receiving orders from different clothing merchants. They give her a certain quantity of clothing to decorate with different and novel designs. That way she makes them more striking. Ana really likes her work because it allows her to use her creativity and her good taste. The difficult part stems from having to have very good eyesight in order to thread the beads to decorate the clothing. They are very small, and you need to be very skillful when it is time to work. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she has demonstrated herself to be very punctual in making all of her payments. She will use the requested money to buy materials to decorate clothing. In the future she would like to have a store where she could exhibit and sell her own work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for her embroidery

loans.name: Cruz De Fátima

texts.es: La Sra. Cruz de Fátima es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como una pequeña comerciante donde ofrece cosméticos de la marca Avon a los pobladores de dicho municipio. Actualmente tiene cinco años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde le han otorgado cinco créditos los que le han ayudado enormemente porque los ha invertido en la construcción y mejora de su casa. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de un juego de sillas abuelitas con el fin de amueblar su casa poco a poco.
texts.en:
Cruz de Fátima is from El Sauce. She sells Avon products to residents of the city. She has collaborated with Ceprodel for 5 years and has had 5 loans that have helped her enormously because she invested them in the construction and improvement of her house. The funds will be used to by a set of rocking chairs in order to start to gradually furnish her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a set of rocking chairs.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda, de 43 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposo Pedro (47) y sus 2 menores hijos.
Desde hace 3 años instaló en su vivienda una pequeña librería, al principio acondicionó su sala para ello, pero tiempo después acondicionó su mercadería en estantes y colocó una puerta para atender con mayor comodidad. A ella le gusta mucho vender útiles escolares y de escritorio porque es un trabajo tranquilo y lo puede realizar en su casa, sin descuidar la crianza de sus pequeños. Lo que no le agrada es el polvo que hay en la zona por donde vive, ya que constantemente deteriora su mercadería. Hermelinda atiende desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche y también ofrece algunos adornos y muñecos de peluche, los cuales tienen bastante demanda, por ello está muy satisfecha, ya que con las ganancias de su librería - bazar puede ayudar en los gastos del hogar a su esposo. 

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda acceder al crédito que le permitirá seguir trabajando. Con el dinero solicitado tiene planeado invertir en la compra de más cuadernos para abastecer su librería, ya que empezó la época escolar y éstos tendrán mucha demanda.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is 43 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Pedro (age 47) and their two dependent children. Three years ago, she established a small bookstore in her home. From the start she set it up in her living room, and shortly thereafter installed shelves for holding merchandise and a door to make it feel more comfortable. She enjoys selling school supplies and stationery because it is quiet work that can be performed at home without having to leave her children. What she does not like is the dust that accumulates in the area where she lives because it constantly causes her merchandise to deteriorate. Hermelinda operates her store from 7am until 9pm and also sells decorations and stuffed toys that have sufficient demand. She is very happy because the income generated from her bookstore-bazaar has allowed her to help her husband with the household expenses.

This is her first loan with MFP. Hermelinda is grateful to everyone who made it possible for her to access this loan that will allow her to continue working. With the money she is requesting, she plans to buy more notebooks to restock her bookstore. The school year has already started and these products are in great demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase notebooks to increase her inventory

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela tiene 45 años, vive en su casa propia con sus tres hijos, quines son menores de edad y le ayudan en lo que pueden para salir adelante juntos.

Cada día se despierta muy temprano para preparar a sus hijos para el colegio, posteriormente empieza a elaborar la comida que venderá en el día. A partir de las 4 de la tarde, con ayuda de sus hijos acondiciona un espacio fuera de su casa para vender sus platillos hasta las 12 de la noche. Lo que más le gusta cocinar son papas rellenas, tortillas y pollo frito, pues estos platillos se venden muy bien entre sus vecinos y clientes, ya que la prefieren por su sabor, buenos precios y la porción de arroz adicional que les brinda. Este negocio le es muy rentable porque las ganancias le permiten mantener a sus hijos y brindarles educación; lo que no le agrada es esperar hasta altas horas de la noche para lograr vender toda su comida. En adelante, tiene planeado mejorar y ampliar las instalaciones de su puesto para vender con mayor comodidad.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda acceder al dinero del crédito que le permitirá seguir trabajando. Marcela tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de comestibles; como arroz, aceite y azúcar, en grandes cantidades, para seguir cocinando y vendiendo sus deliciosos platillos.
texts.en:
Marcela is 45 years old and lives in her own home with her three dependent children. They all help one another so that they can succeed together.

Each day Marcela wakes up early to get her children ready for school. Afterwards she begins preparing the food that she will sell for the day. Starting at 4pm and with the help of her children, she begins setting up the space outside of her home where she sells her dishes until midnight. What she enjoys cooking the most are stuffed potatoes, tortillas, and fried chicken since they sell very well among her neighbors and customers. They prefer the taste of her food, the good prices, and the extra serving of rice that she offers. Her business is very profitable because the income enables her to support her children and provide them an education. What she dislikes is waiting until the late night hours before all of her food is sold. Therefore, she has plans to improve and expand the facilities at her kiosk so that she can sell more comfortably.

This is her third loan with MFP. Marcela is very grateful to everyone who made it possible for her to access a loan so that she could continue working. She plans to buy food items such as rice, oil, and sugar in large quantities so that she can continue cooking and selling her delicious dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Sonia Estela

texts.es: Sonia Estela tiene 39 años de edad, su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de cosa de horno, hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que se hace cargo de su familia. Ella dio a este negocio porque necesitaba un medio que le generara ingresos necesarios. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para la elaboración de sus productos como mantequilla, leña, queso, maíz entre otros. Ella sueña con ampliar su local para tener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Sonia Estela is 39 years old. She produces and sells baked goods to earn a living. Sonia has been in this business for five years as a means of supporting her family. She started this business because she needed a way to generate necessary income.

Sonia is currently requesting a loan to buy supplies and ingredients used in making her products, such as butter, firewood, cheese, corn, and other items. Her dream is to expand her establishment so that she can generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase butter, firewood, cheese, corn, and other items

loans.name: Jairo David

texts.es: En el municipio de somotillo comarca la pimienta, el señor Jairo David S. A., se dedica a la producción agropecuaria, dentro la cual desarrolla diversos rubro como la crianza de ganado bobino, porcino y aviar también establece cultivos de subsistencia como maíz, ajonjolí, y sorgo, los que le proveen a demás de su seguridad alimentaria, algunos ingresos para mejorar su situación económica, el señor Jairo David Se ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida a estas actividades las que ejecuta todos los días de la semana de 6 a 2 de la tarde, ya que le permiten la mantención de su familia la que esta con formada solo por su esposa, quien también le colabora en los que haceres diarios, se le otorgo un crédito para la compra de un panel solar el cual le permitió mejorar su vida social, este financiamiento será empleado para la compra de una vaca y una vaquilla las que aumentaran su hato ganadero y mejorar el sistema de producción
texts.en:
Jairo David S. A. lives in Somotillo, La Pimienta. He raises livestock such as: cattle, pigs and fowl; he also farms subsistence crops like corn, sesame and sorghum which provide, besides his own nutritional security, additional income to improve his economic situation. Jairo David has spent most of his life in these activities, which he does every day of the week from 6am to 2pm. They have made it possible for him to support his wife, who helps him with his daily tasks. He received a previous loan to buy a solar panel that improved his social life. The current loan will be used to buy a cow and a young heifer to increase the size of his cattle herd and improve his production system.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow and a young heifer.

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es: En el municipio de somotillo, comarca jiñocuao, el señor José Santos O. E. se dedica a la crianza de ganado y el establecimiento de cultivos de granos básicos como maíz y frijoles, el ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida ha estas actividades que le proveen los recursos económicos para la mantención de sus 5 hijas y esposa. Dichas actividades las realiza de 6 a 2 de la tarde, el financiamiento será utilizado en la postes para mejorar las cercas de su finca, con las cuales pretende que su  ganado no provoquen perjuicios a sus cultivos que tiene actualmente los que son de alto costo ya que son de riego.
texts.en:
José Santos O. E. raises livestock and grows basic grains like corn and beans in the Somotillo municipality in the Jiñocuao region. He has dedicated the greater part of his life to these activities. They provide the economic resources to support his five daughters and his wife. He does the work from six in the morning until two in the afternoon. He will use the loan for posts to improve the fences on his farm. He intends to protect his crops from damage from his livestock. The crops he now has cost a lot because they are being irrigated.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy posts to improve fences

loans.name: Víctor Antonio

texts.es: En la comarca el caimito municipio de somotillo el señor Víctor Antonio G. Días, se ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida al desarrollo de actividades agropecuarias dentro de las cuales destaca la crianza de ganado bovino, porcino, aviar y equino también establece cultivos como maíz, ajonjolí y sorgo con los cuales mantiene a su familia, la cual esta compuesta por su esposa y dos niños los que tienen 4 y 6 años respectivamente, el señor Víctor Antonio G. D.realiza jornadas de trabajo de 6 a 4 de la tarde dentro de las principales actividades que ejecuta esta el pastoreo de su ganado y las actividades de sus cultivos, ha tenido tres créditos con los cuales ha mejorado su sistema productivo ya que realizo la compra de un molino de quebrar maíz con el cual esta diversificando sus ingresos y mejorando su estilo de vida y la mantención de su familia.
texts.en:
Víctor Antonio G. Días has spent most of his life as a farmer and cattleman in El Caimito, Somotillo. He raises cattle, pigs, fowl and horses; he also farms corn, sesame and sorghum with which he supports his family, which is composed of his wife and two children, who are 4 and 6 years of age respectively. Víctor Antonio G. D.s work day is from 6am to 4pm. Among his main chores is taking the cattle to forage and caring for his crops. He has had 3 loans that have improved his production system in that he bought a mill to grind corn which is diversifying his source of income and improved his life style and support of this family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Mayini Claribel

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	En la comarca Rodeo grande sector las marías grandes la señora Margiany Clarivel E. M., ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida a la producción agropecuaria dentro de la cual desarrolla numerosos rubros productivos los que le aseguran su bien estar familiar y proveen de recursos necesarios como su alimentación y vestimenta, dentro de estos rubros destaca la crianza de ganado bobino, porcino y aviar así como los cultivos de subsistencia como maíz, ajonjolí y sorgo que a demás de facilitarle sus alimentos básicos constituyen también una fuente de ingreso adicional, estos rubros los realiza en las épocas de invierno y verano con jornadas de 6 a 2 de la tarde todos los días.
Con el financiamiento pretende terminar de mejorar el techo de su casa y pintarla, ya que actualmente no esta en muy buenas condiciones y de esta forma mejorar su vida social y ofrecer un hogar digno asu pequeño hijo de 2 años de edad.
texts.en:
Margiany Clarivel E. M. has been a farmer for most of her life in Rodeo Grande, Las Marías Grandes. She is involved in a variety of productive activities that insure her family's wellbeing and makes it possible for her to feed and clothe them; among which are: sheep, pig and fowl raising as well as farming subsistence crops like corn, sesame and sorghum. These crops, besides providing for the family's basic nutritional needs, also constitute an additional source of income. She works both Winter and Summer seasons from 6am to 2pm every day. She will use the funds to finish roofing and to paint her house because it's currently not in very good conditions. She will thus improve her social life and provide a proper home to her 2-year-old son.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy wire and a dairy cow

loans.name: Darío Altagracio

texts.es:
El señor Darío es un productor y agricultor de Nagarote el cual junto a su familia ha logrado salir adelante  ya que con los créditos brindados por ceprodel el ha podido mejorar su vivienda ya que le ha permitido aumentar su hato ganadero y así producir más leche la cual vende en su casa.
Este crédito es para la compra de vaquillas preñadas y así aumentar su producción de leche la cual le beneficia ya que con la venta de leche actualmente sus hijos están por graduarse de secundaria y siempre segur apoyándolo en sus estudios
texts.en:
Darío is a farmer and producer in Nagarote. He and his family have managed to get ahead thanks to loans from Ceprodel that have made it possible for him to make improvements to his dwelling and increase the size of his cattle herd which, in turn, has led to increased production of milk, which he sells from his home. He will use these funds to buy young pregnant cows to further increase milk production, which is a great benefit for him because the sale of the milk provides for his children's schooling (they are about to graduate from middle school) and he wants to continue to support their education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pregnant heifers.

loans.name: Asunción

texts.es:
Asuncion es una madre de familia de 47 años que vive junto a su esposo y a sus menores hijos en el caserío La Piedra del distrito de Lambayeque, en la provincia del mismo nombre, ubicada a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace veinte años a la crianza y venta de animales de corral. Ella cría aves (patos, pavos, gallinas) en la parte posterior de su domicilio y las comercializa con los negociantes que visitan la zona en donde vive con mucha frecuencia. Este negocio es de mucha importancia para la economía de su familia ya que su esposo, como la mayoría de hombres del lugar, trabaja como obrero agrícola y los ingresos que percibe no con suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares.

Asunción desea mejorar la calidad de sus animales para percibir más ingresos al momento de venderlos, por ello se encuentra solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado para aves.

Asunción es una mujer bastante responsable y trabajadora. Sus vecinos y conocidos la consideran una persona confiable y que siempre está dispuesta a ayudar a los que la necesitan.
texts.en:
Asunción, age 47, lives with her husband and their minor children in the rural community of La Piedra in the Lambayeque district and province of the same name. It is a half hour from the city of Chiclayo. For twenty years she has been raising and selling poultry. She raises birds (ducks, turkeys, chickens) in the area behind her house. She sells them to merchants who frequently visit the area where she lives. This business is very important to her family’s economy because her husband, like most men in the area, is a farm worker. His income is not enough to pay the family expenses. Asunción wants to improve the quality of her animals to get more income when it is time to sell them. That is why, for the first time, she is asking Edpyme Alternative for a loan for 1,000 PEN. She plans to buy balanced food for birds. Asunción is a very responsible and hard-working person. Her neighbors and acquaintances consider her to be trustworthy. She is always ready to help those who need it.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy balanced food for the improvement of her business of raising poultry

loans.name: Guadalupe Leticia

texts.es:
La señora Guadalupe es una persona trabajadora y esforzada ya que en su actividad diaria ella destaza y vende la carne de res en su casa y sale a las ventas a entregar el producto además que su sacrificio vale la pena porque le ha permitido ser el sostén de su hogar desde hace 10 años .
Este crédito será utilizado para la compra de dos vacas para posteriormente destazarla con lo cual le permite a ella mantener a su familia la cual le ayudan a vender el producto ella en la actualidad tiene dos hijos que le ayudan en el negocio
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a hard-working woman who puts daily effort into her butchering. She sells beef from home and also goes out door-to-door to sell her product. Her daily sacrifice is worth it because it has made it possible for her to support her household for the last 10 years. She will use this loan to buy two cows for future butchering, which permits her to support her family, who help her sell the meat. She has two children that help her with the business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two cows.

loans.name: Ana Yohelsy

texts.es:
La joven Ana Yohelsy G. H. es empleada en una fábrica de elaboración de puros en este municipio de Condega.

Ella solicita un crédito en Ceprodel el que utilizara para el pago de un par de lentes que ella necesita para corregir su vista y la compra de un medicamento para mejorar su salud personal.

Ella empezó a trabajar en esta fábrica en la elaboración de puro  después de salir de la secundaria y desde entonces se dedica a esas labores y así obtener un ingreso mensual fijo, ella trabaja del día lunes hasta el día viernes desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde.

Ella espera mejorar su vista y salud con el financiamiento que solicita en Ceprodel para así poder seguir trabajando y rendir en sus labores diarias y sacar adelante su familia ya que la salud personal esta primero que todo.

Ana yohelsy G. en una joven soltera y con dos hijas una de ella en edad estudiantil y a la que le costea los gastos escolares.

Este es el crédito numero doce que Ana Yohelsy solita en Ceprodel en un periodo de nueve años, ella dice que estos financiamiento le has ayudado positivamente a mejorar sus condiciones familiares ya que a podido comprar sus electrodomésticos, así como muebles y resolver los gastos escolares de si hija, por lo que se muestra agradecida.
texts.en:
Ana Yohelsy G. H. is employed at a cigar factory in Condega. She is asking Ceprodel for funds to buy a pair of glasses that she needs to correct her vision and to buy medicine that she needs to improve her health. She started to work in the cigar factory when she got out of middle school; since then she has worked at this job and earns a fixed monthly income. She works Monday through Friday from 7am until 5pm. She hopes to improve her vision and health with this loan that she is asking from Ceprodel so that she can continue to work and be productive in her daily tasks in order to move her family ahead; health is the most important thing. Ana Yohelsy G. is a single woman with two daughters, one of whom is school age and for whom she pays all school expenses. This is her 12th loan with Ceprodel in 9 years. She states that the loans have been of much benefit to her because she has been able to improve her family situation buying appliances and furniture and paying for her daughter's schooling; for this she is grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for her glasses and medicines.

loans.name: Esther Del Socorro Córdoba Calderón

texts.es:
La Sra. Esther del Socorro C. C. es empleada en una institución local en el Municipio de Condega.
	
Ella solicita un crédito el que va a utilizar en la compra de unos muebles para su casa.

Ella espera que con la compra de estos muebles pueda tener mejor comodidad en la casa donde ella reside y así mejorar su estilo de vida. Ella es una mujer casada y con un niño que aun no esta en edad escolar y vive con su esposo en casa de sus suegros.

Ella empezó a trabajar por la necesidad de tener un ingreso fijo mensualmente y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, ella tiene aproximadamente unos 3 años de trabajar en dicha institución de lunes a viernes desde las  8 de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde, cabe señalar que antes de trabajar ella se dedicaba a sus estudios en secundaria.

Este es el segundo crédito que ella solicita en Ceprodel en este mismo año y espera que dicho financiamiento le beneficie positivamente y  espera ir mejorando así como le beneficio el crédito anterior en la compra de un terreno para la construcción futura de su casa de habitación propia ya que de los contrario con sus ingresos no lo podría hacer por si sola ya que son ingresos bajos.
texts.en:
Esther del Socorro C. C. is employed by a local firm in Condega. She is asking for funds to buy living room furniture for her house. She hopes that the purchase of the furniture will increase her comfort level at home thereby improving her lifestyle. She is married and has a son, who is not yet old enough to go to school; she lives with her husband in her in-law's house. She started working because she needed to have a fixed monthly income and improve her living conditions. She has worked for the above-mentioned firm for 3 years, Monday through Friday, 8am to 5pm. Prior to getting this job she was a middle school student. This is her second loan request with Ceprodel this year. She hopes the loan will be beneficial to her and hopes to gradually improve the same way as the previous loan helped her to buy a lot for the future constuction of her own home because, without the loans, her own salary was not enough for her to do it on her own because it is very low.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy living room furniture.

loans.name: Iris Etelbina

texts.es:
La Sra. Iris Etelbina R. P. es obrera en una fábrica de elaboración de puro en el Municipio de Condega.

Ella solicita un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de cemento para repellar las paredes de la sala de su casa de habitación, ya que dichas paredes no están afinadas.

Ella tiene ocho años de estar trabajando en esta fábrica en la elaboración de puros para exportación hasta hoy en día para así tener un ingreso mensual estable y cubrir con sus gastos familiares. Antes de dedicarse a esta labor ella era estudiante de secundaria

 Ella trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las siete de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. 

Iris P. espera que con la compra de dichos materiales de construcción ella pueda mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y darle una mejor presentación y así tener un hogar mas digno para ella y su familia.

Esta joven es casada y tiene dos hijos los cuales están en edad escolar y a los que le toca cubrir con los gastos escolares con la ayuda de du esposo también.

Este es el crédito numero cinco que ella solicita en un periodo de de cuatro años. Ella dice mostrarse contenta con el resultado positivo que ha obtenido con los financiamientos ya que ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda así como a logrado sacar adelante los estudios de sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Iris Etelbina R. P. is employed as a laborer in a cigar factory in Condega. She is asking Ceprodel for funds to buy cement to coat her living room walls because they are rough and unfinished. She has worked at the for export cigar factory for 8 years in order to have a stable monthly income to meet family expenses. Prior to this employment, she was a middle school student. She works Monday through Friday from 7am until 5pm. Iris P. hopes that the purchase of these building materials will make it possible for her to improve her living conditions so that her house will have a better appearance and her family will have a more proper home. This young woman is married and has two, school-age children; she and her husband must pay for all their educational expenses. This is her 5th loan in 4 years. She says that she is happy with the positive results she has gotten from the loans because she has managed to improve her home’s condition as well as pay for both her children’s schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
La Sra. Juana Francisca A. A. es comérciate y se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida en el municipio de Condega.

Ella solicita un financiamiento  para la compra de materia prima como aceite, arroz, queso, etc. para la elaboración de alimentos para aumentar la producción en su negocio y aumentar su clientela también.

Ella empezó con este negocio hace unos siete años con el objetivo de venderle alimento a los trabajadores de una fabrica de puro que esta en frente de su casa de habitación, empezó con ventas pocas y luego fue aumentando estas, ella realiza la primer venta desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 12 del medio día y la segunda venta por la noche desde las 7 hasta las nueve y media de la noche. Cabe señalar que ella era ama de casa antes de dedicarse a este negocio.

Doña Juana A. es casada y tiene cuatro hijos uno de ellos aun esta bajo su cargo.

Este es el crédito numero dos que ella solicita en un periodo de dos años, doña Juana dice que sus créditos con Ceprodel le han ayudado a crecer su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos mesuales.
texts.en:
Juana Francisca A. A. is a merchant who sells prepared meals in Condega. She is asking for funds to buy raw materials and supplies like: cooking oil, rice, cheese, etc. to make her meals and increase production thus increasing her customer base, too. She started this business about 7 years ago with the intention of providing meals for employees of a cigar factory that’s across the street from her house. She began with few sales but gradually these increased. Her first shift is from 8 am until noon and her second shift is from 7-9 pm. It’s worth mentioning that prior to getting into this line of work she was a housewife. Juana A. is married and has 4 children, one of whom is still under her care. This is her second loan request in two years. She tells us that loans from Ceprodel have helped her to enlarge her business and improve her monthly income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and raw materials (rice, cooking oil, cheese, corn, firewood)

loans.name: Julia María

texts.es:
La Sra. Julia María R. R. trabaja como enfermera en el centro de salud del Municipio de Somoto.

 Ella solicita un crédito el va a ser utilizado en la compra de materiales de construcción tales como cemento, arena, ladrillos. Con esto ella tiene pensado remodelar su casa de habitación  y mejorar sus condiciones.

Ella empezó a trabajar como enfermera hace unos diez años una ves que se recibió de la secundaria y desde entonces se a dedicado a dicha labor, ella realiza este trabajo  de lunes a sábado  desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde.

Ella espera mejorar vivienda con el financiamiento que se le brinde en Ceprodel y de esta manera mejorar también su condición de vida así como la de  su familia.

Julia R. es casada y tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos están en edad escolar y a los que le costea sus gastos escolares con el apoyo de su esposo.

Este es el crédito numero cinco que ella tiene en Ceprodel en un periodo de seis años, los que le han ayudado positivamente a ir mejorando las condiciones de su vivienda así como la compra de electrodomésticos que le ha ayudado a facilitar las labores domesticas.
texts.en:
Julia María R. R. is a nurse in Somoto’s health center. She is asking for funds to buy building materials and supplies like: cement, sand, bricks. She plans to remodel her house and improve its condition. She started working as a nurse about 10 years ago when she finished secondary school. Since then, she has been in this occupation. She works Monday through Saturday from 7 am until 5 pm. She hopes to improve her home with Ceprodel’s loan thus improving her and her family’s living conditions. Julia R. is married and has three children, two of whom are school-aged and for whom she, together with her husband, must provide for all educational expenses. This is her 5th loan with Ceprodel in a 6-year period. They have helped her to improve her home and to purchase home appliances that have eased her domestic chores.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Maria Ismelda

texts.es:
La Sra. María Ismelda B. V. es agricultora y comerciante del área rural del Municipio de Pueblo Nuevo.

Ella solita un financiamiento en Ceprodel para la compra de granos tales como el maíz y retenerlo para venderlo en tiempo de verano donde los precios de este son mas altos y el grano es mas escaso.

Este negocio empezó cando María B. empezó a comprar granos en poca cantidad en época de cosecha y venderlo en tiempo de escases hasta comprar cada ves mas granos, ella se a dedicado a esta labor desde hace aproximadamente unos quince años,  cabe señalar que en años anteriores ella era estudiante de secundaria.

Ella espera que con la compra y retención de estos granos pueda venderlos en mejor precio cuando sea el tiempo de escases y esto le generara mejores ganancias y por ende mejores ingresos familiares y de esta manera espera que su negocio crezca cada ves mas.

Este es el crédito numero ocho que Doña María B. solicita en Ceprodel en un periodo de cinco años. Estos financierito le han beneficiado positivamente ya  que a través de esto a logrado asistir sus cultivos de granos básicos y tener segura la cosecha para es sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
María Ismelda B. V. is a farmer and merchant in the rural zone of Pueblo Nuevo. She is asking Ceprodel for funds to buy corn to store and then sell in Summer when prices are higher and the grain is scarcer. The business began when María B. began to buy small amounts of grain during harvest time and then sell it during times of shortage; each time she bought more grain and has been doing this work for about 15 years now. It is worth noting that in the years prior to this she was in secondary school. She hopes that by buying and storing these grains she will be able to sell them for a better price at a time when the grain is scarce. This will generate better profits and thus better family income; she hopes that her business will grow more each time. This is her 8th loan with Ceprodel in a period of 5 years. These loans have been beneficial to her because she has been able to care for her crops and insure a good harvest for the support of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita L. is from the city of Gala, Ozamiz City. She is 62 years old, is married, and has seven adult children. Rosita owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transport services. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Rosita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle in order to provide better service. This loan will be her fifth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her existing vehicle in order to provide better service

loans.name: Lenie's Group

texts.en:
Lenie S. is from Biray, Molicay, Ozamiz City. She is 34 years old and is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Lenie is married and has two school-aged children. She owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling vegetables like squash, eggplant, cabbage, etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Lenie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. Lenie plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mushviq

texts.en: Mushviq K. is 40 years old trader who sells electrical goods as TVs, CD and DVD players and so on. Mushviq is married and has three children. His dream is to provide best education to his beloved kids. Now he applied for 1600 AZN in case to expand his business and purchase more items to sell.

loans.use: purchase more electrical goods

loans.name: Evelyn Petronila

texts.es:
La joven Evelyn es una persona que con sacrificio ha logrado salir adelante ya que en la actualidad con su negocio ha logrado construir su casa ya que anteriormente vivía en la casa de su suegra y junto a su esposo han logrado desarrollarse en esta actividad,
Este crédito lo solicita para la compra de dos cerdas las cuales estás se cubren y al termino de seis meses estas paren y venden las crías pequeñas
texts.en:
Evelyn is a young woman who, with much sacrifice, has managed to get ahead in life. Her work has allowed her to build her house because she used to live with her mother-in-law. Together with her husband, she has developed in this activity. She will use the funds to buy two sows to breed. In six months they will give birth and the piglets will be sold.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two sows.

loans.name: Florencio Jerónimo

texts.es:
El señor Florencio es una persona que trabaja como albañil en este municipio el cual atreves de los créditos con ceprodel ha podido mejorar su casa la cual anteriormente esta era de plástico en su totalidad y poco a poco la ha terminado de construir con piedra cantera y ladrillo de barro dándole mayor seguridad y protección a su familia.
Este crédito lo solicita para terminar de construir una pared que todavía la vivienda  está cerrada con plástico donde él se ahorraría la mano de obra  por ser albañil.
Su  familia  la cual esta agradecida con ceprodel por tener una hogar más seguro donde vivir
texts.en:
Florencio works as a bricklayer in this town. Thanks to loans from Ceprodel he has managed to make improvements to his house, which used to be made totally of plastic. Bit by bit he has finished building it with stone and adobe thus providing increased security and protection to his family. The loan will be used to finish building a wall where the dwelling is still closed with plastic. He will save on labor costs since he's a bricklayer. His family is very grateful to Ceprodel for helping to provide a home in which to live that is safer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.
